loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is a 44-year-old married woman with four children, two of whom who are currently in school.

A very hard-working entrepreneur, Josephine has a business making native bags in the Philippines. She has been in this business for five years. She requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more raw materials for her business.

In the future, Josephine would like to save enough money so that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more raw materials for her business

loans.name: Euliza

texts.en:
Euliza is 48 years old and married with one child. She works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a restaurant business in the Philippines and requested a 14,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan through NWTF to buy additional ingredients like meat, fish, vegetables, etc

Euliza has been in this business for 10 years.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional ingredients like meat, fish, vegetables, etc

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en:
Samuel, who is a member of NWTF, supports his family through his business in which he raises livestock in the Philippines. His daughter, Sholie, is 18 years old and is the youngest of four children in the family. She is studying for a Bachelor of Science in Criminology and is currently in the second year of this four-year course.

Samuel is borrowing PHP 8,350 to pay for tuition fees for the first semester of the 2014-15 school year. When she graduates, Sholie wants to help her parents to improve their way of living.

loans.use: to pay his daughter's tuition fees

loans.name: Fatima

texts.en:
Fatima is a 37-year-old married woman with three children, who are all in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Fatima's house was destroyed by super typhoon Haiyan which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013. She has restarted her general store business and is committed to regain what she lost. Fatima is taking out a PHP 8,270 housing loan through NWTF in order to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor to build her a house for her family.

Fatima has been with NWTF since 2012 in her pursuit to rise out of poverty. With your help, she will be able to start once more in a new home. In the future, Fatima would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

loans.name: Gracelyn

texts.en:
Gracenie, who is a daughter of Gracelyn (a member of NWTF), is 21 years old and is the third of four children in the family. 

Gracelyn is borrowing PHP 7,000 to pay for Gracenie's tuition fees of the first semester of the school year 2014-2015.

Gracenie is currently in the fourth year of her four year Bachelor of Science in Business Administration course.

When she graduates, Gracenie plans to help her parents in the future.

loans.use: to pay for tuition fees.

loans.name: Beverly

texts.en:
Beverly is 48 years old and married with four children.

Beverly works hard to provide for her family. She has a motorcycle transportation business in the Philippines and requested a 50,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan through NWTF in order to buy spare parts for her motorcycle and groceries for her store.

Beverly has borrowed and repaid six loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for ten years and also earns an income from a rice retailing businesses.

Beverly aspires to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for her motorcycle and groceries for her store.

loans.name: Phoibe

texts.en: Phoibe is age 65. She is married and has been in the business for the past 18 years. She wants the loan to buy more sorghum to sell. She will use the profits to pay school fees for her children and to make savings from the remaining.

loans.use: to buy more sorghum to sell.

loans.name: Dzame

texts.en:
Dzame is a widow with three children, all of whom completed school. She lives at her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

She has operated milk-selling business, supplying milk from home to her neighbors and passersby. Her potential customers are neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. Dzame dreams of establishing a wholesale business in the future. With the loan that she is requesting of KES 30,000, she wants to purchase milk to sell. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase milk to sell.

loans.name: Mwanapili

texts.en:
Mwanapili is a mother of nine children who attend school. She owns a house that has electricity and piped water.

She sells maize, fruits and green vegetables. She always struggles to improve her grocery stall, trying to sell more, and save money in order to have a more formal establishment.  Mwanapili is requesting a loan to buy sacks of fruit and green vegetables to sell.

loans.use: to buy sacks of fruit and green vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Julie

texts.es: Miscelanea y modisteria son los dos negocios que tiene Julie desde hace 6 años. Ella inició su negocio apoyada por su esposo quien es comerciante y viaja a otros paises y trae mercancia variada para venderla y tambien recibió el apoyo de su suegra quien es una confeccionista de vestidos y en lencería. Julie trabajaba en un almacen y logró aprender mucho del mercado de ropa y con los tres enfoques ha logrado fortalecer sus negocios. en su punto comercial sus clientes encuentran desde útiles escolares hasta productos de confección y articulos de lencería , multiusos etc.  Sus ventas las realiza de contado todos los dias, trabajando  desde las 8 dela mañana hasta las 12 del medio dia y desde las 2  hasta las 6 de la tarde. Sus metas mas adelante es formalizar su negocio adecuar su infraestructura comprando muebles, y enseres , además de terminar de adecuar su apartamento para lograr un mayor bienestar. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiemito que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará útiles escolares, articulos de modistería, piñateria para incrementar su inventario y hacer sus mejores ofertas al público y lograr así que su credikiva sea una inversión exitosa.
texts.en: Dressmaking and a convenience store have been Julie's two businesses for the past 6 years. She started her businesses with the support of her husband, who is a business man and travels to other countries to bring different types of merchandise to sell. She also received the support of her mother-in-law, who makes dresses and lingerie. Julie worked at a store and was able to learn a lot about the clothing market and with the three points of view has been able to strengthen her businesses. At her store, customers find everything from school supplies to dressmaking products, lingerie, multipurpose items, etc. She sells in cash only and works everyday from 8:00 a.m. until noon and from 2:00 until 6:00 p.m. Her goals going forward are to formalize her business, improve its infrastructure by purchasing furniture and essentials, and to improve her apartment to assure her well-being. She is currently applying for a Kiva loan -- her first one through the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation. With this loan, she will buy school supplies, dressmaking products, and children's materials to increase her inventory and have better offers for her customers. This way, her Kiva loan will be a successful investment.

loans.use: to buy school supplies, dressmaking materials,  children's items.

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en:
Emmanuel is 25 years old.  He is married and his wife is a business lady. He sells local beers and has been working for six years. 

With the loan, he would like to buy more sorghum for use in making local beers to sell. The profits from the business will be used to buy provide food for the family.

loans.use: To buy more sorghum to use in making local beers to sell.

loans.name: Devota

texts.en:
Devota is 34 years old. She is married and her husband is a businessman. She owns a boutique which she has been running for the past eight years. 

With the loan, she would like to buy more cooking oil and jerrycans to sell. The profits from the business will be used for food for the family.

loans.use: To buy more retail items, such as cooking oil and jerrycans.

loans.name: Susanna

texts.en: Susanna lives in Qarahunj village with her husband and 20-year-old daughter.  Susanna is specialized in husbandry keeping. Specifically she keeps cows, calves, sheep and chickens. Susanna also does some limited cultivation of wheat and barley. As her farming business has begun to grow, Susanna would like to increase her livestock with two more cows and forage for feeding them. That's the reason Susanna has applied for this loan of USD 3,000. Please help her to enlarge her farm and gather higher income for her family.

loans.use: to pay for two cows and forage for feeding the livestock.

loans.name: Anzhela

texts.en:
Anzhela lives in Verishen village with her parents, two sisters and brother. The whole family has been involved in husbandry keeping. They keep 14 cows, 32 calves and 30 sheep, as well as cultivate some grass as forage for the livestock. 

Anzhela is requesting this loan of USD 3,000 to purchase 2 more cows and make previous credit repayments. The loan will greatly help Anzhela and her family to enlarge their agribusiness and improve their living.

loans.use: to pay for two cows and make previous credit repayments.

loans.name: Mwanajuma

texts.en:
Mwanajuma is the mother of six children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has electricity and piped water.

She sells maize, fruits and green vegetables. She always struggles to improve her grocery stall, trying to sell more and save money in order to have a more formal establishment. 

Mwanajuma is requesting a loan to buy sacks of fruits and green vegetables for resale.

loans.use: to buy sacks of fruits and green vegetables for resale.

loans.name: Ricardo Antonio

texts.es:
Ricardo, es un hombre que se preocupa mucho por mantenerse trabajando para dar a su familia lo necesario para subsistir, es acompañado, vive con su compañera de vida y tres hijos, de los cuales uno está estudiando nivel superior y los demás educación media; posee un foto estudio, aprendió el oficio como ayudante, luego se independizo como fotógrafo con grandes esfuerzos y poco a poco logro establecerlo, ya tiene 15 años de contar con su negocio. 
Comprará papel fotográfico, rollos, cintas, cuadros, etc., contara con todo lo necesario para seguir trabajando, cumplirá con los trabajos pendientes de fotografías y filmaciones, espera aumentar la popularidad de su negocio, tener mayores ingresos para cumplir con todas sus obligaciones.
Su visión mejorar su situación económica para ampliar su hogar, modernizar su equipo de trabajo y seguir apoyando a sus hijos en la educación
texts.en:
Ricardo is a man who worries a lot about continuing to work in order to give his family what is necessary to live. He is married. He lives with his life companion and their three children, of whom one is studying at the university and the others are in high school. He has his own photo studio. He learned this trade as an assistant, then with great effort he became independent as a photographer, and little by little he managed to establish his business. He has already had his business for 15 years.

He will buy photographic paper, film, tapes, frames, etc. He will have everything necessary to continue working. He will complete the pending work of photographs and films. He hopes to increase the popularity of his business and to have greater income to meet all his obligations. His vision is to improve his economic situation to enlarge his house, modernize his working equipment, and continue supporting his children in their education.

loans.use: to buy photographic paper, camera film, tapes, frames, etc., so that he will have everything necessary to continue working.

loans.name: Baisalbek

texts.ru: Байсалбеку 41 год, женат, имеет среднее образование, многодетный отец 5 детей. В течении долгого времени Байсалбек занимается разведением скота и полеводством. Начав свой бизнес со стартовой суммой 3,000 сом (KGS), Байсалбек приложил все усилия для развития своего бизнеса, на сегодняшний день у него есть 5 коров, 7 овец, земельный участок, на котором он выращивает кукурузу, клевер, картофель, овощи, а также есть парник для выращивания саженцев. Для дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Байсалбек обратился в Банк «Бай – Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на покупку телят и овец с целью откорма и реализации. В будущем, Байсалбек планирует расширять поголовье скота и сделать дома ремонт.
texts.en: Baisalbek is 41 years old and married with five children.  He has a high school education and for a long time, he has been raising livestock and growing crops.  He started his business with the sum of 3,000 som (KGS) and through putting his all into developing his enterprise, he now has five cows, seven sheep and a plot of land on which he grows corn, clover, potatoes, vegetables, and he also has a greenhouse for seedlings.  In order to develop his business further, Baisalbek has turned to Bai Tushum Bank for a loan of 100,000 som (KGS) to buy calves and sheep to fatten up and resell.  In the future, Baisalbek plans to further increase his head of livestock and to make repairs on his home.

loans.use: to buy calves and sheep to fatten up and resell so he can increase his profitability and make repairs on his home

loans.name: Maria

texts.es: Con 63 años de edad Maria es una señora muy responsable y trabajadora, comenta María que  se dedica a criar ganado desde que era muy joven, así que le va bien en este negocio ya que ella tiene sus vacas y por medio de la venta de la leche es como se ayuda económicamente, Maria  tiene 4 hijos que ya son mayores de edad y que ya trabajan,  Maria vive con su esposo,  su hijo, nuera y 2 nietos, con el crédito va a comprar una vaca para salir adelante y por medio de este negocio aspira apoyarse en los gastos diarios para su familia.
texts.en: At 63 years old, María is a responsible and hard-working woman. María says that she has been making a living raising cattle since she was very young. Her business is going well as she has cows and, through milk sales, she earns a living. María has four adult children who now all work. María lives with her husband and son, daughter-in-law and two grandchildren. María will use this loan to buy another cow to increase her sales and progress in life.

loans.use: to buy a cow to increase milk sales

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more cashew nuts to expand her business.

loans.name: Juan Rodrigo

texts.es:
Juan es un joven muy emprendedor y solidario, en todo lo que hace siempre tiene en su mente a su madre quien fue la que le dio todo para su crianza.

Trabaja como operario agrícola en una empresa del municipio de El Carmen De Viboral, pero por otro lado realiza contratos independientes en el oficio de la jardinería y arreglo de plantas.

Esto lo aprendió de su padre quien le enseño el oficio y lo capacito desde muy niño.

El solicita un préstamo para comprar algunas herramientas de jardinería como tijeras de podar, guantes y otros elementos.

Con este préstamo podrá continuar con su actividad de una manera mas cómoda y rápida, además tendrá la oportunidad de crecer en su negocio consiguiendo más contratos.
texts.en:
Juan is a very enterprising and caring young man.  In everything he does he's always thinking about his mother, who gave him everything for his upbringing.

He works as an agricultural worker in a company in the town of El Carmen de Viboral.  He also does independent work in gardening and landscape design.  He learned this from his father, who taught him the trade and trained him from a very young age.

Juan's requesting a loan to buy pruning shears, gloves, and some other gardening tools.  With this loan he'll be able to keep on working more comfortably and quickly.  He'll also have the opportunity to get more contracts and grow in his business.

loans.use: to buy pruning shears, gloves, and other gardening tools

loans.name: Blanca Leticia

texts.es:
Blanca es una joven muy emprendedora de 20 años de edad, es madre soltera, vive con sus padres y dos hermanos, Blanca estudio hasta 5° grado. 
Ahora ella es madre soltera, pero eso no le ha impedido conseguir un trabajo, ella es vendedora de teléfonos desde hace un año y medio y mientras lo hace su hermana cuida de su hijo.

El crédito lo necesita para comprar accesorios y teléfonos para revenderlos.

Su sueño es perseverar con su negocio ya que su hijo crece cada día más y no quiere que nada le falte, y a pesar de ser madre soltera y joven no se detendrá hasta cumplir sus metas.
texts.en:
Blanca, 20, is a very enterprising young woman.  She's a single mother who lives with her parents and two siblings.  Blanca studied up to fifth grade.

She's a single mother now, but that hasn't stopped her from getting a job.  She has sold telephones for a year and a half, and her sister takes care of Blanca's son while she works.

She needs the loan to buy accessories and telephones for resale.

Her dream is to persevere with her business, because her son grows more every day and she doesn't want him to need anything.  Despite being young and a single mother, she won't stop until she achieves her goals.

loans.use: to buy accessories and telephones for resale

loans.name: Luis Fernando

texts.es:
Con un sueño muy definido el cual es no trabajar para otras personas el señor Luis quien se desempeña como mayordomo en una finca en la cual tiene su propio ganado con el permiso de los propietarios, quiere solicitar un crédito para la compra de ganado y aprovechar el pasto que tiene. 

Con el crédito comprar dos terneros pequeños los cuales alimentara y criara una gran ventaja es que el señor tiene gran amor y pasión por su profesión y es muy emprendedor el crédito lo usara para obtener mejores ingresos para su núcleo familiar conformado por su esposa e hija de 8 años que actualmente está estudiando y se proyecta en un periodo de 5 años adquirir su propia finca y trabajar solo para el en sus propios terrenos.
texts.en:
Señor Luis had a very clear goal: that he didn't want to work for someone else. He is therefore the foreman of a ranch where he keeps his own herd with the owners' permission. Señor Luis is applying for a loan to purchase cattle so he can take advantage of the pasture land at the ranch.   

Señor Luis will use the funds from this loan to purchase two young calves which he will raise and feed. He has a great love and passion for ranching, and is also very industrious. This loan will help him earn higher income for his family: a wife and an eight-year-old daughter who is in school. Señor Luis plans to purchase his own ranch within five years and raise his herd only on his own land.

loans.use: to purchase cattle to raise and feed.

loans.name: Jhon Jairo

texts.es:
A sus 58 años de edad el señor Jhon lleva consigo un triste recuerdo el cual fue desprenderse de todo lo que había logrado en años pues por cuestiones de seguridad y problemas de conflicto armado tuvo que partir de su tierra natal y recalar en la ciudad.

Con mucho esfuerzo y ganas logro montar una cafetería con la que gracias a dios le ha venido yendo bien y ha tenido la manera de poder mantener a su esposa y 4 hijos que viven con él.

Ahora se encuentra con mucho entusiasmo y ganas de recuperar lo que un día logro y por esta razón solicita un crédito para remodelar su tienda pues su aspecto es muy humilde. 

Con el crédito lograra cambiar la imagen de su negocio logrando más agrado para sus clientes mejorando sus ventas pues solo tiene su tienda para mantener a su familia.

Su gran sueño es seguir adelante no dejarse derrumbar por lo que un día perdió.
texts.en:
At 58 years of age Jhon carries with him the sad memory of losing everything he had accomplished over the years. Due to security issues and problems with the armed conflict he was forced to leave his native land and ended up in the city. With a lot of effort and desire he managed to open a cafeteria where thanks to the grace of God things are going well for him and he has a means to support his wife and four children who live with him.

Now he has much enthusiasm and desire to recoup what he once had and for this reason he is requesting a loan. He wants to remodel his cafe which has a very humble appearance. With the loan he can manage to change the image of his business, making it more pleasing for his customers and increasing his sales. He only has this store to support his family. His dream is to continue to move ahead and not be knocked down by what he lost one day.

loans.use: buy materials to remodel his cafe.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more cooking oil, rice and cooking seasoning to expand her business.

loans.name: Germán Alexi

texts.es:
German tiene 32 años de edad, está por graduarse de Licenciatura en ciencias de la educación, está soltero y no tiene hijos, con él viven su madre y 3 de sus hermanos. 


German se dedica a trabajar como promotor de comunidades solidarias, lleva 3 años desempeñando esta función, él cuando salió de estudiar bachillerato siguió trabajando en el campo sembrando granos básicos, pero luego le informaron sobre el trabajo de promotor, además anteriormente trabajaba de alfabetizador de adultos. El lugar donde trabajaba le queda a 30 minutos de su casa y se desplaza a pie, lo hace en un horario de 8:00 A.M a 4:00 P.M.

  
Él necesita el crédito para pagar los gastos de su graduación en la universidad, es decir los derechos de graduación, el crédito le ayudará ya que mejorará su calidad de vida porque podrá salir graduado con un título que lo acredite o lo autorice para poder trabajar, con ello tendrá acceso a más oportunidades. 

Su sueño es terminar con sus estudios, y en seguida con su titulo optar a un puesto laboral para poder ejercer su profesión como docente, y ayudar a tener una educación para que otros puedan salir adelante con sus estudios, además pretende construir su vivienda para tener más privacidad.
texts.en:
German is 32 years old, and he is about to graduate with his degree in education.  He is single and does not have children.  He lives with his mother and three of his siblings.  German works promoting supportive communities, and he has three years of experience doing this.  When he graduated from high school, he continued working in the field planting basic grains, but he later found about about working as a promoter.  In addition, he also worked as an adult literacy teacher.

The place where he works now is about 30 minutes away from his home and he walks there.  He works from 8am to 4pm.  He is in need of this loan to pay for his college graduation fees.  The loan will help him because it will improve his quality of life since he will be able to graduate with a degree that will allow him to work.  With this, he will have access to many more opportunities.  His dreams is to finish with his education, and with his degree, so he can get a job that will allow him to work as a teacher and help others gain an education so that they can get ahead.  In addition to this, he wants to build a home so that he can have more privacy.

loans.use: pay for his college graduation fees.

loans.name: Borkor

texts.en:
Borkor lives in the Teshie, Accra. She was born in 1972, and is a single mother with one dependable child, who is in the secondary school level. 

She sells fresh roasted maize and ripe plantains on a pavement at her neighborhood. She has been working in buying and selling fresh roasted maize and ripe plantains for over six years, and she manages her business alone. 

Now Borkor would like to increase working capital, so she is asking for a loan of GHS 1,200 to buy more fresh maize and ripe plantains.

loans.use: To buy more fresh maize and ripe plantains

loans.name: José Rafael

texts.es:
José tiene 35 años de edad, estudió hasta 9° grado, dejó los estudios ya que se dedicó a trabajar junto a su padre en la agricultura y en el cuido de ganado, está soltero y de él dependen sus padres y un sobrino.


Él se dedica a la agricultura desde que era un niño, fue su padre la persona que le enseñó este rubro. a medida fue creciendo él decidió ir trabajando junto a su padre y tener su propio cultivo, también él se dedica a él cuido de ganado, actualmente su trabajo le queda cerca de su casa y el horario de trabajo es variable ya que tiene que levantarse temprano para ordeñar dos vacas y tiene que darles de comer para luego salir a trabajar en sus cultivos de maíz y frijol, en este trabajo también es apoyado por su padre ya que trabajan juntos para llevar los granos al hogar y asegurar el alimento de su familia.


El crédito lo necesita para comprar abono, herbicidas y plaguicidas para aplicarles a sus cultivos.

En un futuro él desea poder realizar mejoras a su casa y tener un ganado de una mejor raza para tener más producción y vender los derivados que extraiga, desea también formar una familia propia.
texts.en:
José is 35 years old and completed up to ninth grade at school. He left his studies in order to work in farming and looking after cattle with his father. José  is single; José's dependents are his parents and one nephew.

José  has been working in farming since he was a child; his father taught him the trade. As he grew up, José  decided to leave the work with his father and have his own crops. He also works raising cattle. José's work is close to his home. His hours are changeable; he wakes up early to milk two cows and to fed them, and then later goes out to work on his corn and bean crops. José receives support from his father. Together the two of them work to take home the grains and ensure that there is food for the family.

José needs this loan in order to buy manure, weed-killer and anti-disease treatments for his crops.

In the future José wants to be able to make improvements to his home and to have a better breed of cattle. He wants more milk from the cattle and to sell the products. José also wants to have his own family.

loans.use: to buy manure, weed-killer and anti-disease treatments for his crops.

loans.name: José Romilio

texts.es:
José tiene 41 años de edad, estudió hasta sexto grado, está acompañado y su pareja se dedica a los oficios domésticos, tiene tres hijos y son los únicos que dependen de él.



José se dedica a la siembra de granos básicos, como maíz, frijol y maicillo, cuando encuentra trabajo de ayudante de albañil también lo realiza. Él tiene alrededor de 25 años de ser jornalero y aprendió esta actividad porque sus padres eran agricultores también y lo instruyeron para que aprendiera, decidió dedicarse a ello porque lo tiene como una fuente de ingresos para la subsistencia de su familia. Siempre ha sido agricultor, el lugar de trabajo le queda a 15 minutos de sus casa y se transporta a pie, generalmente trabaja por la mañana.


Él necesita el crédito para comprar los insumos agrícolas para realizar una segunda siembra, con ello tendrá más producción, podrá vender y obtener ganancias que beneficien a su familia.


Su sueño es que sus hijos se preparen académicamente, también quiere mejorar el techo de la cocina de su casa porque está dañado.
texts.en:
José is 41 years old and has a sixth grade education.  He is married and his spouse is a homemaker.  They have three children, and they are the only people who depend on him. José works planting basic grains such as corn, beans and sorghum.  When he finds work as a masonry assistant, he also does that.  He has about 25 years of experience as a day laborer, and he learned this trade because his parents were farmers as well, and they taught him.  He decided to devote himself to this because it provides a source of income for his family.  He has always been a farmer.  His work site is about 15 minutes away from his home and he walks there.  He usually works in the morning.

He is in need of this loan to purchase agricultural supplies for a second planting.  This will allow him to increase his harvest yield so that he can sell it and generate earnings for his family.  His dream is for his children to get an education.  He also wants to repair the roof over the kitchen in his house because it is in need of repair.

loans.use: purchase agricultural supplies for a second planting that will increase his yield so that he can sell and earn an income for his family.

loans.name: Onua Do Group

texts.en:
These members are part of the group called Onua Do and they live in the same neighborhood. The group is composed of two women who have been active for several years and who have come together to benefit from financial support enabling them to bolster their revenue-generating businesses. 

Agnes is the group’s representative. She is active in selling yams, rice, cooking oil, chicken, fresh fish etc. She has over 10 years of experience. The loan will be used to purchase yams, rice, cooking oil, chicken, fresh fish etc. These items are sold to customers on a pavement near her residence. She supports her husband in covering the household expenses. Her future plans include building her own house.

loans.use: To purchase yams, rice, cooking oil, chicken, and fresh fish to sell

loans.name: Blanca Nelly

texts.es:
Blanca tiene 37 años de edad, se dedica a los oficios del hogar desde que era una niña, estudió hasta 3° grado ya que sus padres por ser de escasos recursos no pudieron apoyarla, está casada y su esposo se dedica a los oficios del hogar, con él han procreado 3 hijos el primero tiene 20 años estudia bachillerato pero solo los fines de semana ya que de lunes a viernes trabaja, la segunda tiene 18 años ella estudia 3° año de bachillerato y el último tiene 16 años y está estudiando 9° grado, de ella solo dependen sus hijos y esposo. 


Ella se dedica a los oficios del hogar desde que era una niña, fue su madre quien le enseñó, también ella puede trabajar la tierra cultivando maíz y frijol, esto lo aprendió de su padre, así como el cuido de ganado y el comercio del mismo, ella es una persona muy trabajadora y responsable en los trabajos que realiza así como en el cuido de su familia, ella trabaja desde en la mañana hasta que anochece.

El crédito lo necesita para comprar dos vacas las cuales son de una buena raza lechera y se las venden a un precio, ella quiere aprovechar la oportunidad de comprarlas y darles el pasto suficiente para que al momento que las vendan pueda tener buena ganancia.

Ella sueña con ver a sus hijos graduarse de una carrera universitaria para que tengan una mejor calidad de vida comparada con la que ella tuvo en su niñez, desea que sean personas de bien con un trabajo estable y buenos ingresos de dinero, ella desea tener las fuerzas para continuar trabajando y cumplir sus planes que son de hacer su casa más grande y tener mejores condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Blanca is 37 years old and has done housework since she was a child. She studied up to grade 3 only, as with the limited resources of her parents, they could not support her. She is married and her husband works doing housework. They have three children, the oldest being 20 years old. He is studying in secondary school but only on weekends as he works from Monday to Friday. The second is 18 and she is in her third year of high school. The youngest as 16 and is in Grade 9. Only her children and husband are dependent on her.

Blanca has worked doing housework since she was a child, her mother taught her. She also works in the fields growing corn and beans, which her father taught her. She also raises and sells livestock. She is very hard-working and responsible in the work she is doing and in caring for the family. She works from morning to night.

Blanca needs the loan to buy two cows which are of good milking race which are being sold at a good price. She wants to take advantage of the opportunity to buy them and feed them lots of grass so when she goes to sell them she will realize a good profit.

She dreams of seeing her children graduate from university and have a better quality of life to what she had as a child. She hopes they become good people with stable employment and good income. She hopes to have the strength to continue to work and fulfil her plans which are to make improvements on her house and enjoy better living conditions.

loans.use: to buy two cows.

loans.name: Elías

texts.es:
Elías tiene 23 años de edad, estudió hasta 6° grado, dejó los estudios ya que se dedicó a trabajar junto a su padre en la agricultura, está soltero y de él dependen sus padres y su hermana menor.



Él se dedica a la agricultura desde que era un niño, fue su padre la persona que le enseñó este rubro, a medida fue creciendo el decidió ir trabajando y tener su propio cultivo, también él se dedica a trabajar en una panadería en la cual es vendedor rutero, en este trabajo inicia a laborar en la madrugada y termina su ruta al mediodía, así que por la tarde tiene que dedicarle a realizar el trabajo de agricultor, sus cultivos están cerca de su casa y solo tiene que caminar durante 10 minutos para llegar a ellos, en esto es apoyado por su padre y un hermano ya que es un trabajo de familia el cual es muy bien aprovechado por ellos.


El crédito lo necesita para comprar abono, herbicidas y plaguicidas para aplicarles a sus cultivos ya que quiere tener todo listo para la hora de la aplicación.

En un futuro él desea realizar mejoras a su casa, desea también formar una familia propia, procrear hijos y guiarlos por un buen camino, enseñarles a trabajar muy duro para que ellos puedan desempeñarse en la comunidad, también desea empezar poco a poco un negocio de venta de pan artesanal el cual será hecho por su madre y hermana y venderlo en la comunidad.
texts.en:
Elias, 23, has a 6th grade education.  He left school because he decided to work with his father in agriculture.  He is single, and his parents and younger sister depend upon him for support. 

Elias has been a farmer ever since he was a child.  His father taught him to farm, and as he grew up he decided to continue to work in agriculture and have his own fields.  In addition, he works for a bakery distributing their products on an established route.  In this job he starts working at dawn and finishes his route by noon.  This way he can devote the afternoons to his farming work.  His crops are near his house; he only has to walk about 10 minutes to get to there.  In his farming, he is supported by his father and a brother, because this is a family enterprise from which they all benefit.

Elias needs this loan to buy organic fertilizers, herbicides, and pesticides to apply to his crops, because he wants to have everything ready when it is time to use them.  In the future, he wants to carry out some home improvement projects, form a family, have children and guide them on the right track.  He will teach them to work very hard so that they can function in the community.  In addition, he wants to gradually start up a business selling handmade bread made by his mother and sister in the community.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, herbicide and pesticide

loans.name: Rhoda Ephraim

texts.en: Rhoda Ephraim is a 35-year-old farmer from Gunda.  As a Babban Gona member, Rhoda Ephraim is excited about the opportunity to finally have access to credit, good markets and a trained agronomist. Like all Babban Gona members, Rhoda Ephraim can earn up to $2000/ha this season from growing maize, more than three times the Nigerian farmer’s average annual income. The average Babban Gona farmer yields 30 bags/hectare; double the national average of 14. However, Rhoda Ephraim is ambitious and is hoping that as a result of this loan, she will be able to acces quality inputs such as fertilizer and improved seeds that will  result in a yield of at least 35 bags of maize per hectare this season. Rhoda Ephraim is hopeful about what the future holds; she  hopes that with the increased income as a result of a high yield, she will finally be able to afford to educate her children. Rhoda Ephraim’s dreams do not end here: “ultimately, I want to ensure my children are educated and have access to professional jobs”, she said.

loans.use: To access high quality inputs such as fertilizer and seed in order to double income and yield

loans.name: Tasiu

texts.en: Tasiu is a maize farmer from Gunda. Tasiu expressed that he is driven by one goal: to “become the most profitable farmer in my community.” It is the desire to fulfil this ambition that led Tasiu to join Babban Gona. Now, as a Babban Gona member, he finally has the opportunity to access credit, good markets and a trained agronomist. Like all Babban Gona members, Tasiu can earn up to $2000/ha this season from growing maize, more than three times the Nigerian farmer’s average annual income. The average Babban Gona farmer yields 30 bags of maize/hectare, double the national average of 14. However, Tasiu is ambitious and is aiming to reap 35 bags per hectare this season. By doing so, Tasiu will finally have enough money to make significant life changes. When asked what he plans to do with his income from this season, he said: “I plan to use the money I make to expand my farmland”. With this loan, Tasiu will be able to access all the inputs and services to make this dream a reality.

loans.use: To access high-quality inputs such as fertilizer and seed in order to double income and yield.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase a solar home system that will substitute the use of batteries and fuel.

Lado is hopeful about what the future holds; he  hopes that with the increased income as a result of a high yield, he will finally be able to afford to educate his children: Shitu  and Hafisu. Lado’s dreams do not end there: “ultimately, I want to ensure my children are educated and have professional jobs”, he expressed.

loans.use: To purchase high-quality inputs in order to double maize yield and income

loans.name: Ibrahim

texts.en: Ibrahim is a Babban Gona farmer from Hanaaiki. Ibrahim is driven by one goal: to “become the most profitable farmer in my community.” It is this ambition that led Ibrahim to join Babban Gona. Now, as a Babban Gona member, he finally has the opportunity to access credit, good markets and a trained agronomist. Like all Babban Gona members, Ibrahim can earn up to $2000/ha this season from growing maize, more than three times the average Nigerian farmer’s annual income. The average Babban Gona farmer yields 30 bags/hectare; double the national average of 14. However, Ibrahim is ambitious and is aiming to reap at least 58 bags per hectare this season because with this loan, he will finally be able to access the required yield enhancing inputs such as improved seeds. Ibrahim is hoping that as a result of this expected yield, he will finally have enough money to make significant life changes. When asked what changes he would like to make, he said “I plan to use the money I make to build a better home.  Ultimately, I want to become the most profitable farmer in my community.” With this loan, Ibrahim will be able to access all the inputs and services to make these dreams reality.

loans.use: To access high-quality inputs such as fertilizer and seed in order to double income and yield.

loans.name: Murtala

texts.en: Murtala is a maize farmer and member of Babban Gona. Murtala joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for hischildren: Sunusi, Zailani,  and  Faiza. Murtala is excited that Babban Gona offers a lasting solution to ending the cycle of poverty. For the first time, Murtala will have access to quality inputs such as fertilizer and seed. Without this loan, he would  be subjected to buying these products in the open market where the products are not only very expensive, but are often diluted with external products like sand. With access to high quality inputs, Murtala can reap up to 30 bags/hectare, double the national average of 14  and  earn up to $2000/ha, more than three times the average Nigerian farmer’s annual income.  When asked, Murtala said “I plan to use the money I make this year to provide more food and clothing for my family. Murtala is not thinking about just this year; he said, “in 5 years, I want to become the  most profitable farmer in my community.”

loans.use: To access high-quality inputs such as fertilizer and seed in order to double income and yield.

loans.name: Carlos Saul

texts.es:
Carlos vive en Puente Piedra, distrito de Lima, capital del Perú, junto a sus padres y sus tres hermanos, un menor, aun en edad escolar y su hermana, que como el también esta estudiando. Sus padres trabajan muy duro para poder sacar adelante a sus 3 hijos, su madre vende fruta en un mercado y su padre vende pan en un triciclo de manera ambulante desde muy temprano. El dinero no alcanza para costear los estudios de todos, por lo que Carlos, al ser el hijo varón mayor, tendría que dejar sus estudios y empezar a trabajar de no contar con el apoyo de los prestamistas de Kiva.
La pensión que pagaba por su carrera se duplico al pasar a su tercer ciclo de estudios por lo que a sus padres les es imposible seguirlo apoyando, es por esto que les pide su apoyo a los prestamistas de Kiva ya que al acceder al beneficio que prestan, el podría pagar la cuota que se le asignaría por el mismo y así podría seguir estudiando sin inconvenientes.
El agradece la oportunidad y la ayuda que le dan los prestamistas de Kiva y considera su labor como muy importante para el desarrollo de la educación en los países en vías de desarrollo.
El desea terminar su carrera y ganar experiencia trabajando en alguna imprenta para en un futuro poder poner su propio negocio para así ayudar a sus padres y a su hermano menor para que también se logre como profesional.
texts.en:
Carlos lives in the Puente Piedra district of Lima, the capital of Peru.  He lives with his parents and the three siblings: one younger one, who's still of school age, and his sister, who like him also attends school.  His parents work very hard to be able to get their three children ahead.  His mother sells fruit in a market and his father sells bread as a street vendor on a tricycle, starting at a very early hour.

There's not enough money to pay for everyone's studies, so Carlos, as the oldest male, would have to stop going to school and start working if he didn't have the help of Kiva lenders.

The amount he was paying for his program doubled when he entered the third year of studies, and it's impossible for his parents to continue to support him.  This is why he's requesting the support of Kiva lenders, because upon gaining access to what they're lending, he would be able to pay his fees and continue going to school without any problems.

He's grateful for the opportunity and the help of Kiva lenders.  He thinks his work is very important for the growth of education in developing countries.

He wants to finish his program and get experience working in some print shop so in the future he can set up his own business.  That way he'll help his parents and help his younger brother to become a professional, too.

loans.use: to be able to continue studying

loans.name: Samaila

texts.en: Samaila is a Babban Gona farmer from Gunda. Samaila expressed that he is driven by one goal: to “ensure my children are educated and have professional jobs.” It is the desire to fulfil this ambition that led Samaila to join Babban Gona. Now, as a Babban Gona member, he finally has the opportunity to access credit, good markets and a trained agronomist. With this loan, Samaila will be able to access all the inputs and services to make this dream a reality.

loans.use: To access high-quality inputs such as fertilizer and seed in order to double income and yield.

loans.name: Sabita

texts.en:
Sabita is a 32-year-old woman who lives in Nandakumarpur village, West Bengal. She is married and has two children; both are studying in fifth and first grade respectively. She works as a maid servant, and her husband is an auto driver. The family's income is not adequate to meet the family’s requirements. 

Two months back, her husband met with an accident and was injured; he has not yet recovered completely. 

Sabita wants a loan of INR 25,000 for her husband’s treatment. She hopes that her husband recovers completely and has good health.

loans.use: to pay for her husband’s treatment.

loans.name: Adamu

texts.en:
Adamu is a maize farmer from Furana.  As a Babban Gona member, Adamu is excited about the opportunity to finally access credit, good markets and a trained agronomist.  Like all Babban Gona members, Adamu can earn up to $2000/hectare this season from his farm, more than three times the average Nigerian farmer’s annual income.
With access to high-quality inputs such as fertilizer and seed, Adamu can reap up to 30 bags of maize per hectare this season, double the national average of 14. When asked how he plans to spend the income he will make as a Babban Gona member, he said, “I plan to use the money I make to expand my farmland, and in 5 years, I would like to be the most profitable farmer in my community." With this loan, Adamu is well on his way to achieving these goals.

loans.use: To access high quality inputs such as fertilizer and seed in order to double income and yield

loans.name: Rabiu

texts.en:
Rabiu remembers feeling depressed during a particularly bad harvest. This was before she became a Babban Gona Member. Now, Rabiu, like all Babban Gona members, she can earn up to $2000/ha this season from growing maize, more than three times the Nigerian farmer’s annual income. 
With access to high-quality inputs such as fertilizer and urea, Rabiu can reap up to 30 bags/hectare, double the national average of 14. “In 5 years, I want to become the most profitable farmer in my community”, expressed Rabiu.  With this loan, Rabiu is well on her way to achieving this dream.

loans.use: To access high-quality inputs such as fertilizer and seed in order to double income and yield.

loans.name: Alh. Sale

texts.en:
Alh. Sale is a maize farmer from Furana. As a Babban Gona member, Alh. Sale is excited about the opportunity to finally access credit, good markets and a trained agronomist.  Like all Babban Gona members, Alh. Sale can earn up to $2000/hectare this season from his farm, more than three times the average Nigerian farmer’s annual income.
With access to high-quality inputs such as fertilizer and seed, Alh. Sale can reap up to 30 bags of maize per hectare this season, double the national average of 14. When asked how he plans to spend the income he will make as a Babban Gona member, he said, “I plan to use the money I make to expand my farmland, and in 5 years, I would like to be the most profitable farmer in my community." With this loan, Alh.Sale is well on his way to achieving these goals.

loans.use: To access high quality inputs such as fertilizer and seed in order to double income and yield

loans.name: Pool Jhon

texts.es:
Pool nació en Maynas, provincia de Iquitos, selva del Perú, y vino a Lima en busca de mejores oportunidades para poder estudiar y llegar a ser profesional.
El vive actualmente en Lima junto a su hermana y su esposo, quienes se han hecho cargo de su educación y manutención, ya que sus padres aun viven en su tierra natal y no están en la capacidad económica de ayudarlo económicamente.
Su hermana es ama de casa y su cuñado tiene una pequeña librería, ellos ademas tienen un pequeño hijo y los gastos por este ultimo hacen muy difícil el pago de los estudios de Pool, por lo que este tendría que dejar de estudiar de no contar con el apoyo de los prestamistas de Kiva para poder manejar una cuota mas accesible y así seguir costeando su carrera.
El Perú es un país exportador de productos textiles en ascenso y Pool quiere ser parte de esto, trabajando mucho para ello después de culminar sus estudios en mecánica textil. El tiene el sueño de convertirse en su propio jefe, confeccionando nuevos modelos en telas y fibras y comercializarlas en el mercado interno y externo.
Es por esto que esta muy agradecido con todo el apoyo que puedan brindarle los prestamistas de Kiva y desde ya les quiere decir que estudiara muy duro y que no fallara en sus pagos, ya que entiende que así como a el, los prestamistas de Kiva ayudan a muchos jóvenes por lo que el cumplir con los pagos es ayudar a otros a como Pool quieren cumplir sus sueños
texts.en:
Pool was born in the Maynas province of Iquitos, in the jungles of Peru. He came to Lima in search of better opportunities to study and become a professional.
He currently lives in Lima with his sister and her husband who have taken charge of his education and maintenance since his parents still live in their homeland and are not economically capable of helping financially.
His sister is a household and her husband has a small bookstore. They have a young son which makes it difficult for them to pay for Pool's studies. He would have to leave school if he did not have the support of Kiva lenders to help him obtain a more affordable tuition so he can continue to afford his education.
Peru is a rising exporter of textiles and Pool wants to be part of this. He is working hard to complete his studies in textile mechanics. He has the dream of becoming his own boss, preparing new models in fibers and fabrics in order to sell them in domestic and foreign markets.
This is why he is very grateful to all the support given by Kiva lenders. He already wants to tell them that he will study hard and not fail in his payments as she understands that the Kiva lenders help many young people and by meeting his payments he is helping others like Pool as they try to complete their dreams.

loans.use: to pay tuition

loans.name: Genius Group

texts.en:
Julia is a member of the Genius Group based in Glen Norah Township in Harare. Julia started getting into business in the year 1999, doing sewing. She was supplying protective clothing to mines and school uniforms in rural areas. She met some challenges as her customers where short changing her and not paying in time. Also that is when her husband became unemployed and she became the bread winner in the family. She was then sponsored by an uncle in Australia to start a poultry business, which is her current business.
She then heard about Thrive Microfinance and they helped her grow her poultry business from 100 chickens at a time to 150 in continuous batches, one after the other. She is also planning to go back to her first business of sewing as she has people placing orders. As a breadwinner the growth of business has enabled her to give her two children quality education, of which her first born is now at university. She also has dreams of opening a formal shop for her businesses and getting a car for easier transportation of her wares.

loans.use: to purchase cloth and other materials so that she can return to tailoring in addition to poultry production.

loans.name: Norma Yolanda

texts.en: Norma lives in a community in the Department of Intibucá Honduras. She is a farmer (coffee and corn). She is 39 years old and lives with her husband and four children. Her husband is a farmer too, they work together. It is clear that Norma works hard to maintain her family and at night, after a hard day of work, the conditions in the house are not very good due to the lack of electricity. They currently illuminate their home with kerosene lamps because the electrical utility grid does not reach this rural area. The family wishes to spend more time together, extending the light hours and quality time. She hopes improve the education of her children because they will be able to do their homework with better lighting. Norma is requesting a loan to purchase a complete solar electric system from Soluz Honduras.

loans.use: to purchase a solar home system to substitute the use of kerosene lamps and firewood, in order to reduce expenses and improve the family economy and health

loans.name: Dixenia Esmeralda

texts.es:
Dixenia tiene 36 años de edad, es madre soltera de cuatro hijos ya que su esposo la abandonó y ahora no la apoya con la manutención de sus hijos, ella estudió hasta sexto grado ya que era la mayor de sus hermanos y tuvo que apoyar en el hogar.	

   
Dixenia se dedica a vender frutas, verduras y también mariscos en su comunidad, ya tiene 10 años realizando esta actividad que es tan beneficiosa para ella y además es la única fuente de ingresos para su familia, la mercadería una parte la tiene en su casa y el resto sale a venderla a las casas de la comunidad, además apoya a su hermana a trabajar en un chalet de comida que es un ingreso extra para Dixenia.
 
Ella necesita el crédito para invertir en su negocio, comprará mas frutas, verduras y mariscos, y de esta manera ir incrementando el negocio.
 	
Ella planea tener una cuenta de ahorro para cualquier situación que se le presente a su familia, ampliar el negocio, mejorar su vivienda y que sus hijos sigan estudiando para que sean personas de bien en la sociedad.
texts.en:
Dixenia is 36 years old.  She has four childrenf, and is a single mother now that her husband has abandoned her and does not help support the children.  She studied through sixth grade only, since she was the oldest among her brothers and sister and had to help support the household.

Dixenia earns a living selling fruit, vegetables and also shellfish in her community.   She has been doing this work for 10 years, which has been of great benefit to her, and this business is the only source of income for her family.  She keeps some merchandise in her house and goes out to sell the rest at various houses in the community.  She also supports her brother in working at a food truck, which provides Dixenia with extra income.

Dixenia needs the loan to invest in her business.  She will buy more fruit, vegetables and shellfish and thus grow her business.  She plans to have a savings account to provide for any family need that may arise, and also will broaden her business and improve her living place.  Dixenia plans for her children to stay in school so that they will be good people, contributing to society.

loans.use: to make her business grow by buying more fruit, vegetables and shellfish to sell

loans.name: Annonciate

texts.en:
Annonciate is aged 43. She is married to a businessman. She has sold logs and timber for many years. 

With the loan, she would like to add more types of timber, such as libuyu, and logs to sell. The profits from the business will be used to pay for school fees for the children.

loans.use: To buy more timber and logs

loans.name: Xinia

texts.es: Xinia,tiene la edad  de 52 años, está casada, vive con el esposo y tres hijos que son su mayor prioridad. Con su crédito pretende hacer la compra de dos novillas, con el objetivo que dentro de un tiempo crescan y puedan reproducirse y poder poco a poco aumentar el numero de animales.Ella espera poder crecer con el negocio  y así mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia y también invertir un poco más en el área de cultivo y también cumplir algunas metas.  Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. Élla no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Xinia is 52 years old, married, and lives with her husband and three children, who are her first priority.  With the loan, she wants to buy two young bulls, intending that with time they will grow, be able to reproduce, and then little by little her number of animals will grow.  She hopes to be able to grow with the business and thus improve her family's living conditions.  She also hopes to invest a little more in growing plants and be able to achieve her goals. 
 
This is the first loan Xinia has received from FUDECOSUR.  She has not had other loans from state banks.  FUDECOSUR has offered her the loan with better payment plans and a much lower rate of interest.

loans.use: to buy cattle

location.town: Bello Oriente, Agua Buena, Coto Brus

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase cigarettes, pure water and biscuits to expand her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase cigarettes, pure water and biscuits to expand her business.

loans.name: Marie Dite Jacqueline

texts.en:
Marie Dite Jacqueline has had her own ​​retail store for over 10 years by selling food in her locality. 

Now she's interested in selling EnejiPwop products (energy products) because her locality was out of electricity for a few years. 

For that, a loan is recommended for her to buy the products and sell them in her community.

loans.use: to purchase EnejiPwop stock to sell in her locality

loans.name: Ana Marlene

texts.es: Ana vive en casa propia con su familia, desde hace varios años se dedica a la venta de ganchos, diademas, colas, etc todo para el cabello asi como muestra en la fotografía, esta ubicada en el mercado que se encuentra cerca de la casa, tiene mucha clientela por ser una zona muy transitada,  Ana logra solventar algunos gastos que se le presentan en su hogar, ella esta solicitando un credito para la compra de mas mercadería por mayor ya que esa es su única fuente de trabajo y asi poder tener junto con su familia una mejor estabilidad económica.
texts.en:
Ana lives in her own home with her family. For many years she has made a living selling hair clips, head bands, scrunchies, etc everything for hair, as she shows in her photograph. She is located in the market place found near her home. She has many customers since the area is well traveled. Ana manages to cover some of her household costs.

She is requesting this loan to buy more merchandise wholesale since this is her only source of work and in that way she can have improved economic stability with her family.

loans.use: to buy wholesale clips, head bands, scrunchies, etc. everything for hair.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more palm oil for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more palm oil, caustic soda and native rice for resale.

loans.name: Mario Alduvi

texts.es: Mario se dedica a la agricultura desde hace varios años siembra frijol y maíz, comercializa sus productos en los diferentes mercados, con las ventas que realiza de sus cosechas logra solventar los gastos que tiene en su hogar, es un hombre responsable, honesto y trabajador vive con su grupo familiar en casa propia. Mario está solicitando un credito para poder comprar insumos para su cosecha como: fertilizantes, abonos, semillas, herbicidas, etc. asi como los muestra en la fotografía ya que con lo que gana no le alcanza para cubrir esos gastos y asi tener mejores ingresos y tener una mejor estabilidad económica
texts.en:
Mario has been practicing agriculture for various years now, sowing beans and corn. He sells his harvests in different markets. With the sale of his crops, Mario hopes to cover his household expenses. He is a responsible, honest and hard-working man who lives with his family in their own house.

Mario is requesting a loan to be able to purchase inputs for his harvests such as fertilizers, manure, seeds, herbicides, etc., like the supplies shown in the photograph. With what he earns, he couldn't cover these expenses. With these inputs, he will enjoy a better income and greater economic stability.

loans.use: buy fertilizers, manure, seeds, herbicides, etc., for his crops.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more cooking oil, rice, and cooking seasonings to expand her business.

loans.name: Moisés

texts.es:
Moisés tiene 71 años de edad, su familia está conformada por su esposa y dos hijos y nadie mas depende de él.

 Moisés se levanta a las 5:00 a.m. para irse a las parcelas donde trabaja durante la mañana junto a sus hijos, y su esposa se dedica a los oficios domésticos, en la tarde Mosés trabaja como vigilante de una finca cerca de donde reside.

	El crédito lo necesita para comprar los insumos agrícolas como veneno, semilla, abono, etc. cuenta  con la experiencia necesaria de varios años para llegar a obtener una buena cosecha y llegar a obtener buenos ingresos para el sustento de su familia.

Sus planes en un futuro son comprar ganado y generar producción de leche con ayuda de otro crédito y con la ayuda de sus hijos.
texts.en: Moisés is 71 years old. His family consists of his wife and his two children. He has no other dependents. Moisés gets up at 5 am to go to his plots of land where he works during the morning with his children. His wife takes care of the house. In the evenings Moisés works as security on a farm close to his residence. He needs the loan to buy agricultural inputs like poison, seeds, manure, etc. He has several years experience needed to obtain a good harvest and make good money for the sustenance of his family. His future plans are to buy cattle and produce milk with the help of anther loan and the help of his sons.

loans.use: to buy agricultural inputs like poison, seeds, manure, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more used bags to expand her business

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina previously obtained a 16,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase more quantities and varieties of grocery items and products needed for her business. Her earnings were a big help for her children’s education and for their personal, household, and business expenditures.

She would like to apply for another 30,000 PHP loan for her to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages, and other products to add to her inventory. The more items displayed at the store, the better. More items to sell will result in better profits. Her profits from business will definitely help sustain her family’s daily needs and children’s education expenses. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Gina hopes that her business will continue to cover her everyday needs and that she will always be able to help her family. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week, and this is where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries, and beverages needed for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase cigarettes, pure water and biscuits to expand her business.

loans.name: Diego

texts.es: Diego, tiene la edad  de 25 años, está casado, vive con  la esposa y un  hijo que  son su mayor prioridad. Con su crédito pretende hacer la compra de  unos cerdos de engorde y el alimento para su cuido . El pretende darle la alimentacion adecuada para vender con el peso ideal y con ello octener ganancias  y poder seguir creciendo con el negocio de cerdos de engorde  y así mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia y también cumplir algunas metas.  Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. Él no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Diego is 25 years old, married, he lives with his wife and child who are his top priority.

With this loan he aims to buy several pigs to fatten and the feed to take care of them. He aims to give them enough feed to sell them at the ideal weight and thus earn income and be able to continue growing his pig fattening business and thus improve the living conditions of his family and also reach a few goals. 

This is the first loan he has received from FUDECOSUR. He hadn't had any loans before through state-owned banks, but FUDECOSUR has offered him a loan much more easily and with a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to buy pigs.

location.town: Bello Oriente, Agua Buena, Coto Brus

loans.name: María Vilma

texts.es:
María tiene 56 años de edad, nunca fue a la escuela pues sus padres nunca le dieron la importancia al estudio, es viuda  y procreó 5 hijos, 4 de ellos ya se acompañaron, solo una hija vive con ella, ademas en su casa viven 3 nietos y estudian en la escuela.


María siempre se ha dedicado a la agricultura y al trabajo en el campo, oficio que aprendió con su padre, pues siempre le dijo que aprendiera a trabajar porque eso le serviría cuando tuviera hijos, su día comienza a las 5:00 am y el lugar donde tiene la milpa está a 20 minutos de su casa y se va a pie, trabaja 5 horas y regresa a su casa por las tardes a atender a su familia y a realizar las labores del hogar.



El crédito solicitado lo necesita1 para comprar lámina para construir una casa, pues la que tiene no sirve, además comprará semilla, abono y veneno ya que sembrará una hectárea de maíz.

Sus sueños son que su última hija se prepare en una carrera universitaria, pues ella no tuvo la oportunidad.
texts.en: María is 56 years old. She never attended school as her parents did not think studying was important. She is a widow who has 5 children. Four of them are now in relationships and one daughter still lives with her. Three grandchildren also live in her house and go to school. María has always working in agriculture and in the fields, an occupation her father taught her. He always said that she should learn to work as this would be useful when she had children. Her day begins at 5 am and the place where she grows her corn is 20 minutes away from her house. She walks there, works for 5 hours and returns home in the afternoon to take care of the family and do the housework.  She needs the loan to buy laminate to build a house as the one she has is no good. She also wants to buy seeds, fertilizer and poison to grow one hectare of corn. Her dreams are for her last daughter to study at university as she never had the opportunity

loans.use: to buy laminate to build a house. She also wants to buy seeds, fertilizer and poison to plant a hectare of corn.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is a 38-year-old woman who has been in the commercial world since she was 23 years old and working as a hairdresser.

She works every day with the hope and courage to become a better businesswoman. She aspires to have her own kiosk in which she works as a hairdresser. She wants to continue investing in her business and is requesting a loan that she will invest in the purchase of wigs, perming creams, shampoo and conditioner to serve customers better.

With help from this loan, she will purchase more wigs, perming creams, shampoo and conditioner to serve customers better.

loans.use: To purchase more wigs, perming creams, shampoo and conditioner

loans.name: Rosario

texts.en:
Rosario previously accessed a 17,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase more quantities and varieties of grocery items and products needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help for their personal, household and business expenditures.

She would like to apply for another 15,000 PHP loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add to her inventory. The more items displayed at the store the better. More items to sell will result in a better profit. Her profits from the business will definitely help sustain her family’s daily needs and other expenses. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Rosario still hopes for her business to continue flourishing. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Isiyaku

texts.en: Isiyaku is a maize farmer from kadanya Biyar. Isiyaku is driven by one goal: to “become the most profitable farmer in my community.” It is this ambition that led Isiyaku to join Babban Gona. Now, as a Babban Gona member, he finally has the opportunity to access credit, good markets and a trained agronomist. Like all Babban Gona members, Isiyaku can earn up to $2000/ha this season from growing maize, more than three times the average Nigerian farmer’s annual income. The average Babban Gona farmer yields 30 bags/hectare; double the national average of 14. However, Isiyaku is ambitious and is aiming to reap at least 35 bags per hectare this season because with this loan, he will finally be able to access the required yield-enhancing inputs such as improved seeds. Isiyaku is hoping that as a result of this expected yield, he will finally have enough money to make significant life changes. When asked what changes he would like to make, he said “I plan to use the money I make to expand my farmland.” With this loan, Isiyaku will be able to make these dreams reality.

loans.use: To access high-quality inputs such as fertilizer and seed in order to double income and yield.

loans.name: Ma. Liza

texts.en:
Ma. Liza previously accessed a 30,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase more quantities and varieties of grocery items and products needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help for her children’s education, and in their personal, household and business expenditures.

She would like to apply for another 35,000 PHP loan for her to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add to her inventory. The more items displayed at the store the better. More items to sell will result in a better profit. Her profits from business will definitely help sustain her family’s daily needs and children’s education expense. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Ma. Liza hopes to become successful through all her hard work. She dreams of good life for her children. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week, and this is where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet has faithfully paid back her previous loan, which she used for her business. She has been operating her own “sari-sari” (variety) store for ten years, and she earns well from this. Having a bigger family requires more effort to provide for their needs, especially for her two children. She had to work hard, with the determination of having better income, to provide their children with a better education. 

To improve sales, Janet would like to apply for a new loan to purchase additional grocery goods to sell. With PHP 20,000, she could already purchase more quantities and varieties of grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business. She sincerely sends you her heartfelt thanks and appreciation for this assistance in advance.

In the future, Janet dreams for children to complete their studies and to have a good life. She meets with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week, and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages to sell

loans.name: Marife

texts.en:
Marife has been operating her own business for six years, and she earns well. Having a big family requires more effort to provide for their needs, especially for her children. She and her husband work hard, with the determination of earning a better income to provide their children with a better education. She successfully paid back her loan, which she used for dishwashing liquid and other detergent products that she is selling.

In order to increase sales, Marife is requesting a new loan for PHP 16,000 to purchase additional powder detergent and products of the same kind. She has also added different frozen food products like tocino into her inventory, and she is now buying and selling plastic ware items. She sincerely expresses her heartfelt thanks and appreciation for this assistance in advance.

Marife hopes to improve her profit from her retail business. She also desires for her children to finish their schooling all through her hard work. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week. Here she can also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for additional supplies such as fabric softener, dishwashing liquids, detergent powder, and other products

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Karoti  A Group

texts.en:
Fransiscar is married with three children who are still in school. She has been running several projects including a beauty salon and broilers. She has been in her business for three years now.  She works from 8 am to 9 pm daily and is able to make a fair monthly profit.

This will be Fransiscar's fourth loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  She used the previous loans to buy chicks, chicken feeds and salon equipments. She has paid back all of her loans successfully.  She is happy with the loan and appreciates Kiva for their support. She used the profit to buy house furniture, pay school fees and cover household expenses.  She will use this loan to buy a new dryer, salon equipment and chicks for raising broilers.  She dreams of making her businesses bigger.

Fransiscar will share this loan with her loan group "Karoti  A", which has four members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy a new dryer, salon equipment and chicks for browing broilers.

loans.name: Capitoline

texts.en: Capitoline is married and her husband is a businessman. She sells scholastic materials. She has been in business for the past seven years. She wishes to add more scholastic materials to sell. With the profit, she will pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: To buy more stationary to sell

loans.name: Speciose

texts.en: Speciose is married and her husband is a businessman. She owns a secretarial shop where she makes photocopies for the clients and prints for them. She has been running the business for the past 12 years. With the loan, she would like to buy more papers and cartridges to sell. The profits from the business will be used to provide food for the family.

loans.use: To buy more papers and cartridges for use in the business.

loans.name: María Paz

texts.es:
María tiene 47 años de edad, es madre de 4 hijos, dos de ellos están en el extranjero y de los otros dos que están con ella uno es mecánico y el otro estudia, el esposo de María vive en el extranjero.


María se dedica a los quehaceres del hogar y a cuidar unas gallinas, ella se levanta temprano para hacer el desayuno de sus hijos y además cuida de su mamá quien está muy enferma.

 El préstamo lo necesita  para comprar  medicinas y pagar los gastos de operación de su mamá que está muy enferma y es urgente una operarla.


Su sueño más grande en este momento es ver a su mamá gozando de salud.
texts.en:
Mary is 47 years old and the mother of four children. Two of them live overseas, while the other two, a mechanic and a student, live with her.

Mary works in household chores and tends to some hens. She gets up early to make breakfast for her children and also cares for her mother who is quite ill. 

She needs the loan to buy medicine and to pay the cost of her mother's surgery, who is very ill and urgently needs an operation. 

Her biggest dream right now is to see her mom enjoying good health.

loans.use: buy medicine and pay the expenses of her mother's surgery, who is very ill and urgently needs surgery.

loans.name: José Fredis

texts.es:
José tiene 38 años de edad, por los escasos recursos económicos no tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar mas que 2º grado, ya que era uno de los hermanos mayores y tenía que ayudar a sus padres a trabajar, está acompañado y su pareja se dedica a las labores del hogar, tienen dos hijos por lo que son tres personas las que dependen de él.

José se dedica a trabajar en la agricultura y lo aprendió de sus padres, porque desde niño iba con ellos al campo, además tiene un vehículo con el que hace viajes, para el trabajo agrícola se traslada 3 kilómetros en bicicleta hasta llegar a su parcela, horario de trabajo no tiene ya que trabaja en lo propio por lo tanto hasta que termina de hacer lo programado para ese día regresa a casa.


El dinero del préstamo lo necesita para comprar una novilla para poder venderla en dos años, además comprará frutas y verduras para andar vendiendo en su vehículo.


Sus sueños son tener una tienda en su casa, comprar ganado de repasto y así poder tener mayores ingresos económicos, está seguro que con la ayuda de Dios y de los prestamos lo hará posible.
texts.en:
Jose is 38 years old.  He didn't have the chance to stay in school after 2nd grade, because of limited financial resources, since he was one of the older children in the family and had to help his parents work. He is in a relationship and his partner is busy at home.  They have two children, so three people depend on Jose for support.

Jose earns a living as a farmer.  He learned how to do this from his parents because since he was a boy he went with them to the fields.  He also has a vehicle with which he can make trips.  For his farming work he travels 3 kilometers by bicycle to get to his land.  He doesn't have fixed hours of work since he's working for himself and doesn't return home until whatever  work he had planned is done.

He needs the money from the loan to buy a heifer he can sell in two years; he will also buy fruits and vegetables to sell going around in his vehicle.

His dreams are to have a store in his house and to buy cattle to put to pasture, and thus have more income.  He is sure that with the help of God and the loans this will be possible.

loans.use: to buy a heifer in order to sell her in two years, and also fruits and vegetables to sell from his vehicle

loans.name: Ana Aida

texts.es:
