Ana de 47 años de edad es una mujer muy trabajadora muy dedicada a su hogar y a la educación de sus hijos, además de eso administra el negocio de la familia que es la fabricación de teja labor realizada por su esposo. Ella se levanta muy temprano para hacer el aseo del hogar y preparar el desayuno para su familia y enviar a los 3 hijos a estudiar. 



Ana tiene varios años dedicándose a este negocio y es el sustento de vida que posee para sacar adelante a sus hijos con ayuda de su esposo, también administra una pequeña tienda que tiene en su casa donde vende productos básicos de primera necesidad.


El crédito lo necesita para surtir la tienda ya que no cuenta con el capital suficiente para la inversión.

 Su sueño es ver a sus hijos graduados de la universidad.
texts.en:
Ana, 47 years old, is a hard-working woman, dedicated to her home and to her children's education.  Besides this, she manages the family business, which is her husband's work of making tiles.  She gets up very early to clean the house and make breakfast for her family and send the three children to school.

Ana has worked hard at the family business business for years and provides her livelihood, the way she can help her children get ahead with her husband's help.  She also runs a small store in her house, selling basic products people need every day.  Ana needs the loan to stock her store since she doesn't have enough capital to invest.  Her dream is to see her children graduate from college.

loans.use: to stock her store since she lacks capital

loans.name: Joel Antonio

texts.es:
Joel tiene 34 años de edad, estudió hasta 6º grado debido a que pertenece a una familia de 10 hermanos y no podían darle mayor estudio, está acompañado y su pareja le ayuda en su negocio, tiene 1 hijo por lo que son 2 personas las que dependen de él.

Joel actualmente tiene una panadería, son 20 años los que lleva trabajando en esto y lo aprendió desde niño debido a la falta de oportunidades que hay de trabajo, su negocio está en su casa por lo que junto a su pareja se levanta a las 4:00 am a comenzar a elaborar el pan y termina a las 6:00 pm



este crédito lo necesita para comprar material para la elaboración de pan, pues al comprar por mayor le venden a mejor precio la harina.


Los sueños de Joel son tener una panadería mas fuerte con varios empleados y así poder obtener mayores ingresos económicos, tener una casa propia ya que por ahora alquila y así darle una mejor estabilidad a su familia.
José sabe que sera un reto muy duro pero con la ayuda de Dios y de los préstamos podrá salir adelante.
texts.en:
Joel is 34 years old. He went to school only to the sixth grade because he belonged to a family of 10  brothers and sisters and his parents weren’t able to give him more education.  He is in a relationship and his partner helps in in his business. He has one child, so there are two people who depend on him.

Joel has a bakery. He has worked 20 years in baking and he learned it as a child due to the lack of job opportunities. His business is located in his house and, together with his companion, he gets up at 4 am to begin making bread; he ends at 6 pm.

He needs this loan to buy more material for bread making, since if he buys at wholesale they will sell him flour for a better price.

Joel’s dreams are to have a bigger bakery, with several employees, and in that way obtain a better income,  and to have his own house, since he rents at present, and thus provide better stability to his family.  Joel knows that this is a difficult challenge, but with the help of God and his loans, he will be able to get ahead.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for bread-making at wholesale prices

loans.name: Karol Azucena

texts.es:
Karol tiene 29 años de edad, solo estudió 7° grado debido a que se acompañó bien  joven, ahora ya está casada y su esposo se dedica a la agricultura, tiene 3 hijos que estudian en la escuela y nadie más vive con ellos.   


Karol se dedica a la venta de pupusas, tortas mexicanas, refrescos y licuados desde hace cinco años, desde hace 6 meses se le presentó una oportunidad de comprar una tienda que antes era de su madre, Karol se levanta a las 5: AM a preparar el desayuno para su familia y luego manda a sus hijos a la escuela, luego se dedica a trabajar en el negocio y termina a las 7:00 pm.   



El préstamo será utilizado para comprar más productos de la canasta básica, azúcar, frijoles, aceite y arroz también jabón, lejía y  más y así  darles un mejor servicio a sus clientes.  

Ella sueña con ver a sus hijos graduarse en una profesión y que su tienda se convierta en un mini-super.
texts.en:
Karol is 29 years old. She studied only up to the 7th grade because she started a long-term relationship with a young man when she was quite young. Now she is married and her husband works in agriculture. She has three children that attend school. No one else lives with them.

For the last five years Karol has been selling pupusas (stuffed tortillas), sandwiches, soft drinks and fruit smoothies. Six months ago, she had the opportunity to buy a store that used to belong to her mother. 

Karol gets up at 5 am to prepare breakfast for her family, she sends her children off to school and then she goes to work in the business and finishes at 7 pm.

The loan will be used to buy more basic foods, such as sugar, beans, oil, and rice, and in addition, soap, bleach and other products, so that she can provide better service to her clients.

Karol dreams of seeing her children graduate with a profession and for her store to evolve into a mini-supermarket.

loans.use: to buy more basic food and household products in order to provide better service to her clients.

loans.name: Luis Antonio

texts.es:
Luis es el mayor de 3 hermanos y vive con sus padres en el populoso distrito de Carapongo en Lima. Su madre es ama de casa y su padre es soldador y trabaja como obrero de manera eventual, por lo que no cuenta con un ingreso  estable.
Luis estudia electrónica industrial y actualmente esta cursando la mitad de la carrera, sin embargo su hermano acaba de terminar la secundaria y también desea estudiar una carrera como el. La situación económica de su casa no permite que ambos puedan hacerlo, por lo que Luis solicita el apoyo de los prestamistas de Kiva para poder financiar sus carrera de manera que el pueda seguir estudiando y su hermano también.
El maneja una cuota demasiado elevada que no puede cubrir, por lo que el monto que tendría que pagar por concepto de cuota en el préstamo de Kiva le seria de gran ayuda ya que podría cancelarlo sin inconvenientes, permitiendole a su hermano también estudiar.
Ademas Luis esta próximo a realizar practicas pre-profesionales remuneradas, y aunque le pagaran el sueldo mínimo, esto lo ayudara a poder afrontar con éxito por si solo los pagos.
Por esto Luis quiere agradecer a los prestamistas de Kiva por todo el apoyo que le brindaran ya que con este no solo lo estarán ayudando a que el pueda seguir estudiando, sino también a su hermano, por lo que están el y su familia muy agradecidos con la oportunidad que les están dando.
texts.en:
Luis is the oldest of three siblings.  He lives with his parents in the populous Carapongo district in Lima.  His mother is a housewife, and his father is a welder.  He works occasionally as a laborer.  Therefore, he does not have a stable income.

Luis is studying industrial electronics, and he is currently in the middle of his degree program.  However, his brother just finished high school, and his brother also wishes to study for a degree like Luis.  The financial situation at his house does not allow for both of them to be able to do so.

That is why Luis is requesting the support of the Kiva lenders.  He does this to be able to pay for their studies in a way that he will be able to continue studying and his brother will, too.

He is facing a payment that is too high, and he is not able to cover it.  He would be able to cover the amount of his payments for the Kiva loan, which would be a big help, without problems.  This would allow both him and his brother to go to school.

Luis is close to doing pre-professional practicums.  He is paid for this, but they pay the minimum salary.  This will help him to be able to successfully manage the payments.

Luis wants to thank the Kiva lenders for all of the support that they will provide.  With this they will not just be helping him to be able to continue studying.  They will also be helping his brother.  He and his family are very grateful for the opportunity the lenders are giving them.

loans.use: to continue his education and for his brother to go to school as well.

loans.name: Marivic

texts.en:
Marivic is 33 years old, married and has four children. Together with her husband she works hard to provide for the everyday needs of her family.

Marivic has offered sewing services within her community in Cavite, Philippines for years now. She makes lace, curtains and other home decor to sell. Additionally, seasonal clothing such as uniforms are in demand all year. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 1000 PHP in sales every day.

Marivic wants to make her business more profitable, so she is applying for a 20,000 PHP loan through CCT to buy more fabric, thread, needles and other notions needed for her sewing. She is hoping that she will further improve her business through this financial assistance. She dreams of growing her business and opening another store. Her desire is to see her family prosper.

All CCT community clients, including Marivic, are organized into fellowship groups of fifteen to thirty members who meet on a weekly basis. There they share stories of their work, repay microfinance loans and draw strength and inspiration from their study of the Word of God.

loans.use: To buy fabric, thread, needles and other materials needed in her business.

loans.name: José Adan

texts.es:
José tiene 24 años de edad, estudió hasta noveno grado de educación, está soltero no tiene compromiso, aún vive con sus padres  quienes se dedican a la agricultura al igual que él. De José no depende nadie directamente pero colabora con sus padres en los gastos de la casa. 


José se dedica a la agricultura y a la venta de granos básicos, se ha dedicado a esta actividad desde hace 8 años, el lugar de trabajo está a un kilómetro de distancia el cual recorre a pie para llegar y trabaja 6 horas diarias.

El crédito lo necesita para comprar abono y herbicidas, para fertilizar el maíz que ya sembró. El préstamo mejorará su negocio porque el tendrá la oportunidad de abonar su cultivo a tiempo y por tanto tendrá mejor cosecha lo que se traducirá en mejores ingresos por la venta. 


Sus sueños son seguir trabajando en la agricultura ya que muchas personas que se dedicaban a esta área en su comunidad ya no lo hacen y desea seguir apoyando a este rubro.
texts.en:
José is 24 years old. He went to school until ninth grade. He is single and is not engaged. He still lives with his parents who work in agriculture, just like he does. Jose doesn't depend directly on anyone but he helps his parents with household expenses.

Jose works in farming and sells basic grains. He has done this work for eight years. The place where he works is a kilometer's distance away, which he travels by foot to get there and work six hours per day.

He needs the loan to purchase compost and herbicides to fertilize the corn that he already planted. The loan will improve his business because he will have the opportunity to fertilize his crops on time and therefore have a better harvest. This will translate into better income from sales.

His dreams are to continue working in agriculture because there are many people who work in this area but aren't continuing in the field, and he wants to continue in this trade.

loans.use: to purchase compost and herbicides to fertilize the corn that he already planted.

loans.name: Manuel

texts.es:
Manuel tiene 40 años de edad, estudió hasta tercer grado de educación,  está acompañado y su pareja de dedica a los oficios domésticos, tiene 3 hijos los cuales aún viven con él y están estudiando  educación básica.



Manuel se dedica a  la agricultura desde hace mucho tiempo, su padre quien es agricultor le enseñó el trabajo de la siembra de los granos básicos, decide dedicarse a esta labor debido a que no encontró otra manera de ayudar y alimentar a su familia. La distancia de su trabajo está a pocos minutos de su casa, su esposa colabora y trabaja 6 horas diarias. 

El crédito lo necesita para comprar una vaca lechera, pues quiere aprovechar el residuo del pasto que genera con la producción agrícola,  y así  tener un activo más. 

Sus sueños son seguir trabajando en lo que le gusta ya que le ha servido para mantener  a su familia.
texts.en:
Manuel is 40 years old. He went to school until third grade. He is married, and his wife works around the house. He has three children who still live with him and are going to primary school.

Manuel has been farming for a long time. His father, who is a farmer, taught him the trade of planting basic grains. He decided to go into this work because he didn't find any other way of supporting and providing for his family. His work is just a few minutes away from his house. His wife helps, and he works six hours a day.

He needs the loan to purchase a milk cow because he wants to take advantage of the residual grass generated from agricultural production and so have another business.

His dreams are to continue working, doing what he likes because it has served to support his family.

loans.use: to purchase a milk cow because he wants to take advantage of the residual grass generated from agricultural production and so have another business.

loans.name: María Margoth

texts.es:
María tiene 57 años de edad, no tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar debido a la situación económica de su familia y las escuelas estaban muy lejos, ella es madre soltera de 4 hijos, pero ya solo una hija y un nieto viven con ella.


María se dedica a los oficios domésticos y también a  la agricultura, se ha dedicado a esta actividad desde  que tiene uso de razón y sus padres le enseñaron desde que era muy joven, de igual forma cuando formó su hogar tuvo que realizar el trabajo de siembra de granos básicos para mantener a su familia, el trabajo está cerca de su casa y labora en un horario de 5 horas al día.


Ella necesita el crédito para comprar  los insumos para sembrar y fertilizar los granos agrícolas (maíz, frijol, maicillo, yuca)  entre otros que ella cultiva. 

Sus sueños son seguir cultivando y con las ganancias comprar una vaca.
texts.en:
María is 57 years old. She didn't have the opportunity to go to school because of her family's financial situation, and the schools were very far away. She is a single mother of four children, but only one daughter and a grandson live with her.

Maria works around the house, and she also farms. She has been doing this work for as long as she could reason, and her parents taught it to her when she was very young. When she started her household, she had to work planting basic grains to provide for her family. The work is close to her home, and she works five hours a day.

She needs the loan to purchase supplies for planting and fertilizing the grain crops (corn, beans, sorghum, yucca) and other things she farms.

Her dreams are to continue farming, and with the revenue, to purchase a cow.

loans.use: to purchase supplies for planting and fertilizing grain crops (corn, beans, sorghum, yucca) and other things that she farms.

loans.name: Andresabel

texts.en:
Andresabel is a resident of Tanza Cavite, Philippines. At the age of forty she manages the household while operating her business. She and her husband are continually working hard to meet their everyday expenses.

Andresabel is a mineral water distributor. She buys mineral water in five-gallon containers through wholesalers, then sells the water at retail. She also earns additional income by selling petroleum and diesel by the bottle. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 300 PHP in sales every day.

To help her boost her business, Andresabel is applying for an 8,000 PHP loan through CCT to buy extra mineral water. She expects to see her income gradually rise as she expands her business. She would like to offer other services or expand into selling other products so as to increase her income. Her goal in life is to see that her family is always well.

All CCT community clients, including Andresabel, are organized into fellowship groups of fifteen to thirty members who meet on a weekly basis. There they share stories of their work, repay microfinance loans and draw strength and inspiration from their study of the Word of God.

loans.use: To buy additional stocks of mineral water to increase her product inventory

loans.name: Luvuno

texts.en:
Luvuno is a married woman with six children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees.

Luvuno sells vegetables from home and her stall to her neighbors and passersby. She faces much competition from other vegetable vendors in the area.

Luvuno decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business. She is applying for a 30,000 KES loan through Yehu to buy sacks of tomatoes, potatoes, fruit and green vegetables to sell.

loans.use: to buy more produce to sell

loans.name: Mwaka

texts.en:
Mwaka appreciates the previous loan that helped her expand her business. She operates a poultry selling business. She mentioned disease outbreak causing losses as a challenge in the business. Mwaka dreams of becoming a wholesaler of poultry in the future. 

With the KES 50,000 she wants to purchase chicks and poultry feed. She joined Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase chicks and poultry feed.

loans.name: Fidelia Del Carmen

texts.es:
Fidelia tiene 41 años de edad, estudió hasta segundo  grado de educación, está casada desde hace 22 años y su esposo se dedica al trabajo de  electricista y a la agricultura, tiene 3hijos de los cuales 2 están estudiando  en educación básica y una está ya acompañada.

Fidelia se dedica a los oficios domésticos y a la venta de pan  en la comunidad, actividad que desarrolla desde hace 12 años, esto le ha ayudado a aportar a los gastos del hogar. El trabajo lo realiza en dos jornadas, la primera a las 6:00 de la mañana  y la segunda a las 5:00 de la tarde.


Ella necesita el crédito para instalar el servicio de luz eleéctrica en su casa, necesita comprar  alambre, tubos galvanizados, focos, y contratar la mano de obra para realizar el trabajo. 

Su sueño es seguir trabajando en el comercio, pero sueña con formalizarlo, es decir poner un puesto de venta fijo ya que actualmente le toca andar por toda la comunidad a pie vendiendo su producto,  y sueña para su familia que sus hijos logren estudiar ya que ella no pudo.
texts.en:
Fidelia is 41 years old. She went to school until second grade. She has been married for 22 years, and her husband works as an electrician and in farming. She has three children, two of whom are going to primary school, and one who is already married.

Fidelia works around the house and sells bread in the community, an activity that she has been doing for 12 years. This has helped her pay for household expenses. She does the work in two shifts, the first starting at 6 am, and the second at 5 pm.

She needs the loan to install electric lighting service in her house. She needs to buy wire, galvanized tubes, and light bulbs, and to contract a worker to do the job.

Her dream is to continue working in sales, but she dreams of formalizing it. That is, she wants to set up a sales booth, since now she has to walk around the whole town, on foot, selling her products. Her dream for her family is that her children will complete their studies since she could not.

loans.use: to install electric lighting service in her home. She needs to purchase wire, galvanized tubes, and light bulbs, and to contract a worker to do the job.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase supplies that she will use for planting. She will purchase fertilizers and compost and pay for a farm boy.

loans.name: Neda

texts.en:
Neda has faithfully paid back her previous loan which she used for her business. She has been operating her own doormat-making business for years and she earns well from this. Having a bigger responsibility requires more effort to provide for their needs, especially for her children. She had to work hard, with the determination of having better income, to provide her children with better education. 

To improve her profit, Neda would like to apply for a new loan. With PHP 21,000, she could already purchase more quantities of raw materials like fabric, thread and other materials for her business. She sincerely lets you know her heartfelt thanks and appreciation for this assistance in advance.

In the future, Neda hopes to expand and grow her business. She also dreams that her children will finish their studies. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her life and business every week in a place where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for fabric, thread, needles and other materials needed in her business.

loans.name: Doris Esmeralda

texts.es:
Doris de 29 años de edad, es licenciada en contaduría pública, madre soltera de una hija de 8 años de edad que actualmente está estudiando tercer grado y nadie más depende de Doris.

Doris es dueña  de un negocio de papelería frente a un centro escolar, este negocio lo tiene desde hace 4 años y lo aprendió sola, viendo que la zona es un lugar bueno para el negocio de papelería ya que  vive frente a un centro escolar y ve que ahí si puede obtener ingresos para la familia; pero también Doris trabaja como contadora en una Institución que se encarga de capacitar jóvenes con diversos temas en las comunidades, ella trabaja en la oficina de lunes a viernes de 8:00 am a 5:00 pm, el negocio de la papelería se lo administra una prima.

El préstamo solicitado en CrediCampo lo necesita para comprar calzado para damas y niños ya que son los que más se venden.

Sus sueños son darle a su hija todo lo necesario para que ella se  prepare, tener un negocio muy grande de calzado y de papelería.
texts.en:
Doris, 29 years old, has an accounting degree, and is the single mother of an eight year old daughter who is in third grade.  No one else depends on Doris for support.  Doris owns a stationery store near a school center.  She has had this business for four years and learned it by herself, seeing that the area is a good place to sell stationery goods.  She lives near a school center and has seen that this is a way to earn income for the family.  However, Doris also works as an accountant for an organization dedicated to training young people in various subjects in the communities.  She works at the office from Monday to Friday from 8 AM to 5 PM.  A cousin of hers runs the stationery store.  

She needs the loan sought through CrediCampo to buy shoes for women and children since those are best-selling items.  Her dreams are to give her daughter everything needed so that she can prepare herself well, and to have a really large business selling  footware and paper products.

loans.use: to buy shoes for women and children since those are the best selling ones

loans.name: Mwanachitu

texts.en:
Mwanachitu is a married woman. She is blessed with four children all of whom attend school. They live at their own house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees.

Mwanachitu has operated a tailoring business, making women’s and gent's suits for sale at home. She cites seasonality and stiff competition from other tailoring operators to be her major challenge. 

With the KES 20,000 she wants to purchase cloth materials and sewing threads for her business. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase cloth materials and sewing threads for her business.

loans.name: Rukoola Kbc Listener's Club Group

texts.en:
Stella is a female Ugandan, 46 years old and married with six children who are 17, 16, 15, 12, 10, 5 and 2 years old.  Three of her children attend school and she is responsible for paying their tuition and meeting all their needs.

Her main business is farming on a small scale where she consumes and sells the surplus. She has applied for a loan through the group to buy organic fertilizers to spread in her banana and vegetable garden. She is hopeful this will help her to increase her yield and output, therefore making a reasonable income to adequately support her family and educate all her children. She is a hardworking person and is thankful to the Kiva lenders through UGAFODE for a job well done.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizers to spread in her banana and vegetable garden.

loans.name: John

texts.en: John is a married man with two children. His children are still infants and have not started schooling. He comes from rural Ibanda district. He has a retail shop in a trading centre where he gets income to support his family. John is also a boda boda rider which is his side source of income. John applied for a loan of 1,500,000 UGX to add more stock in his business and also buy spare parts for his motorcycle since its in a poor mechanical condition. However his main challenge is limited capital to improve on his business and stiff competition among the people doing the same business. His dream is to expand on his business and build a permanent house for his family.

loans.use: To buy motorcycle spare parts, sodas, dry cells, sugar, washing powder, and other items,

loans.name: Benedine

texts.en:
Benedine comes from Nyarukika-Ibanda district. She is a single mother, 32 years old, with one child who divorced her husband due to family problems. 

Benedine runs a small retail shop with capital of 800,000 UGX in Nyarukika Trading Centre. She has applied for a loan of 1,500,000 UGX to help her add more stock in the retail shop in the form of sugar, flour, and soap among other items. She will use the rest of the money to pay rent for her business. Her future plan is to build a permanent house for her aged parents. Benedine is an honest and hardworking woman.

loans.use: To buy retail stock to sell such as sugar, soap, and flour

loans.name: Ponciano

texts.es:
Ponciano nació en Tingo Maria, provincia de Huanuco, sierra del Perú. El vino a la capital para poder estudiar y labrarse un mejor futuro para ayudar a su madre que lo espera en su ciudad natal. ella vive sola ya que su padre falleció cuando el tenia 14 años. Desde entonces han sido ella y sus tres hermanos con los que vive actualmente, su hermano mayor, Macario, es quien se esta haciendo responsable de su mantenimiento y estudio, conjuntamente a los de su hermano menor. Ponciano estuvo ayudándolo con los pagos, gracias a que estuvo trabajando a medio tiempo, pero debido al horario en su instituto a tenido que dejarlo.
Es por esto ultimo que actualmente se esta complicando el poder financiar el costo que implican sus estudios, ya que tanto su hermano mayor como el menor también se encuentran estudiando, muy aparte del gasto por transporte, comida y el alquiler del cuarto donde viven.
Por todo esto tendría que abandonar sus estudios y comenzar a trabajar nuevamente, de no contar con el apoyo de los prestamistas de Kiva.
Los tres hermanos estudian carreras técnicas que se complementan y tienen pensado poner de manera conjunta un taller en su ciudad natal y así poder velar por el bienestar de su madre.
Ponciano agradece a los prestamistas de Kiva por todo el apoyo que le pueden brindar ya que con el sera posible que cumpla su sueño de ser profesional y con esto ser capaz de alcanzar todas sus metas.
texts.en:
Ponciano was born in Tingo Maria, Huanuco Province in the Peruvian highlands. He came to the capital to be able to study and carve out a better future to be able to help his mother who waits for him in his hometown. She lives alone, as his father died when he was 14 years old. Since then, it's just been her and his three brothers who he currently lives with, his older brother, Macario, is the one who has been responsible for taking care of him and his studies, as well as those of his older brother. Ponciano was helping with the payments, thanks to the fact that he was working part time, but due to the timetable in his institution he had to leave his job.

Due to this, he is currently in a complicated situation, having to pay the cost of financing his studies, as both his older and younger brothers are also studying now, not to mention the cost of transportation, food and rent for the room where they live.

Ponciano is thankful to the Kiva lenders for all the support they have provided him with so far, as for him it will be possible to reach his dream of being a professional and thus be able to reach all of his goals.

loans.use: to finish his degree and to return to his hometown and help his mother.

loans.name: Víctor Angelo

texts.es:
Víctor vive con sus padres y sus tres hermanos, su padre es jardinero y su madre ama de casa. El sueldo que percibe su padre no es suficiente para afrontar los gastos propios del hogar y su educación por lo que pronto deberá dejar sus estudios y empezar a trabajar de no contar con el apoyo de los prestamistas de Kiva.
El esta muy deseoso de poder seguir estudiando y culminar sus estudios para poder trabajar y asi ayudar a su familia y a que sus hermanos también puedan estudiar una profesión, por lo que agradece mucho la ayuda que brindan los prestamistas de Kiva a jóvenes deseosos de salir adelante como el.
Víctor estudia para ser soldador estructural y considera que es una gran carrera dado el crecimiento del país y la necesidad de mano de obra calificada en temas técnicos.
El piensa que una persona con la adecuada educación es capaz de lograr muchas cosas, por lo que considera que la labor desinteresada que realizan los prestamistas de Kiva en todo el mundo es digna de admiración y reconocimiento.
texts.en:
Victor lives with his parents and three siblings, his father is a gardner and his mother is a housewife. The salary of his father isn't sufficient to afford the costs of his own home and his studies, so he would soon have to leave his studies and start working if he wasn't able to count on the support of the lenders on Kiva.

He very much desires to continue studying and finish his studies to be able to work and thus help his family so that his siblings can also study a profession, so he is very thankful for the support that the Kiva lenders offer to young people who want to get ahead like him. Victor studies to be a structural welder and considers that it is a great career given the country's growth and the need for skilled labor in technical areas.

He thinks that a person with adequate education is able to achieve many things, so he considers that the selfless work done by Kiva lenders worldwide is worthy of admiration and appreciation.

loans.use: to continue studying his technical course as a structural welder.

loans.name: Jovelyn

texts.en:
Jovelyn previously accessed a 25,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase more quantities and varieties of grocery items and products needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help with her children’s education and with their personal, household and business expenditures.

She would like to apply for another 20,000 PHP loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add to her inventory. The more items displayed at the store the better. More items to sell will result in a better profit. Her profits from the business will definitely help sustain her family’s daily needs and her children’s education expenses. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Jovelyn dreams of growing her business more and expanding. She hopes to give the best education to her children. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week. This is where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business

loans.name: Monday

texts.en: Monday is a married man with six children who are all in school. Monday comes from a cell in Kiruhura district. He has a retail shop in a trading centre and it is where he gets income to support his family and pay school fees for his children. He has applied for a loan of 5,000,000 UGX. He will use this loan to help him buy more stock of sugar, rice, flour, washing powder, beverages and other items for his business and also to roof his house since it is still under construction. His customers are his neighbors. Monday is a very honest and hard working man. His dream is to transform his business from retail to wholesale trade.

loans.use: To buy bags of sugar, rice, flour,washing powder, beverages, etc.

loans.name: Sushila

texts.en:
Sushila is only 30 years old and a hard-working entrepreneur residing at a small village, Magurmari of Dhupguri in Jalpaiguri district. She is married and lives in a household of five members: herself, her husband and three children (two sons and one daughter, of whom two are students of grade 4 and grade 1; the other is too young for school.) They live in a small house which is made of mud, bamboo and straw and is lacking the basic amenities like water connection and electricity.

Sushila's husband, Gopal, aged 29 years, is a carpenter by profession. He runs a business of selling small wooden furniture (like chairs, tables, stools, etc.), which he sells locally, and earns for the family. Sushila acknowledges the fact that the income from her husband's business was barely enough to meet the daily expenses. With three young kids to take care of and provide with a good education, she started to rear cattle. She purchased a cow and has been supplying milk to her neighbours. Despite her childhood being ruined, as she could not get a good education and only attended school till primary level, she never gave up her fighting spirit and became financially independent. She is a young, courageous woman who is willing to work harder.

She seeks a loan from BJS (Kiva’s partner) to buy a dairy cow and increase her cattle rearing business. One more cow means more milk to supply, thus she can earn more profit.  With the increased income and savings, Sushila wants to provide higher educational facilities to her children, which she did not get in her childhood.

She thanks BJS and Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow for her milk supply business.

loans.name: Ruma

texts.en:
Ruma hails from Dhupguri. She is 33 years old, married, and a housewife. She and her husband, Shibeswar, together are raising three children (two sons and one daughter). All are students and are in different grades of the secondary level. They live in a small village, Kathapara in Jalpaiguri district, in their small house. Both Ruma and her husband attended school till grade 6.

Dynamic and hard-working, Ruma's husband is running a business of growing seasonal vegetables. Though a housewife, Ruma helps her husband in every way, especially at the time of harvesting and selling their products to the local markets. Due to the seasonal nature of his job, his income is unsteady and insufficient for the family's household. With the addition of cultivation of paddy, he will not only be able to increase his monthly income, but also add to its reliability because paddy is an all-season crop and has a high demand in the market. They are looking for a loan to purchase necessary agricultural supplies.

In order to help her husband, Ruma has applied for a loan from BJS. She wants to utilize the loan to purchase good quality paddy seeds, fertilizers and insecticides to start cultivation. The loan will help Ruma keep her family afloat and stable financially. She dreams to construct a better and decent house.

Her full thanks go to BJS and Kiva for their financial help.

loans.use: To purchase paddy seeds and fertilizers for cultivation.

loans.name: La  Belle Group

texts.fr:
Mariées majoritairement dans des ménages monogamiques, les cinq  membres du groupe  ont en moyenne 29 ans et 3 enfants. Elles habitent toutes à Kanadjiguila commune du Mandé / cercle de Kati et se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage et de leurs activités génératrices de revenu au marché de Kanadjiguila. Les membres du groupe font le petit commerce de, chaussure, jus, baya et charbon du bois. Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 3ème cycle de prêt solidaire.
Madame Youma (femme debout en 2ème position de la droite vers la gauche sur la photo) est une vendeuse des chaussures de plusieurs sortes. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 20 paires de chaussures en gros au grand marché. La revente se fait en détails à Kanadjiguila à une clientèle composée majoritairement de femmes. Madame Youma compte avoir avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 40 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé, pour être réinvesti dans l’activité et satisfaire les petits besoins du foyer.
texts.en:
Married for the most part in monogamous households, the five group members are on average 29 years old with three children. They all live in Kanadjiguila in the Mande municipality, which is part of the Kati Circle, and became acquainted through neighborhood ties and their income-generating activities at the Kanadjiguila market.

Group members are small retail merchants dealing in shoes, juice, charcoal and bayas (string of beads worn around the hips). In order to increase their working capital, the group decided to collaborate with Soro Yiriwaso and are in their third group loan cycle.

Mrs. Youma (the woman standing in second position from right to left in the photo) is a seller of various kinds of shoes. She intends to use her loan to buy 20 pairs of shoes at wholesale prices at the main market. Retail sales are conducted in Kanadjiguila to a clientele composed mostly of women.

Mrs. Youma hopes to attain average monthly profits of 40,000 CFA francs, to be reinvested in the business and used to cover small household expenditures.

loans.use: buy different kinds of shoes

loans.name: Pankarasiyo

texts.en: Pankarasiyo is a 35-year-old man who is married with five children. He is a hardworking man who mainly gets his income from using a motorcycle as a means of transport. He also obtains additional income from selling bananas. He began the business to generate income for personal development and he has hope of buying a new Bajaj motorcycle to ease the transport costs of taking his bananas to the market. Thus, Pankarasiyo is requesting for a loan to purchase a Bajaj motorcycle. The main challenge he faces is that of bad roads.

loans.use: to purchase a Bajaj motorcycle.

loans.name: Oksana

texts.en:
Oksana is married. She has twin girls. She sells cosmetics in a shop. Also she cooks homemade pelmeni (traditional food) to sell. She lives in a house with her family.

Oksana is asking for a loan of 20,000 UAH to do renovation. She wants to put new windows and doors in her house to save enegry.

Oksana is hardworking and responsible. This year her girls are going to enroll in a college.

loans.use: to put new energy saving doors and windows in her house

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en: Fatuma is a hardworking mother of four children living in Kyenjojo, Uganda. She is a farmer who deals in tea growing as her main source of income. She also gets other income from milk production. She started this business in order to meet her family's needs. However, Fatuma is faced with the problem of fluctuating weather conditions - especially hail stones - that destroy tea leaves. Her main hopes are to expand her tea plantations and complete building her house. Fatuma is acquiring credit to buy iron sheets to roof her house.

loans.use: to buy iron sheets to roof her house.

loans.name: David

texts.en: David is 35 years of age and is married with six children living in Kyenjojo, Uganda. He is a hardworking man who deals in the cattle trade. He began the trade to improve his family’s welfare. He gets his other income from making local brew (“waragi”) for selling. He hopes to build a permanent home, though he faces the challenge of price fluctuations for cattle on the market. He intends to use this loan to buy more cattle for selling.

loans.use: to buy more cattle for selling.

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en: Samuel is a married man with three children living in Kyenjojo, Uganda. He is a hardworking man who deals in the buying and selling of produce, mainly maize and beans. He began his business in order to improve his standard of living. He gets other income from the sale of bananas. His hopes are to buy a tipper lorry to make the transportation of his produce easier. However, Samuel's major challenge is poor weather conditions which limit his output. He will use this loan to purchase maize and beans for selling.

loans.use: to purchase maize and beans.

loans.name: Rupa

texts.en:
Rupa is only 23. She is from Dhupguri. She lives with her husband and one young son in the small village of Raipara in Jalpaiguri district. Rupa has an education till grade 9, and her husband, Tapu, is 25 years old.

Rupa's husband, Tapu, is associated with an agribusiness. He has been in this business for the last five years. He likes to work on his farmland and works tirelessly all day long to grow vegetables. This activity is the only source of income for the family. Rupa is a homemaker. She manages all the household work and looks after her husband and son. After managing all of these activities, she helps her husband in his agricultural works, especially at the time of harvesting and carrying the produce to the market to sell. She is a hardworking woman who desires to better her family. Now they have decided to grow ribbed gourds on their farm, which are in much demand in the present market, and which are widely used in Indian dishes.

Rupa has taken a loan from BJS (Kiva's partner). She will use the loan proceeds to buy seeds, fertilizers, pesticides and other items. This loan will be very helpful for her business, enabling her to get ahead and to make progress in her business. The earnings from this business, she dreams, will allow her to give a better education to her son and give them a decent and better lifestyle.

She aspires to purchase more land for cultivation and to grow their business. She is grateful to her lenders BJS and Kiva for their financial assistance.

loans.use: To purchase seeds and fertilizers for cultivating ribbed gourds.

loans.name: Violet

texts.en: Violet is a 32-year-old, married woman with four children living in Fort Portal, Uganda. She sells popcorn alongside running a saloon business. She faces challenges in the form of defaulters. She desires to buy a motorcycle to make the delivery of popcorn to here clients easier. Now, Violet needs a loan to buy more corn for making popcorn.

loans.use: to buy corn for making popcorn.

loans.name: Safina

texts.en:
Safina, hailing from Dhupguri, is an active and energetic woman of 26 years. She is a housewife who had the opportunity to study till grade 9. She is the mother of a toddler. She lives in a rural village, Kholaigram in Jalpaiguri district, with her husband and only son.

Her husband, 28-year-old Sarafat, works in agriculture. He has been in this business for the last couple of years. He learned about it when he was very young, and his father taught this to him. He grows different vegetables in different seasons, and this farm work is the only source of income for the family, which is inadequate to cover all the household expenses. To earn more profit, he wants to cultivate lady's fingers (okra). Safina and her husband have chosen this as it is a vegetable which is cheap and also is widely used in rural areas. His biggest difficulty is capital for which he can't start cultivation.

In order to purchase farm supplies for the cultivation, Safina has taken a loan from BJS (Kiva's partner). She plans to buy seeds, fertilizers, insecticides and other necessary things to start cultivation. Through this loan, she hopes, their dream will come true. She wants to work hard to get her family well and save money for the future.

Her full thanks go to her generous lenders for their financial assistance.

loans.use: To purchase seeds, fertilizers and insecticides for cultivating lady's finger .

loans.name: Lawrence

texts.en: Lawrence is a married man with six children living in Kyenjojo, Uganda. He is a hardworking man dealing in tea farming, Irish potatoes and maize. He started his business for income generation. Lawrence's business is let down by poor weather conditions and price fluctuations. Lawrence aims to establish a very strong business and to complete the construction of his residential home.The purpose of this loan is to clear his garden for the next season.

loans.use: to clear his garden for the next season.

loans.name: Katuramu

texts.en: Katuramu is a hardworking man living in Kyenjojo, Uganda. He deals in the sale of motorcycle spare parts. He obtains other income from empowering school drop outs by educating and training them in motorcycle repairs and mechanics. He started this business for self sustainability. His main hopes are completing a commercial house in the next six months and expanding his garage. Defaulting customers are a set back to Katuramu's business. He will use this loan to purchase more motorcycle spare parts for selling.

loans.use: to purchase more motorcycle spare parts for selling.

loans.name: Francis

texts.en: Francis is a married man with nine children living in Kyenjojo, Uganda. He is a farmer dealing in the cattle trade. His other source of income is his rentals. He started this business to generate income to improve his family's standard of living. His customers are cattle butchers. Cattle disease breakout like foot and mouth disease sometimes poses a threat to his business. He hopes to establish a retail shop so as to diversify his trade and expand his income base. With this loan, Francis will buy cattle for selling.

loans.use: to buy cattle for selling.

loans.name: Oliver

texts.en: Oliver is a thirty-eight-year-old mother of five children living in Kyenjojo, Uganda. She has a retail shop in a rural area selling soft drinks. She started the business to improve her standard of living. She obtains other income from rentals and hopes to construct more. The major challenge faced by Oliver is inadequate capital to be able to run her business smoothly. The purpose of this loan is to buy sugar, salt, detergent and other general merchandise.

loans.use: to buy sugar, salt, detergent and other general merchandise.

loans.name: Julio Alexander

texts.es:
Julio es un joven emprendedor, tiene 22 años de edad, es soltero y vive en Ica junto a su familia.
Es una persona con muchas ganas de salir adelante. Lamentablemente no pudo estudiar una carrera profesional porque su familia es de bajos recursos económicos; sin embargo esto no es un impedimento para él. Con mucho esfuerzo y dedicación está apoyando a su familia, desde hace más de 2 años trabaja como Obrero de Campo en un Fundo Agrícola y le va muy bien porque es muy responsable, trabajador, honesto y tiene muchos deseos de superación. Sale muy temprano a trabajar y regresa a altas horas de la noche a su casa porque quiere darle lo mejor a sus padres.
Julio está agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva porque con el apoyo que le han brindado él podrá comprar un artefacto, una refrigeradora para que de esta manera sus comidas puedan durar por más tiempo y ahorren dinero. Gracias a esto estará mejorando su calidad de vida y seguirá esforzándose para poder brindar a sus padres un futuro mejor.
texts.en:
Julio is an enterprising young man, 22 years old, single and lives in Ica with his family.

He is a person with a strong desire to get ahead. Unfortunately he was unable to study a professional career because his family has few economic resources. Nonetheless, this is not an impediment for him. He is supporting his family through much effort and dedication. For over two years he has been working as a field laborer in a farm and it has been going very well for him because he is responsible, hardworking, honest and has a strong desire to overcome. He goes to work very early and returns late in the night to his house because he wants to give the best to his parents.

Julio is grateful to Kiva lenders because with the support they have offered him he will be able to buy a refrigerator so that their food will last longer and they can save money. Thanks to this he will be improving their quality of life and he will continue striving to provide a better future for his parents.

loans.use: to buy home appliances (refrigerator)

loans.name: Papri

texts.en:
Papri is a 30-year-old housewife of Dhupguri. She is married to Ashim, aged 31 years, who has an education up to grade 6. They are raising two sons, who are students of grade 6 and grade 3. They have their own small kachha (made of mud and straw) house at Magurmari village in the small town Dhupguri in the district Jalpaiguri.  

Papri’s husband is engaged with a milk supply business. He purchases milk from dairy farms and sells it to the local market, but the income from this business is not sufficient to meet the expenses of their family, as well as the education of their children. Papri has decided to help her husband and decided to enhance her family business, but due to lack of capital they are unable to invest in their business. Now Papri has taken a loan from BJS (Kiva’s partner), so that they can buy more milk from the dairy farm and sell to the local market as well as their neighbors. As there is a great demand for her product quality, it becomes more profitable to her, and she can invest more in her existing business. It will uphold her family's financial status, and she can run a decent life.

Papri aspires to purchase more land with the profit from her business.

They are grateful to the lenders, BJS and Kiva.

loans.use: To invest in her milk supply business by buying more milk.

loans.name: Vanansio

texts.en: Vanansio is a married man with six children living in Kyenjojo, Uganda. He deals in the cattle trade and started business mainly for self development. His main hopes are to continue growing his business and open up butcheries. Vanansio mainly faces a challenge of few customers during the rainy season because of poor roads. The purpose of this loan is to buy more cattle to sell.

loans.use: to buy more cattle to sell

loans.name: Lina Maryori

texts.es:
Lina una madre de 37 años de edad, con dos hijos de 19 y 20 años próximos a entrar a la universidad, pero presenta un gran problema y es que ella no dispone de capital para pagar el elevado costo de las matrículas y tampoco le da solicitándolas a crédito.

Quiere iniciar su negocio de comidas rápidas con la esperanza de tener la forma de pagar los estudios de sus hijos que es su gran anhelo y deseo en la vida.

Con el crédito comprara el carro de comida, los insumos como uniformes, y materia prima, panes, carnes, verduras para realizar las ensaladas las salsas, papas etc. 

El crédito será trascendental pues quiere darles a sus hijos estudio y que se dediquen a esta labor para que sean grandes profesionales en un futuro.
texts.en:
Lina is a 37-year-old mother with two children who are 19 and 20 years old and about to enter university. This is a big problem for her because she does not have the capital to pay for the high cost of tuition, and nor will it be sufficient to solicit a loan.

She wants to start her own business selling fast food with the hope of having a better way of paying for her children's studies, which is her greatest desire in her life.

With the loan she will buy a food cart, supplies such as uniforms and raw material, bread, meat, vegetables to prepare salads, sauces, potatoes, etc. The loan will be transcendental since she wants her children to dedicate themselves to their studies to be come successful professionals in the future.

loans.use: to start her business selling fast food by buying a food cart, uniforms, and supplies to prepare the food

loans.name: Moses

texts.en: Moses is twenty-nine-years-old, single and has been a teacher by profession for five years. He works five days a week and nine hours a day at a secondary school plus farms for additional income. He hopes to operate a small business and build a house for his family. However, he is challenged by his low salary. Moses is a hardworking man who wants money to buy land.

loans.use: to buy land.

loans.name: Hakilissiguiton 2 Group

texts.fr:
Les 10 membres du groupe   Hakilissiguiton 2  sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 33 ans, 3 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles traditionnelles à Sincina-Sesso, un des villages de Koutiala, 3ème région administrative du Mali. Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur neuvième prêt avec l’institution, les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est le  Maïs  avec  Alima Solomane , arrêtée 2ème  de droite à gauche  sur la photo.
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter des intrants, des semences, des petits matériels agricoles et payer les frais de labour et de sarclage pour entretenir  ½ hectare. 
La production sera vendue au niveau du village et à Koutiala, après la récolte, à une clientèle mixte. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de175 000FCFA en fin de campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The 10 members of the Hakilissiguiton 2 group are married women with an average age of 33 and, on average, 3 children. They all live in traditional families in Sincina-Sesso, one of the villages in Koutiala, the third administrative region of Mali. They are working with the MFI Soro Yiriwaso in order to be able to carry out their agricultural activities during the rainy season. This is their 9th loan from the institution, and they have properly repaid their previous loans.

Alima Solomane, second from the right in the picture, grows maize. She plans to use her loan to buy agricultural inputs, seeds and small agricultural equipment, and to pay the labour costs for cultivating and weeding 1.5 hectares of land. After the harvest, the produce will be sold in the village and in Koutiala to a varied clientèle. She expects to make an average monthly profit of 175 000 francs per crop cycle. This profit will allow her to repay her loan and to support her husband with the daily expenses.

loans.use: to buy seeds, agricultural inputs, small agricultural equipment and to pay the labour costs for cultivating and weeding.

loans.name: Hakilissiguiton 4 Group

texts.fr:
Les 10 membres du groupe   Hakilissiguiton 4 sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 30 ans, 3 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles traditionnelles à Sincina-Sesso, un des villages de Koutiala, 3ème région administrative du Mali. Elles collaborent avec l’institution de micro finance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur neuvième prêt avec l’institution, les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est l’arachide  avec  Rokiatou Seydou , arrêtée 2ème de droite à gauche sur la photo.
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter des intrants, des semences, des petits matériels agricoles et payer les frais de labour et de sarclage pour entretenir  1 hectare. 
La production sera vendue au niveau du village et à Koutiala, après la récolte, à une clientèle mixte. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 165 000FCFA en fin de campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The 10 members of the Hakilissiguiton 4 group are married women with an average age of 30 and, on average, 3 children. They all live in traditional families in Sincina-Sesso, one of the villages in Koutiala, the third administrative region of Mali. They are working with the MFI Soro Yiriwaso in order to be able to carry out their agricultural activities during the rainy season. This is their 9th loan from the institution, and they have properly repaid their previous loans.

Rokiatou Seydou, second from the right in the picture, grows groundnuts. She plans to use her loan to buy agricultural inputs, seeds and small agricultural equipment, and to pay the labour costs for cultivating and weeding 1 hectare of land. After the harvest, the produce will be sold in the village and in Koutiala to a mixed clientèle. She expects to make an average monthly profit of 165 000 francs per crop cycle. This profit will allow her to repay her loan and to support her husband with the daily expenses.

loans.use: to buy seeds, agricultural inputs and small agricultural equipment and to pay the labour costs for cultivating and weeding.

loans.name: Hakilissiguiton 3 Group

texts.fr:
Les 10 membres du groupe  Hakilissiguiton 3  sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 33 ans, 2 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles traditionnelles à Sincina-Sesso, un des villages de Koutiala, 3ème région administrative du Mali. Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur neuvième prêt avec l’institution, les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est le  Maïs  avec  Diarra Solo , assise au bout et à droite sur la photo.
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter des intrants, des semences, des petits matériels agricoles et payer les frais de labour et de sarclage pour entretenir  3 hectares. 
La production sera vendue au niveau du village et à Koutiala, après la récolte, à une clientèle mixte. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 295 000FCFA en fin de campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The 10 members of the Hakilissiguiton 3 group are married women with an average age of 33 and, on average, 2 children. They all live in traditional families in Sincina-Sesso, one of the villages in Koutiala, the third administrative region of Mali. They are working with the MFI Soro Yiriwaso in order to be able to carry out their agricultural activities during the rainy season. This is their 9th loan from the institution, and they have properly repaid their previous loans.

Diarra Solo, sitting on the right in the picture, grows maize. She plans to use her loan to buy agricultural inputs, seeds and small agricultural equipment, and to pay the labour costs for cultivating and weeding 3 hectares of land. After the harvest, the produce will be sold in the village and in Koutiala to a mixed clientèle. She expects to make an average monthly profit of 295 000 francs per crop cycle. This profit will allow her to repay her loan and to support her husband with the daily expenses.

loans.use: to buy seeds, agricultural inputs, small agricultural equipment and to pay the labour costs for cultivating and weeding.

loans.name: George

texts.en: George is a fifty-two-year-old married male with six children of which four go to school. He has been selling crude oil for the last ten years. He works six days a week and ten hours a day. He earns additional income from rentals. George hopes to educate his children. Bad weather is a challenge to George's business. George will use the money to buy salt to sell.

loans.use: to buy salt to sell.

loans.name: Jackson

texts.en: Jackson is a forty-six-year-old married man with eleven children of which eight go to school. He has been in the retail business for ten years. He works seven days a week and fifteen hours a day. Banana selling supplements his income. Jackson started his business to sustain his family. Jackson hopes to build more rentals and educate his children however a low rate of turn-over is a challenge being faced. Jackson is a hard-working man who wants money to buy sugar, salt, omo (detergent) and cooking oil to sell.

loans.use: to buy sugar, salt, omo and cooking oil to sell.

loans.name: Miria

texts.en:
Miria is a fifty-five-year-old hard-working married woman with three children aged twelve, eight and four years. She lives in Kamwenge, Uganda. She runs a retail shop as her main source of income. Miria faces competition as her main challenge and scarcity of resources to buy more stock to sell. She has hopes of becoming a rich woman and educating her three children.
  
She intends to use the loan to buy more crates of beer and soda to sell.

loans.use: to buy more crates of beer and soda to sell.

loans.name: Nieta Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Nieta est majoritairement composé de femmes  monogames. Elles ont en moyenne 42 ans et 4 enfants. Elles habitent toutes à Kanadjiguila commune de Mandé / cercle de Kati et se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage. Les membres du groupe font le petit commerce du bois de chauffage, d’ustensiles et de la restauration. Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce les membres du groupe ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 3ème cycle de prêt solidaire.
Madame Fatoumata (femme assise à l’extrême droite sur la photo) a une réputation dans la vente du bois de chauffage. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 2 chargements du bois de chauffage dans les villages environnants de Bamako. La revente se fait en détails au marché et à la maison à Kanadjiguila et à une clientèle majoritairement composée de femmes. Madame Fatoumata  espère réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 50 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé, pour être réinvesti dans son activité. Elle a pour objectif de subvenir aux éventuels problèmes de la famille dans cette relation avec Soro Yiriwaso.
texts.en:
The Nieta group consists of a majority of monogamous women. They are on average 42 years old with four children. They all live in Kanadjiguila in the Mande municipality, which is part of the Kati Circle, and became acquainted through neighborhood ties.

Group members are small retail merchants dealing in firewood, kitchen utensils and food preparations. To increase their stock-in-trade, the group decided to collaborate with Soro Yiriwaso and are in their third group loan cycle.

Mrs. Fatoumata (the woman sitting on the right in the photo) is a reputed seller of firewood. She intends to use her loan to buy two loads of firewood from villages surrounding Bamako. Retail sales are conducted at the market and from her home in Kanadjiguila, to a clientele composed mostly of women.

With this loan Mrs. Fatoumata hopes to attain average monthly profits of 50,000 CFA francs, to be reinvested in her business. Her objective through this relation with Soro Yiriwaso is to cope with possible family needs.

loans.use: buy firewood

loans.name: Siguikafo Group

texts.fr:
Mariées majoritairement dans des ménages monogamiques, les quatre  membres du groupe Siguikafo ont en moyenne 42 ans et 5 enfants. Elles habitent toutes à Kanadjiguila commune du Mandé / cercle de Kati et se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage et de leurs activités génératrices de revenu au marché de Kanadjiguila. Les membres du groupe font le petit commerce d’habits (friperies). Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 3ème cycle de prêt solidaire.
Madame Adiaratou (femme debout à l’extrême  gauche sur la photo) est une grande vendeuse des habits (friperies). Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 2 balles de friperies à Médine. La revente se fait en détails au marché et à la maison de Kanadjiguila à une clientèle composée majoritairement de femmes. Madame Adiaratou compte avoir avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 75 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé, pour être réinvesti dans l’activité et satisfaire les petits besoins du foyer.
texts.en:
Married for the most part in monogamous households, the four members of the Siguikafo group are on average 42 years old with five children. They all live in Kanadjiguila in the Mande municipality, which is part of the Kati Circle, and became acquainted through neighborhood ties and their income-generating activities at the Kanadjiguila market.

Group members are small retail merchants dealing in used clothing. In order to increase their stock-in-trade, the group decided to collaborate with Soro Yiriwaso and are in their third group loan cycle.

Mrs. Adiaratou (the woman standing on the left in the photo) is a great seller of used clothes. She intends to use her loan to buy two bales of used clothing in Medina. Retail sales are conducted at the market and from her home in Kanadjiguila to a clientele composed mostly of women.

With this loan Mrs. Adiaratou hopes to attain average monthly profits of 75,000 CFA francs, to be reinvested in the business and used to cover small household expenditures.

loans.use: buy used clothing

loans.name: Eross Joel

texts.es:
Eross es el mayor de tres hermanos y sera el primero de su familia en llegar a ser profesional. Proviene de un hogar de padres separados y su madre que trabaja de costurera en su casa es la única fuente de ingresos, ya que su padre no aporta a la economía familiar.
Su madre trabaja muy duro para poder mantener el hogar y Eross valora mucho el esfuerzo que realiza su madre para que el pueda acabar su carrera en administración industrial.
El pasa a segundo ciclo y la pensión de su instituto se a incrementado al doble, por lo que no podrá seguir estudiando dado que su madre no puede pagar dicho importe, esto de no contar con el apoyo de los prestamistas de Kiva.
Eross necesita una cuota menor para poder seguir estudiando, cuota que sera factible alcanzar de ser beneficiado con el apoyo que otorgan los prestamistas de Kiva, por lo que el desea darles las gracias al comprender su situación económica y su petición de apoyo para poder continuar.
El desea seguir con su carrera y hacer practicas pre-profesionales remuneradas mientras estudia, para así poder ayudar a su madre no solo con sus gastos de estudios, sino también con el costo del tratamiento y medicinas de su hermano menor que sufre del aparato respiratorio.
El desea en un futuro próximo ganar experiencia trabajando en una gran empresa y sueña con tener su propio negocio.
texts.en:
Eross is the eldest of three siblings and will be the first in his family to become a professional by graduating from university. Eross' parents are separated; his mother is a seamstress and the only source of income for the family as Eross' father does not contribute anything.

Eross mother works very hard to support the household. Eross greatly values the efforts that his mother makes in order for him to finish his degree in industrial management.

Eross is starting his second year and tuition fees have increased two-fold. He can therefore no longer continue to study as his mother cannot pay this amount of money, and Eross does not currently have the support of Kiva lenders.

Eross needs lower tuition fees in order to continue studying. This will be feasible if Eross is able to benefit from the support of Kiva lenders. Eross wants to thank lenders for understanding his financial situation and his loan application.

Eross wants to continue with his degree and do a paid internship while studying. This will help his mother with the costs of his education, and will help Eross' mother to pay for the costs of medication and treatment for Eross' younger brother, who has respiratory difficulties.

In the near future Eross would like to gain experience working for a large business. He dreams of having his own business.

loans.use: to achieve his dream of being the first professional in his family.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fertilisers.

loans.name: Oscar

texts.es: Oscar, tiene la edad de 38 años, está casado, vive con la esposa y dos hijos actualmenteque. Con su crédito pretende hacer la compra de fertilizantes, fungicidas y pagar mano de obra en trabajos de asistencia para el café, además de comprar algunas plantas de almácigo para hacer resiembras a inicio de lluvias esto con el objetivo de aumentar la densidad de plantas por área, además de aprovechar la buena fertilidad del suelo y las condiciones de clima y otras que favorecen al cultivo de café. Con estas mejoras al cultivo espera obtener un poco de ganancias y así mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia.  Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. Él no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en: Oscar is 38 years old, married and currently lives with his wife and two children. Oscar plans to use this loan in order to buy fertilisers and fungicides and to pay labourers to help with coffee crops. He will also buy copperwood plants to plant at the start of the rainy season. He will do this in order to increase the plant density in the area and take advantage of the fertile land and climate, which are good for the coffee crops. With these improvements, Oscar hopes to have a little profit and improve his family's living conditions. This is Oscar's first loan from "FUDECORSUR". He has not had any other loans with state banks and "FUDECOSUR" is providing this loan under better conditions and with much lower interest rates.

loans.use: to buy supplies and coffee.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy staple goods, such as beans, butter, hot chocolate, "arepas" and brown sugar loaves.

loans.name: Hakilissiguiton 5 Group

texts.fr:
Les 4 membres du groupe   Hakilissiguiton 5  sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 33 ans, 3 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles traditionnelles à Sincina-Sesso, un des villages de Koutiala, 3ème région administrative du Mali. Elles collaborent avec l’institution de micro finance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur neuvième prêt avec l’institution, les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est le Maïs avec  Djeneba , arrêtée au bout à droite sur la photo.
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter des intrants, des semences, des petits matériels agricoles et payer les frais de labour et de sarclage pour entretenir  2 hectares. 
La production sera vendue au niveau du village et à Koutiala, après la récolte, à une clientèle mixte. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 260 000FCFA en fin de campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The 4 members of the Hakilissiguiton 5 group are married women with an average age of 33 and, on average, 3 children. They all live in traditional families in Sincina-Sesso, one of the villages in Koutiala, the third administrative region of Mali. They are working with the MFI Soro Yiriwaso in order to be able to carry out their agricultural activities during the rainy season. This is their 9th loan from the institution, and they have properly repaid their previous loans.

Djeneba, standing on the right in the picture, grows maize. She plans to use her loan to buy agricultural inputs, seeds and small agricultural equipment, and to pay the labour costs for cultivating and weeding 2 hectares of land. After the harvest, the produce will be sold in the village and in Koutiala to a varied clientèle. She expects to make an average monthly profit of 260 000 francs per crop cycle. This profit will allow her to repay her loan and to support her husband with the daily expenses.

loans.use: to buy seeds, agricultural inputs, small agricultural equipment and to pay the labour costs for cultivating and weeding.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy ready-to-wear clothing.

loans.name: Mawupemo Telessou Group

texts.fr: Vomessi est membre du groupe Mawupemo dont la responsable est DJOGBEMA Akou. Vomessi  est mariée et mère de deux(02) enfants. Elle a commencé son petit commerce avec la vente des produits vestimentaires depuis 2007. Elle y ajoute l’achat et vente des produits d’alimentation générale, des bassines plastiques et s'approvisionne 8 fois par mois au grand marché de Lomé et revend par vente ambulante dans son quartier. Vomessi dispose de stock de produits alimentaires  et aimerait simplement augmenter son stock  afin de satisfaire ses clients. A cet effet, elle sollicite ce crédit pour l’achat d’une douzaine de bassines, 4 cartons de macaroni et 2 cartons de Mayonnaise. Les autres membres du groupe Mawupemo exercent aussi le petit commerce de produits alimentaires, de fruit, de légume, de pagnes et de céréales.la responsable du groupe et un des membres apparaissent sur  la photo du groupe mais n'ont pas demandé de crédit.
texts.en:
Vomessi is a member of the Mawupeno group, led by Djogbema Akou. Vomessi is married and the mother of 2 children. She started her small business selling clothing in 2007. She then started selling grocery products and plastic basins. She gets her supplies eight times a month from the Lomé Grand Market and makes her sales on the streets in her district. Vomessi would simply like to augment her current inventory of food products in order to be able to satisfy her customers and is therefore requesting a loan so that she can buy a dozen basins, 4 boxes of macaroni and 2 boxes of mayonnaise. The other members of the Mawupeno group are also small retailers of food products, fruit, vegetables, cereals and pagnes (highly colourful and decorative West African clothing).

The group leader and another member of the group are in the photo but have not requested this loan.

loans.use: to buy 12 plastic basins, 4 boxes of macaroni and 2 boxes of mayonnaise.

loans.name: Keneth

texts.en:
Keneth is a 35-year-old hard-working married man with three children (aged 10, 6 and 5) living in Kamwenge, Uganda.  His main business is cattle fattening alongside farming.  He started this business to educate his children.  He has hardships of inadequate capital and theft of his cows.  However, his vision is to become a modernized farmer and have educated children. 

He is requesting a loan to buy more cattle to sell.

loans.use: to buy more cattle to sell.

loans.name: Hope

texts.en:
Hope is a 38-year-old woman living in Kamwenge, Uganda.  She owns a boutique as her source of income plus cattle fattening.  She started this business to earn herself a living.  She has a personal goal of becoming a prominent businesswoman despite inadequate capital. 

She is acquiring credit to buy more clothes to sell.

loans.use: to buy more clothes to sell.

loans.name: Rovence

texts.en:
Rovence is a 38-year-old married woman with four children (aged 18, 15, 13 and 8) living in Kamwenge, Uganda.  She owns a boutique and sells clothes and bedding for a living alongside farming to earn herself extra income.  She started this business to look after her family.  She faces challenges of inadequate capital to meet her customers' demands.  Her dream is to diversify her business.

She intends to use the loan to buy more clothes to sell.

loans.use: to buy more clothes to sell.

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
Mercy is a 35-year-old married woman living in Kamwenge, Uganda.  She deals in the selling of milk as her main source of income alongside beekeeping. She started this business to earn a living and educate her children. She faces a number of challenges, including lack of capital and weather changes that stop customers from turning up, but has hopes of becoming a prominent business lady.

She is requesting a loan to buy another refrigerator for preserving her milk.

loans.use: to buy another refrigerator for preserving her milk.

loans.name: John Bosco

texts.en:
John Bosco is a 30-year-old hardworking married man with one child living in Kamwenge, Uganda.  He owns a retail shop alongside farming.  He started his business with an aim of looking after his family and educating his child.  His main hardship is inadequate capital.  However, he has hopes to become a prominent businessman.
 
He intends to use the loan to buy more sugar, boxes of soap and other items to sell.

loans.use: to buy more sugar, boxes of soap and other items to sell.

loans.name: Edward

texts.en:
Edward is a 46-year-old hardworking married man living in Kamwenge, Uganda.  He sells goat meat and that is where he gets his income.  He also practices agriculture.  He started the business to attain a personal goal of educating his children.  His main hardship is limited capital to buy more goats to sell.  He has hopes of having a big butchery.
  
He intends to use the loan to buy more goats for slaughtering.

loans.use: to buy more goats for slaughtering.

loans.name: Fred

texts.en: Fred is acquiring a loan to buy soft drinks, cooking oil, sugar and other items to sell. He is 35 years old and lives in Hoima, Uganda. He has a retail shop supplemented by a bar.  Poor roads make transportation of goods to his business expensive, thus increasing his operational costs and consequently reducing profits.  He hopes to expand his business.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks, cooking oil, sugar and other items to sell

loans.name: Rapheal

texts.en: Rapheal is a married man operating a retail shop alongside farming in Hoima, Uganda.  He desires to expand his business, although competition is still a challenge.  He will use the loan to buy salt and sugar to sell.

loans.use: to buy salt and sugar to sell.

loans.name: Harriet

texts.en: Harriet lives in Hoima, Uganda.  She is single with a 5-year-old child who is going to school.  She owns a retail shop and sells sugar, soap and matchboxes. She started her business to take care of her family.  Her major challenge is competition.  She is hardworking and will use the loan to buy more Irish potatoes and sugar to sell.

loans.use: to buy more Irish potatoes and sugar to sell.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en: Peter lives in Hoima, Uganda.  He is a 48-year-old married man with four children aged between 8 and 14 who all attend school.  He owns a retail shop and gets additional income from a nursery bed.  He started his business to improve his household income.  Lack of enough capital hinders his business.  He is an honest and hardworking man who will use the loan to buy more salt, sugar and soap to sell.

loans.use: to buy more salt, sugar and soap to sell.

loans.name: Markus
