texts.en: Markus is a 50 year old farmer from Dogon Awo. As a Babban Gona member, Markus is excited about the opportunity to finally have access to credit, good markets and a trained agronomist. Like all Babban Gona members, Markus can earn up to $2000/ha this season from growing maize, more than three times the average Nigerian farmer’s annual income. The average Babban Gona farmer yields 30 bags/hectare, double the national average of 14. However, Markus is ambitious and is aiming to reap 35 bags per hectare this season. When asked, Markus said “I plan to use the money I make to provide more food and clothing for my family, in 5 years, I want to ensure my children are educated and have professional jobs.” With this loan, Markus is on his way to achieving this dream.

loans.use: To access high quality inputs such as fertilizer and seed in order to double income and yield

loans.name: Hakilissiguiton 1 Group

texts.fr:
Les 10 membres du groupe   Hakilissiguiton 1  sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 30 ans, 3 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles traditionnelles à Sincina-Sesso, un des villages de Koutiala, 3ème région administrative du Mali. Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur neuvième prêt avec l’institution, les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est le  Maïs  avec  Sitan Seydou , assise au milieu sur la photo.
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter des intrants, des semences, des petits matériels agricoles et payer les frais de labour et de sarclage pour entretenir  2 hectares. 
La production sera vendue au niveau du village et à Koutiala, après la récolte, à une clientèle mixte. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 265 000FCFA en fin de campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The 10 members of the Hakilissiguiton 1 group are married women with an average age of 30 and, on average, 3 children. They all live in traditional families in Sincina-Sesso, one of the villages in Koutiala, the third administrative region of Mali. They are working with the MFI Soro Yiriwaso in order to be able to carry out their agricultural activities during the rainy season. This is their 9th loan from the institution, and they have properly repaid their previous loans.

Sitan Seydou, sitting in the middle of the picture, grows maize. She plans to use her loan to buy agricultural inputs, seeds and small agricultural equipment, and to pay the labour costs for cultivating and weeding 2 hectares of land. After the harvest, the produce will be sold in the village and in Koutiala to a varied clientèle. She expects to make an average monthly profit of 265 000 francs per crop cycle. This profit will allow her to repay her loan and to support her husband with the daily expenses.

loans.use: to buy seeds, agricultural inputs, small agricultural equipment and to pay the labour costs for cultivating and weeding.

loans.name: Yusuf

texts.en: Yusuf is a Babban Gona farmer from Dogon Awo. Yusuf expressed that he is driven by one goal; to “ensure my children are educated and have professional jobs.” It is the desire to fulfil this ambition that led Yusuf to join Babban Gona. Now, as a Babban Gona member, he finally has the opportunity to access credit, good markets and a trained agronomist. Like all Babban Gona members, Yusuf can earn up to $2000/ha this season from growing maize, more than three times the Nigerian farmer’s average annual income. The average Babban Gona farmer yields 30 bags of maize/hectare, double the national average of 14. However, Yusuf, is ambitious and is aiming to reap at least 35 bags per hectare this season. By doing so, Yusuf will finally have enough money to make significant life changes. When asked what he plans to do with his income from this season, he said: “I plan to use the money I make to expand my farmland”. With this loan, Yusuf will be able to access all the inputs and services to make this dream a reality.

loans.use: To purchase high-quality inputs in order to double maize yield and income

loans.name: Tout Est Grace Group

texts.fr: Nadouvi est membre du groupe TOUT EST GRACE  dont la responsable  est DEGBE Adjoavi. Mariée âgée 45 ans, elle a huit(08) enfants en charge. Elle a commencé son petit commerce de vente des habits des enfants et adultes depuis 2012. Elle s'approvisionne une fois par mois au grand  marché de Lomé  et par la vente ambulante, elle revend dans son quartier et ses environs puis au marché d’Assiyéyé. Nadouvi  aimerait  augmenter son stock  afin de satisfaire ses clients. A cet effet, elle sollicite ce crédit pour acheter  20 habits d’enfants et 25 pour adultes. Les autres membres du groupe TOUT EST GRACE  exercent aussi le petit commerce de fruit, de légume, de pagnes et de céréales.
texts.en: Nadouvi is a member of the "Tout est grace" group, led by Degbe Adjoavi. She is 45 years old, married and responsible for 8 children. She started her small business selling children's and adult's clothing in 2012. She gets her supplies once a month at the Grand Market in Lomé and makes her sales in the streets of her district and the surrounding area, and at the Assiyéyé market. Nadouvi would like to increase her inventory in order to be able to satisfy her customers. She is therefore requesting this loan in order to buy 20 items of clothing for children and 25 items for adults. The other members of the "Tout est grace" group are also small retailers, or fruit, vegetables, cereals and pagnes (highly colourful and decorative West African clothing).

loans.use: to buy 20 items of clothing for children and 25 items for adults.

loans.name: Sop Mame Diarra 1" Beug Manal Sa Bop" Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de crédit Sop Mame Diarra 1 » Beug Manal Sa Bop » est un sous groupe d’un réseau de femmes  commerçantes transformatrices de produits halieutiques. Il est composé de cinq femmes qui s’activent depuis plusieurs années et qui se sont regroupées pour bénéficier d’un appui financier qui leur permettra de renforcer leurs activités génératrices de revenus. La responsable, la dame Mame Gnilane, 54 ans, est une femme divorcée et mère de 2 enfants âgés respectivement de 34 et 29 ans. Elle s’active dans le commerce de tissus, la vente de produits aloès-vera et la vente de jus de fruits. Elle a une expérience de plus de 30 ans dans ce domaine. Mame Gnilane est divorcée et elle s’occupe personnellement de la dépense quotidienne et des charges de sa famille.
Dans l’avenir, elle veut ouvrir un grand magasin et améliorer son activité.
texts.en: The loan group "Sop Mame Diarra 1" Beug Manal Sa Bop" is a subgroup of a network of women who process and sell fish products. The group is made up of 5 women who have been in business for several years and who got together in order to be able to benefit from financial support enabling them to strengthen their revenue-generating activities. The group leader, Gnilane, is 54 years old, divorced and the mother of 2 children aged 34 and 29. She sells fabrics, aloe vera products and fruit juice. She has been in this line of work for over 30 years. Gnilane is divorced and covers the daily expenses and her family's expenditures herself. In the future, she would like to open a big shop and improve her business.

loans.use: to buy aloe vera products and fabrics for resale.

loans.name: Angela Maria

texts.es:
La señora Angela desde muy joven se dedico a las funciones del campo tales como agricultura y cría de animales, actividades que le enseño su padre para su supervivencia.

Hoy en día su actividad principal es la cría de pollos de engorde y levante teniendo como objetivo aumentar su capital comprando gallinas ponedoras y realizando adecuaciones a su galpón.

Es una madre responsable y amorosa con sus hijos, vive en una finca con ellos y su esposo.
De este negocio depende sus supervivencia ya que su esposo no tiene un trabajo estable.

Sueña con poder otorgarles a sus hijos una educación de calidad para que más adelante se puedan defender solos y sean independientes.

Todos los días asiste su negocio y procura por hacer las cosas muy bien.

Con el apoyo a este préstamo impactaras efectivamente la vida de una mujer humilde y trabajadora del campo Colombiano.
texts.en:
Ángela has been working in agriculture and raising animals since she was very young. Her father taught her these activities, thinking of her subsistence. Her main activity is raising broilers, but she wants to increase her working capital by buying laying hens and improving her pens.

She is a responsible and loving mother. She lives with her family in a farm. Their subsistence depends on this business, since her husband does not have a fixed job.

Her dream is to be able to pay for a good education for her children, so that they can be independent in the future. She works every day and always tries to do a good job.

This loan will definitely have a positive impact on the life of a humble and hardworking woman from the Colombian countryside.

loans.use: to buy laying hens and to improve her pens.

loans.name: Lucrecia Del Carmen

texts.es: Doña Lucrecia es una persona responsable, trabaja para el estado desde hace muchos años desempeñándose como administradora del Minsa ella viaja semanalmente a una distancia de aproximadamente unos 150 kilómetros para trasladarse a su centro de trabajo.  No tiene hijos que mantener solo sus dos hermanos mayores que habitan con ella, su esposo es pequeño agricultor y es el esta mas al cuidado de la vivienda cuando doña Lucrecia sale a trabajar ambos han luchado para poder construir su vivienda, doña Lucrecia cuenta con una parte del material como son los perlines para iniciar la construcción en proyecto, solicita este crédito para Comprar cemento, arena, piedrin, hierro y pagar mano de obra para construir un anexo  que ocupará de dormitorio ya que actualmente solo tiene uno y necesita otro para sus dos hermanos que habitan con ella.  Su deseo es contar con buenas condiciones en su hogar y seguir apoyando a sus hermanos que lo necesitan.
texts.en: Lucrecia is a responsible person. She has worked for the state for many years as an administrator in the Ministry of Health. She travels every week a distance of about 150 kilometers to get to her work center. She doesn't have any children to support, only her two older brothers who live with her. Her husband is a small farmer and he is more in charge of the house work when Lucrecia goes to work. They both have struggled to be able to build their house. Lucrecia has a little bit of the material, such as rods to begin the project. She is asking for this loan to buy cement, sand, gravel, and iron, as well as to pay for the labor in order to build an addition which will have a bedroom. Right now they only have one and she needs another one for her two brothers who live with her. Her wish is to have good conditions in her home and keep giving her brothers support because they need it.

loans.use: to buy construction materials.

loans.name: Satymbubu

texts.ru: Сатымбубу 63 года, замужем, есть взрослый сын. У Сатымбубу среднее образование, она всегда в хорошем расположении духа, старается добиваться всего своими силами, умеет планировать и использовать денежные средства. В поисках дополнительного источника дохода для своей семьи, более 20 лет назад начала свой бизнес по животноводству. На сегодняшний день в ее хозяйстве имеется 6 коров, 55 овец и коз. Для дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Сатымбубу обратилась в Банк «Бай – Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 2,800 долларов (USD) на покупку бычков и нетелей. Доходы от кредита Сатымбубу планирует использовать для постройки большого сарая.
texts.en: Satymbubu is 63 years old and she is married with one grown son.  She has a high school education and she is always in a good mood and trying to achieve everything she can - she is able to make plans and use money wisely.  In search of an additional source of income for her family, Satymbubu started her business raising livestock 20 years ago.  Today her farm has six cows and 55 sheep and goats.  To develop her business further, Satymbubu has turned to Bai Tushum bank for a loan of 2,800 dollars (USD) to buy bulls and calves.  She plans to use the income from this loan to build a large barn.

loans.use: To purchase calves and heifers for fattening and resale

loans.name: Rahila

texts.en: Rahila is a 35-year-old farmer from Dogon Awo.  As a Babban Gona member, Rahila is excited about the opportunity to finally have access to credit, good markets, and a trained agronomist.  Like all Babban Gona members, Rahila can earn up to $2000/ha this season from growing maize, more than three times the average Nigerian farmer’s annual income. The average Babban Gona farmer yields 30 bags/hectare, double the national average of 14. However, Rahila is ambitious and is aiming to reap 35 bags per hectare this season. When asked, Rahila said “I plan to use the money I make to educate my children: Emma, Mika,and Ruth, and ultimately, I want to ensure my children are educated and have professional jobs”. With this loan, she is well on her way to achieving this dream.

loans.use: To access high-quality inputs such as fertilizer and seed in order to double income and yield

loans.name: Moisés Natanael

texts.es:
Moisés tiene 31 años de edad, estudió hasta noveno, luego decidió entrar al cuartel para convertirse en soldado, lo cual lo ha logrado, su pareja se dedica a los oficios de la casa, tiene dos hijos que son menores de edad y se encuentran estudiando.


Él se desempeña como militar de la fuerza armada, desde pequeño soñaba con pertenecer a grupos de seguridad lo que logró poniendo de su esfuerzo y esmero, ya que no fue fácil pasar por tanta prueba, tiene más de 5 años de dedicarse a esta profesión, antes de ser militar era agricultor, sabe de todo tipo de trabajo en la tierra, la distancia que recorre es de 40 km, el recorrido lo hace en bus, su horario de trabajo es de 5:00 am a 4:00 pm.


El préstamo será invertido para pagar la mano de obra para la preparación de la  tierra hoy en época de siembra, también comprará los insumos entre ellos: abono, fertilizantes y herbicidas. 

Moisés sueña con tener siempre lo necesario para su familia, por lo que espera trabajar mientras Dios le regale salud y vida.
texts.en:
Moisés, 31, studied up till the ninth grade, when he decided to enroll in the army and become a soldier. His partner works as a housewife. They have two underage children who go to school.

He still works as a soldier. When he was a little boy, he dreamed of belonging to security forces. He achieved it by working hard; it was not easy to overcome all the obstacles. He has been working for more than five years with this activity, but before that he worked in agriculture. He knows a lot about agriculture. He has to travel 40 km by bus [25 miles] and works from 05:00 am till 04:00 pm.

He will use the loan to pay for the labor needed to prepare the land for sowing. He will also buy supplies such as compost, fertilizers and herbicides. His dream is to always be able to provide for his family, so he hopes that God gives him health and a long life to continue working.

loans.use: to pay for the labor needed to prepare the land for sowing and to buy supplies such as fertilizers and herbicides.

loans.name: Yakubu

texts.en: Yakubu is a maize farmer and member of Babban Gona. Yakubu joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for his  children: Audu, Dauda, and  Yohanao. Yakubu is excited that Babban Gona offers a lasting solution to ending the cycle of poverty. For the first time, Yakubu will have access to quality inputs such as fertilizer and seed. Without this loan, he would be subjected to buying these products in the open market where the products are not only very expensive but are often diluted with external products such as sand. With access to high quality inputs, Yakubu can reap up to 30 bags/hectare, double the national average of 14 and  earn up to $2000/ha: more than three times the average Nigerian farmer’s annual income.  When asked how he plans to spend the income he will make this year  as a Babban Gona member, he said, “I plan to use the money  to expand my farmland.” Yakubu is not thinking about this year alone; he expressed that his longterm goal is to “ensure my children are educated and have professional jobs”. With this loan, he is well on his way to achieving this goal.

loans.use: To access high-quality inputs such as fertilizer and seed in order to double income and yield.

loans.name: Johnson

texts.en: Johnson lives in Hoima, Uganda. He is age 33, married, and has 4 children aged 5 to 12 who all attend school. He is a farmer who gets additional income through alcohol distillation. He began business to improve his household income. He faces a challenge of limited capital. He is honest and needs a loan to purchase molorse (a raw material for making waragi).

loans.use: to purchase molorse (a raw material for making waragi).

loans.name: Kenzhetai

texts.ru: Кенжетай 51 года, замужем, мать 4 детей. У Кенжетай - среднее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи она занимается животноводством и полеводством, стартовав 30 лет назад, с покупки скота на 5,000 сом (KGS). Благодаря упорному труду Кенжетай, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 2 лошади, 2 коровы, 10 овец, а также собственная земельная доля мерою 1,20 ГА, на которой она ежегодно выращивает клевер и фасоль. Супруг Кенжетай работает водителем грузового автомобиля и активно помогает по хозяйству. Ежемесячный совокупный доход составляет 15,000 сом (KGS). Прибыль от ведения собственного бизнеса позволила начать строительство собственного дома, осталось только накрыть крышу и приобрести окна и двери. Для этого Кенжетай и обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 150,000 сом (KGS) на покупку и установку энергосберегающих пластиковых окон и дверей, цемента и кирпича. Кенжетай очень хочет, чтобы ее семья жила в большом просторном и уютном доме. Кенжетай планирует и дальше развивать свою сельскохозяйственную деятельность, так как ей нужно накопить средства на косметический ремонт дома и  откладывать средства на свадьбу старшего сына.
texts.en:
Kenzhetai is 51 years old and she is married with four children.  She has a high school education and she raises livestock and grows crops as the main source of income for her family.  She started this business 30 years ago with the purchase of livestock for 5,000 som (KGS).  Thanks to her hard work, Kenzhetai's farm now has two horses, two cows and ten sheep, as well as a 1.20 hectare plot of land, on which she grows annual crops of clover and beans.

Kenzhetai's husband works as a truck driver and he actively helps her around the farm.  Their combined monthly income is 15,000 som (KGS).  The income from running her own business has allowed Kenzhetai to begin constructing their own home - all that is left is to build the roof and to buy windows and doors.  For this reason, she has turned to Bai Tushum Bank for a loan of 150,000 som (KGS) so she can purchase and install energy-efficient plastic windows and doors, as well as cement and bricks.  Kenzhetai wants her family to live in a large, spacious and comfortable home.  She plans to expand her farming activities in the future, as she needs to save up money to make cosmetic repairs to her home and to set money aside for her eldest son's wedding.

loans.use: To purchase energy efficient plastic windows and doors as well as cement and bricks to build a roof so her family can conserve energy

loans.name: Gulsarakhon

texts.ru: 37-летняя Гулсарахон родом из села района Фархор. Ее муж строитель и работает на стройке в России. Сама Гулсарахон вместе с детьми осталась в районе и уже год как вместе с братом мужа занимается животноводством. Она приобрела достаточный опыт и теперь хочет отдельно начать свой бизнес по выращиванию крупнорогатых скотин. Старший сын будет помогать ей в этом. Так как Гулсарахон не имеет достаточного сбережения, она обратилась за кредитом, чтобы купить несколько голов крупнорогатых скотин и наконец начать бизнес. Она очень надеется, что кредиторы Kiva поддержат ее и дадут ей шанс реализовать свою цель.
texts.en: Gulsarakhon is 37 years old and she is from the Farkhor region.  Her husband is a builder and he does construction work in Russia.  Gulsarakhon remains in her native region with her children and she has been engaged in raising livestock with her brother-in-law for a year now.  She has gained enough experience and she now wants to start her own business raising cattle.  Her elder son will help her in this endeavor.  Since Gulsarakhon doesn't have enough savings, she has asked for a loan to buy a few cows and finally start her business.  She sincerely hopes that Kiva lenders will support her and give her a chance to achieve her goals.

loans.use: to buy a few cows to start her business

loans.name: Janyl

texts.ru: Джаныл 58 лет, замужем, мать 4 детей, они взрослые и самостоятельные, живут отдельно. У Джаныл среднее образование, вместе с супругом с 2004 года занимаются животноводством. В хозяйстве Джаныл имеется: 1 корова, 1 бычок и 10 овец. Деятельность Джаныл приносит ей прибыль в размере 6,000 сом (KGS) в месяц. Джаныл планировала продать скот и на эти средства закупить корм, однако передумала и решила обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на покупку сена и корма для скота. Доходы от кредита она хочет вложить в дальнейшее увеличение поголовья скота, а также накопить средства на свадьбу сына.
texts.en: Janyl is 58 years old and she is married with four children who are grown and live on their own.  She has a high school education and she has been raising livestock together with her husband since 2004.  Her farm now has one cow, one bull and ten sheep.  This business brings Janyl an income of 6,000 som (KGS) per month.  She had planned to sell her livestock and save up some feed with the income, but she rethought that idea and decided to turn to Bai Tushum bank for a loan of 50,000 som (KGS) to buy hay and feed for her livestock.  Janyl plans to use the income from this loan to further increase her head of livestock, as well as to save up money for her son's wedding.

loans.use: to purchase feed and hay for cattle so she can increase her head of livestock

loans.name: Janyl

texts.ru: Первый кредит Жаныл благополучно погасила, во второй раз обращается в Банк "Бай-Тушум" за кредитом в сумме 130,000 сом (KGS) для покупки бычков с последующей реализацией. У Жаныл 2 детей, но она, к сожалению, развелась с мужем, живет отдельно и ведет хозяйство в количестве 2 коров, 1 теленка и 25 овец, также обрабатывает 2,00 ГА арендованной земли, где выращивает ячмень и сено. Доходы от кредита Жаныл планирует вкладывать в дальнейшее развитие своего бизнеса, а также в воспитание и образование детей.
texts.en: Janyl paid of her first loan in time and she has now turned to Bai Tushum Bank for a loan of 130,000 som (KGS) to buy bulls for resale.  Janyl has two children, but unfortunately, she and her husband have divorced.  She lives on her own and she maintains a farm with two cows, one calf and 25 sheep, as well as a 2-hectare plot of land, on which she grows barley and hay.  Janyl plans to use the income from this loan to develop her business further so she can provide for her children and pay for their education.

loans.use: to purchase cows and steers in order to be more profitable so she can provide for her children

loans.name: Alisabatu

texts.en: Alisabatu is a 45-year-old farmer from Dogon Awo.  As a Babban Gona member, Alisabatu is excited about the opportunity to finally have access to credit, good markets and a trained agronomist.  Like all Babban Gona members, Alisabatu can earn up to $2000/ha this season from growing maize, more than three times the average Nigerian farmer’s annual income. The average Babban Gona farmer yields 30 bags/hectare,  double the national average of 14. However, Alisabatu is ambitious and is aiming to reap 35 bags per hectare this season. When asked, Alisabatu said “I plan to use the money I make to educate my children: Emma, Hassan, and Ketura, and in 5 years, I want to ensure other members of my community are lifted out of poverty”. With this loan, she is well on her way to achieving this dream.

loans.use: To access high quality inputs such as fertilizer and seed in order to double income and yield

loans.name: Maxwell

texts.en: Maxwell lives in Hoima Uganda. He is aged 23 married with one child aged 2. He owns a retail shop and raises extra income through brick laying. He began his business fout of necessity. Lack of enough capital and too much competition are his major challenges. He is a hard working and loving person who will use the loan to buy more soap, sugar, matchboxes for resale and to grow his brick laying side business.

loans.use: to buy more soap, sugar, matchboxes for resale and to grow his brick laying project

loans.name: Chona

texts.en:
Chona is 44 years old and married with two children. Chona works very hard to provide for them.

Chona runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items like canned goods, soft-drinks, noodles, cooking oil, beer, biscuits, sanitary pads, etc. to sell.

Chona has been in this business for 5 years and sells a variety of items such as canned goods, soft-drinks, noodles, cooking oil, beer, biscuits, sanitary pads, etc. 

Chona would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional items like canned goods, soft-drinks, noodles, cooking oil, beer, biscuits, sanitary pads, etc. to sell

loans.name: Flora

texts.en:
Flora is 54 years old and married with two children.

Flora works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell in her general store.

Flora has borrowed and paid 6 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 2 years and also earns an income from firewood and food vending.

Flora aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell in her general store

loans.name: Marivic

texts.en:
Marivic is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a food vending business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 22,000 through NWTF to buy ingredients like meat, vegetables, spices, fish, seasonings, etc. for her food production business.

Marivic has been in this business for 8 years. Marivic earns more income from her general store.

Marivic has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like meat, vegetables, spices, fish, seasonings, etc. for her food production business

loans.name: Gulnara

texts.ru: Гулнаре 50 лет, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают 4 детей. У Гулнары - среднее образование, с 1981года в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи, она занимается животноводством и полеводством. Благодаря упорному труду, в хозяйстве Гулнары на сегодняшний день имеется 2 коровы, 2 теленка, 100 овец. Также есть 2,80 ГА земли, где Гулнара выращивает 0,6 ГА капусты, 0,40 ГА перца и кукурузы, а на арендованной земле Гулнара выращивает многолетние травы. Гулнара реализует овощи на рынке, также продает молоко местным жителям. В целях расширения бизнеса Гулнара обратилась в Банк «Бай–Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 70,000 сом (KGS) на покупку удобрений, оплату услуг трактора за тюкование сена, и на покупку 2 бычков. Доходы от кредита Гулнара планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины и хочет накопить средства на покупку комбайна.
texts.en:
Gulnara is 50 years old and she is married with four children.  She has a high school education and, since 1981, she has worked in livestock and farming as the main source of income for her family.  Thanks to her hard work, Gulnara now has two cows, two calves and 100 sheep.  She also has a 2.80 hectare plot of land, where she grows .60 hectare of cabbage, .40 hectare of corn, and on the leased land she grows perennial grasses.  

Gulnara sells vegetables at the market and she also sells milk to the local residents.  With the goal of expanding her business, she has turned to Bai Tushum Bank for a loan of 70,000 som (KGS) to buy fertilizer, two bulls and to pay for the use of a hay-baling machine.  She plans to use the income from this loan to further increase her head of livestock and to save up for the purchase of a combine harvester.

loans.use: to purchase two steers and fertilizer so she can increase her profits and buy a harvester

loans.name: Bethel

texts.en:
Bethel works hard to support her family. Bethel is married and has a general store business in the Philippines.

Bethel requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stock like canned goods, bread, candies, biscuits, cooking oil, detergent soap, etc. to sell.

Bethel has been in this business for 3 years now.

Bethel would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional stock like canned goods, bread, candies, biscuits, cooking oil, detergent soap, etc. to sell

loans.name: Blesidita

texts.en:
Blesidita works hard to support her family. Blesidita is married and has a vegetable vending business in the Philippines.

Blesidita requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy more vegetables to sell in her vegetable stall.

Blesidita has been in this business for 6 years now.

Blesidita would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables to sell in her vegetable stall

loans.name: Rosalina

texts.en:
Rosalina is 42 years old and married with five children.

Rosalina works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 23,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store.

Rosalina has borrowed and paid 3 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 4 years and also earns an income from food vending.

Rosalina aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en:
Rosemarie is a married woman with four children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Rosemarie is 32 years old and three of her four children are currently in school.

Rosemarie has frozen foods business in the Philippines. Rosemarie requested a PHP 12,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more packs of frozen foods to sell to her customers.

Rosemarie has been in this business for 3 years. In the future, Rosemarie would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more packs of frozen foods to sell to her customers

loans.name: Vecelina

texts.en:
Vecelina works hard to support her family. Vecelina is married and has a used clothing business in the Philippines.

Vecelina requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy more used clothing to sell to her customers.

Vecelina has been in this business for 3 years now.

Vecelina would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more used clothing to sell to her customers

loans.name: Byrd

texts.en:
Byrd is 56 years old and married with one child who is still in school. Byrd works very hard to provide for her child.

Byrd runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 16,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional groceries like diapers, sanitary pads, noodles, canned goods, soft-drinks, shampoo and other groceries to sell.

Byrd has been in this business for 3 years and sells a variety of items such as diapers, sanitary pads, noodles, canned goods, soft-drinks, shampoo and other groceries. 

In the future, Byrd would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional groceries like diapers, sanitary pads, noodles, canned goods, soft-drinks, shampoo and other groceries to sell

loans.name: Maria Petronila

texts.es:
María, es soltera, vive con un nieto de 4 años de edad, ella disfruta mucho su papel de abuela, se dedica a vender panes con pollo, hot dog y diferentes bebidas, lo realiza desde hace cinco años, su horario es de cinco de la mañana a una de la tarde, lo prendió de su familia, su ventaja es que el negocio está ubicado cerca de su vivienda y por el momento no representa dificultades.
EL financiamiento lo utilizara para adquirir la materia prima, comprara agua, jugos, sodas, pan, pollo, salchichas y otros materiales para que su negocio continúe funcionando y generando ingresos con los que cambiara su estilo de vida familiar y cancelara la deuda adquirida.
Sus sueños son incrementar los productos que ofrece a sus clientes y tener mejores utilidades.
texts.en:
Maria is single and lives with her granddaughter who is 4 years old. She really enjoys being a grandmother. For the past five years she has made a living selling chicken sandwiches, hot dogs and different drinks, a profession she learned from her family. Her working hours are from five in the morning until one in the afternoon and she is lucky that the business is located near her house and for the moment doesn't cause any problems. 

She will use the loan to buy staple items. She will buy water, juice, soda, bread, chicken, hotdog sausages and other items to keep her business in operation and to generate an income with which she will change her family's lifestyle and pay off the debt she has acquired. 

Her dreams are to increase the products she offers her clients and to make a bigger profit.

loans.use: to buy water, juice, soda, bread, chicken, hotdog sausages and other items to keep her business in operation.

loans.name: Béatrice

texts.fr: Béatrice est mariée et mère de Trois(3) enfants à Agoè. Elle est âgée de 32 ans et exerce comme activité le commerce en vendant des chaussures. Béatrice s’approvisionne trois fois par mois au grand marché de lomé qu’elle revend dans son quartier et ses environs.Béatrice sollicite un prêt pour faire plus de stock de farine de chaussures afin de faire des bénéfices.
texts.en: Beatrice is married and mother of three children. They live in Agoe.  She is 32 years old and sells shoes.  She buys her supplies three times per month in the main market of Lome.  She resells in her neighborhood and nearby areas.  Beatrice is asking for a loan to buy more inventory of shoes in order to make a profit.

loans.use: to buy 10 pairs of flip-flops, 8 pairs of sandals, and 3 pairs of closed shoes.

loans.name: Divinita

texts.en:
Divinita is a married woman with two children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Divinita is 38 years old and has two children who are in school.

Divinita has a food vending business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 20,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Divinita has been in this business for five years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Elenita

texts.en:
Elenita is a married woman with nine children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Elenita is 44 years old and has four children who are currently in school.

Elenita has a weaving native mats business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 15,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more raw materials for her business.

Elenita has been in this business for three years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more raw materials for her business

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
As a married parent of eight children, Evangeline works hard to support her family.

She has a food vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from raising pigs. Evangeline is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy ingredients and materials for her food vending business.

Evangeline has been sustaining her business activities through her past three loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients and materials for her food vending business

loans.name: Celia

texts.en:
Celia is 48 years old and married with three children.

Celia works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store.

Celia has borrowed and paid five loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for three years, and also earns an income from food vending.

Celia aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Emelita

texts.en:
Emelita is 41 years old and married with two children.

Emelita works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items like vinegar, salt, sugar, coffee, cooking oil, detergent soap, canned goods, etc. to sell.

She has borrowed and paid five loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for three years, and also earns an income from motorcycle transport.

Emelita aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional items like vinegar, salt, sugar, coffee, cooking oil, detergent soap, canned goods, etc. to sell

loans.name: Akou

texts.fr: Akou est mariée et mère de quatre(4) enfants, résidant dans le quartier d’Agoè. Elle est âgée de 46 ans et exerce comme activité la vente des produits d’alimentation générale. Elle s’approvisionne quatre fois par mois au grand marché de Lomé puis revend à domicile. Akou sollicite un prêt pour faire plus de stock de 2 bidons d’huile végétale, 2 sacs de riz et 5 cartons de tomate en boite afin de satisfaire les clients et faire des bénéfices considérables.
texts.en: Akou is married and mother of four children. They live in the Agoe district. She is 46 years old and sells food products.  She buys her supplies four times per month in the main market in Lome for resale at home.  Akou is asking for a loan to buy more inventory (2 containers of vegetable oil, 2 bags of rice, and 5 boxes of canned tomatoes) in order to satisfy her customers and earn a significant profit.

loans.use: to buy 2 containers of vegetable oil, 2 bags of rice, and 5 boxes of canned tomatoes.

loans.name: Yahaya Jakada

texts.en: Yahaya Jakada is a Babban Gona farmer from Tawakiri. Yahaya Jakada expressed that he is driven by one goal: to “become the most profitable farmer in my community.” It is the desire to fulfil this ambition that led Yahaya Jakada to join Babban Gona. Now, as a Babban Gona member, he finally has the opportunity to access credit, good markets and a trained agronomist. Like all Babban Gona members, Yahaya Jakada can earn up to $2000/ha this season from growing maize, more than three times the Nigerian farmer’s average annual income. The average Babban Gona farmer yields 30 bags of maize/hectare, double the national average of 14. However, Yahaya Jakada is ambitious and is aiming to reap at least 35 bags per hectare this season. By doing so, Yahaya Jakada will finally have enough money to make significant life changes. When asked what he plans to do with his income from this season, he said: “I plan to use the money I make to provide more food and clothing for my family”. With this loan, Yahaya Jakada will be able to access all the inputs and services to make this dream a reality.

loans.use: To access high-quality inputs such as fertilizer and seed in order to double income and yield.

loans.name: Christine

texts.fr: Mariée  âgée de 25 ans, Christine est mère de deux(02) enfants dans le quartier d’Agoè. Elle fait le commerce de poisson comme activité, en achetant  des poissons congelés qu’elle fume à la maison. Christine revend par vente ambulante dans son quartier et les quartiers voisins en s’approvisionnant trois fois  par mois dans une boutique du quartier. Christine sollicite un microcrédit  pour augmenter son commerce avec 4 cartons de poissons afin de faire plus de bénéfices.
texts.en: Christine is 25 years old, married, and mother of two children. They live in the Agoe district. She is in the business of selling fish. She buys frozen fish, smokes them at home, and is a traveling reseller in her neighborhood and surrounding areas.  She buys supplies three times per month in a neighborhood store.  She is asking for a loan to grow her business by buying four boxes of fish in order to earn more profit.

loans.use: to buy 4 boxes of fish.

loans.name: Haruna

texts.en: Haruna is a Babban Gona farmer from Tawakiri. Haruna expressed that he is driven by one goal: to “become the most profitable farmer in my community.” It is the desire to fulfil this ambition that led Haruna to join Babban Gona. Now, as a Babban Gona member, he finally has the opportunity to access credit, good markets and a trained agronomist. Like all Babban Gona members, Haruna can earn up to $2000/ha this season from growing maize, more than three times the Nigerian farmer’s average annual income. The average Babban Gona farmer yields 30 bags of maize/hectare, double the national average of 14. However, Haruna is ambitious and is aiming to reap at least 35 bags per hectare this season. By doing so, Haruna will finally have enough money to make significant life changes. When asked what he plans to do with his income from this season, he said: “I plan to use the money I make to provide more food and clothing for my family”. With this loan, Haruna will be able to access all the inputs and services to make this dream a reality.

loans.use: To access high-quality inputs such as fertilizer and seed in order to double income and yield.

loans.name: Lucena

texts.en:
Lucena is 53 years old and married with five children.

Lucena works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items such as milk, coffee, juice, soft drinks, sanitary pads, bread, detergent soap, canned goods, etc. to sell.

Lucena has borrowed and paid five loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for four years and also earns an income from food-vending and farming rice.

Lucena aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional items such as milk, coffee, juice, soft drinks, sanitary pads, bread, detergent soap, canned goods, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Daniel Kargo

texts.en: Daniel Kargo is a 27-year-old farmer from Kargo.  As a Babban Gona member, Daniel Kargo, is excited about the opportunity to finally have access to credit, good markets and a trained agronomist. Like all Babban Gona members, Daniel Kargo can earn up to $2000/ha this season from growing maize, more than three times the Nigerian farmer’s average annual income. The average Babban Gona farmer yields 30 bags/hectare; double the national average of 14. However, Daniel Kargo is ambitious and is hoping that as a result of this loan, he will be able to acces quality inputs such as fertilizer and improved seeds that will  result in a yield of at least 35 bags of maize per hectare this season.  Daniel Kargo is hopeful about what the future holds; he  hopes that with the increased income as a result of a high yield, he will finally be able to afford to educate his children; Livingston,  and  Mercy. Daniel Kargo’s dreams do not end here: “ultimately, I want to make more money for myself and my family”, he expressed.

loans.use: To purchase high-quality inputs in order to double maize yield and income

loans.name: Irimiya

texts.en: Irimiya is a 35-year-old farmer from Kargo.  As a Babban Gona member, Irimiya, is excited about the opportunity to finally have access to credit, good markets and a trained agronomist. Like all Babban Gona members, Irimiya can earn up to $2000/ha this season from growing maize, more than three times the Nigerian farmer’s average annual income. The average Babban Gona farmer yields 30 bags/hectare; double the national average of 14. However, Irimiya is ambitious and is hoping that as a result of this loan, he will be able to acces quality inputs such as fertilizer and improved seeds that will  result in a yield of at least 30 bags of maize per hectare this season.  Irimiya is hopeful about what the future holds; he  hopes that with the increased income as a result of a high yield, he will finally be able to afford to educate his children; Favour,  and  Sule. Irimiya’s dreams do not end here: “ultimately, I want to make more money for myself and my family”, he expressed.

loans.use: To purchase high-quality inputs in order to double maize yield and income

loans.name: Veronica A.

texts.en:
What Veronica sells is more than just candy. She sells memories, culture and nostalgia. She fulfills a longing of Mexican immigrants in Dallas who want to feel connected to their childhood homes and offers artifacts from their homeland and childhood to their children or grandchildren. 

For two years, Veronica has owned and operated "Dulce Land", which imports Mexican candy brands, such as De la Rosa, Lucas, Montes, Jovy, Azteca, and others. She packages them as mixed varieties and sells them to retailers. She sells collections of lollipops, 1-pound and 2-pound variety bags, and 5- and 10-pound piñata packages.

“Many people who are in their 30s, 40s and 50s grew up watching El Chavo de Ocho, and everybody remembers the commercials during the breaks for the brands of candy that are popular in Mexico,” Veronica says. “So when they see the candy, they’ll say, ‘I haven’t seen these candies since I was little.’ And they’ll buy the candy because it’s what we knew when we were children in Mexico. What they say is that what I am really selling is nostalgia.”

The nostalgia business is brisk and growing for Veronica. Currently, Veronica distributes candy to a Dallas-based Latin American supermarket chain and another chain of import cash and carry stores. She says recently she contracted with another Latin American supermarket that has stores in Dallas and Austin and will be increasing her business by more than 50 percent.

“I am so happy to be able to grow my business, and it’s a business that I love,” Veronica says. “It makes me so happy to know that when someone walks into a store and they buy a piñata and they buy a piñata mix, that children will be happy breaking the piñata and picking up my candy.”

Veronica sought a loan with Accion Texas so she could ramp up her business. She needed credit to make a large purchase of candy.

“If I didn’t get this loan, I couldn’t have grown my business,” Veronica says.

loans.use: to make a large inventory purchase that would enable her to scale up her business in imported Mexican candy.

loans.name: Saratu

texts.en: Saratu is a maize farmer from Kargo.  As a Babban Gona member, Saratu, is excited about the opportunity to finally have access to credit, good markets and a trained agronomist. Like all Babban Gona members, Saratu can earn up to $2000/ha this season from growing maize, more than three times the Nigerian farmer’s average annual income. The average Babban Gona farmer yields 30 bags/hectare; double the national average of 14. However, Saratu is ambitious and is hoping that as a result of this loan, she will be able to access quality inputs such as fertilizer and improved seeds that will  result in a yield of more than 30 bags of maize per hectare this season.  Saratu is hopeful about what the future holds; she  hopes that with the increased income as a result of a high yield, she will finally be able to afford to educate her children; Livingstone, and  Danasabe. Saratu’s dreams do not end here: “ultimately, I want to make more money for myself and my family”, she expressed.

loans.use: To purchase high-quality inputs in order to double maize yield and income

loans.name: Sule Fulani

As a Babban Gona member, Sule Fulani, is excited about the opportunity to finally have access to credit, good markets and a trained agronomist. Like all Babban Gona members, Sule Fulani can earn up to $2000/ha this season from growing maize, more than three times the Nigerian farmer’s average annual income. The average Babban Gona farmer yields 30 bags/hectare; double the national average of 14. However, Sule Fulani is ambitious and is hoping that as a result of this loan, he will be able to access quality inputs such as fertilizer and improved seeds to increase his yield beyond 30 bags of maize per hectare this season.  Sule Fulani is hopeful about what the future holds; he  hopes that with the increased income as a result of a high yield, he will finally be able to afford to educate his children; Iro, and Sabo. Sule Fulani’s dreams do not end here: “ultimately, I want to make more money for myself and my family”, he expressed.

loans.use: To purchase high-quality inputs in order to double maize yield and income

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more products for her store.

loans.name: Eyad

texts.en:
Eyad is a 20-year-old single young man from Attell, a village near Tulkarm. He works with his family on their agricultural land. They plant seasonal crops using greenhouses to ensure they have good quality. 

Eyad took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to rebuild the greenhouses on the family farm. By taking this loan, Eyad will be able to improve the farm and increase its productivity. 

Eyad appears in the photo on the family farm.

loans.use: to rebuild the greenhouses on the family farm.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more raw materials and chemicals for his business.

loans.name: Rani

texts.en:
Rani is a 23-year-old single man from Qalqilya. He lives with his family in a small house. Rani works as a graphic designer and he is very talented. He also helps his father in a barber shop he owns. This barber shop has been open for the past seven years. It is a good business and earns a good income

Rani took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy new tools and make new decorations for the barber shop. By taking this loan, Rani will be able to improve the family business and attract more clients. 

Rani appears in the photo in the barber shop.

loans.use: to buy new tools and make new decorations for the barber shop.

loans.name: Lili

texts.en:
Lili is a 30-year-old housewife from a small village, Khalpara in the Jalpaiguri district. She lives with her husband, Amal, and two little school-going kids who are attending primary school. Lili has a primary education, and her husband attended up to grade 8. They were deprived of further education due to the poor financial resources of their parents.

Lili's husband works on their own agricultural land, grows different kinds of vegetables and makes earnings for their family of four, including two primary-school-going children. As the income is scanty, it is far from enough to meet all the household expenses. So, they are seeking financial help to cultivate a crop to create a sustainable income source that will see her children through school and higher studies. They have decided to cultivate paddy on their farmland, which is a profitable business.

So Lili is requesting a loan from BJS (Kiva’s partner) to buy seeds, fertilizers, compost, herbicides, etc., to be able to have a better quality of harvest, which will earn good revenue. Through the loan, they will have a better quality of life without limitations.

Lili aspires to acquire more land with the profit. She thanks both BJS and Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase good quality paddy seeds and other necessary agricultural supplies for cultivating paddy.

loans.name: Rahana

texts.en:
Rahana is only 27 years old and a woman from Dhupguri. She is staying with her husband, Faridul, and two little daughters. They live in a remote village, Bhangapara of Dhupguri in Jalpaiguri district. She studied till grade 9, but her husband is illiterate and can sign his name only. Their daughters are in grade 3 and grade 1.

Her husband is a farmer and has been involved in the activity of cultivation for a long time. He is engaged in vegetable cultivation, especially potatoes and many other different kinds of vegetables, to alleviate their poverty. Rahana is a housewife who manages household activities and in her spare time helps her husband so they could run their businesses and personal lives smoothly. Currently, their business does not provide much profit to give their family a financial sustenance.

Rahana, along with her husband, requested a loan from Kiva's partner BJS to purchase standard-quality seeds and fertilizers for her paddy cultivation. She has a very good relationship with her customers, as she supplies her products on time to her customers at a cheaper rate. She hopes the paddy cultivation business will be a successful one.

She hopes to build a house for her family, and so she is very grateful to Kiva for this opportunity.

loans.use: To purchase agricultural supplies for paddy cultivation.

loans.name: Rina

texts.en:
Rina is a woman of 29 years who lives in Dhupguri with her husband and two sons. She has an elementary education, and her husband is illiterate but able to sign his name. One of her children goes to school, and the other is too young for school. They live in a remote village, West Magurmari in Jalpaiguri district, in their own kachha house (a house made of straw and mud).

Her husband is a farmer, farming different kinds of vegetable crops, fruits, etc., to sell in the local market. They are from a humble family of scarce economic resources, and that is why Rina’s husband has been working with agriculture for many years.

Due to their low income, Rina is unable to manage her family expenses properly. Her husband is struggling hard all day, but fails to earn according to the expectation, so Rina requested a loan from BJS (Kiva’s Partner) to purchase seeds, fertilizers and pesticides for cultivating paddy in the same field to increase the family income.

She is very ambitious and hopeful that she will succeed in her target of fulfilling the villagers' great demand for paddy, it being the staple food. She hopes to upgrade her financial status with the profit of her business. She dreams to acquire more agricultural lands with the profit generated.

She is thankful to BJS and Kiva for the loan.

loans.use: To purchase seeds and fertilizers for cultivation of paddy rice.

loans.name: Juan Antonio

texts.es:
Juan tiene 44 años de edad, estudió hasta noveno grado, está casado y su esposa se dedica a los quehaceres de la casa, es padre de cuatro hijos todos menores de edad, están en la estudiando y dependen de él.
 

Él es motorista, cobrador y dueño de una ruta de pickup, siendo esta su principal fuente de ingresos, tiene más de 4 años de dedicarse a esta actividad, el horario de trabajo es de 5:00 am a 4:00 pm.


El préstamo será invertido para pagar una deuda a una persona particular, ya que tuvo un momento de necesidad y recurrió a esa persona para que le prestara dinero.

Él sueña con tener lo necesario para su familia mientras Dios le de salud y vida.
texts.en:
Juan is 44 years old and studied up to ninth grade. He is married, and his wife is a homemaker. He is the father of four minor children, who are in school and depend on him. 
He is a driver, debt collector, and owner of a pickup route—this is his main source of income. He has been doing this for more than 4 years. The hours are from 5:00 am to 4:00 pm. 
The loan will be used to pay a private debt, as he had a time of need and turned to someone to lend him money. 
He dreams of providing for his family as long as God keeps him alive and healthy.

loans.use: to pay a private debt, as he had a time of need and turned to someone to lend him money.

loans.name: Matha

texts.en: Matha is a 35-year-old farmer from Kargo.  As a Babban Gona member, Matha, is excited about the opportunity to finally have access to credit, good markets and a trained agronomist. Like all Babban Gona members, Matha can earn up to $2000/ha this season from growing maize, more than three times the Nigerian farmer’s average annual income. The average Babban Gona farmer yields 30 bags/hectare; double the national average of 14. However, Matha is ambitious and is hoping that as a result of this loan, she will be able to acces quality inputs such as fertilizer and improved seeds that will produce more than 30 bags of maize per hectare this season.  Matha is hopeful about what the future holds; she  hopes that with the increased income as a result of a high yield, she will finally be able to afford to educate her children; Godiya,  and  Mika. Matha’s dreams do not end here: “ultimately, I want to make more money for myself and my family”, she expressed.

loans.use: To purchase high-quality inputs in order to double maize yield and income

loans.name: Sefkija

texts.en:
Sefkija comes from one of the minority communities in Kosovo. He is married and a father of three children. Sefkija provides the main source of income for his family, and in order to earn a living, he operates his own business selling hamburgers and kebap (kebab), which he has been doing for a long time. 

However, the money Sefkija earns is not enough for him to be able to complete some renovations needed for his restaurant. For this reason, he would like a loan so that he can make some repairs and changes to his business that will increase and improve the income. He is grateful for this opportunity and wants to thank all of the lenders for their support. Knowing that this is a Kiva loan, he appreciates the support.

loans.use: To make some repairs and changes to his restaurant

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad is a 28-year-old single young man from Attell, a village near Tulkarm. He works with his family on their agricultural land. They plant seasonal crops using greenhouses to ensure they have good quality. He has been working in this field for the past five years. 

Mohammad took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy seedlings and fertilizer for the family farm. By taking this loan, Mohammad will be able to improve the farm and increase its productivity. 

Mohammad appears in the photo on the family farm.

loans.use: to buy seedlings and fertilizer for the family farm.

loans.name: Montaser

texts.en:
Montaser is a 26-year-old single young man from Attell, a village near Tulkarm. He works with his family in their agricultural land. They plant seasonal crops using greenhouses to ensure they have good quality. He has been working in this field for the past three years. 

Montaser took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy new greenhouses and expand the land. By taking this loan, Montaser will be able to improve the farm and increase its productivity.
 
Montaser appears in the photo on the family farm.

loans.use: to buy new greenhouses and expand the land

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a new milk cow so he can use the milk and the other dairy products for his family’s nutritional needs and to reduce and cut costs to their food expenses

loans.name: Marcilia Rosa

texts.es:
Marcila es la orgullosa madre de 6 hijos los cuales educar y alimentar fue muy difícil pues los ingresos que aportaba su pareja no eran suficientes y fue desde entonces que Marcila inicio con su negocio de confección la cual aprendió empíricamente viendo y practicando con una máquina que tiene en su hogar.

Solicita un crédito para la compra de tela, pues tiene su propia línea de ropa que distribuye en almacenes aunque en pocas cantidades pero es suficiente para cubrir deudas y darle un bocado de comida a sus hijos. 

Sueña con tener un gran taller de confección con muchos empleados y más aún que esta profesión esta tan escasa. 

Para ella el crédito es de vital importancia pues podrá seguir trabajando ya que hoy en día no cuenta con materia prima para confeccionar
texts.en: Marcila is a proud mother of 6 children. Feeding and educating them has been very difficult as her partner's income is not sufficient. So Marcila started her sewing business which she learned by herself practicing on a machine she had in her house. She is requesting a loan to buy fabric, as she has her own line of clothing. She distributes them to stores although in limited quantities. It is sufficient enough to pay her debts and give some food to her children. She dreams of having a large sewing workshop with a lot of employees more so as this profession is quite scarce. For her the loan is of vital importance as today she does not have raw material to sew.

loans.use: to buy fabric to sew.

loans.name: Dragana

texts.en:
Dragana wants to thank all of the lenders for the first loan, which has been able to help her to purchase a new tractor. With this, she has been able to continue to plant and grow wheat and corn to sell. She has been very happy with her new tractor and was very satisfied with the loan process. 

Now, she is requesting a second loan to purchase new tools for her tractor, to make the work even more effective and efficient. She promises to pay on time and wants to thank all of the lenders.

loans.use: To purchase new tools for her tractor

loans.name: Maria Natividad

texts.es: María es una joven de 22 años de edad quien tiene un grado educativo de secundaria incompleta cursando hasta noveno grado debido a que sus padres no la quisieron apoyar para seguir estudiando ya que los recursos económicos no eran los mejores. Su esposo Jerson es quien le apoya en el trabajo de campo y de su matrimonio tienen dos hijos quienes aún están pequeños para poder involucrarlos en el negocio. La siembra y cultivo de café ha sido fuente de ingresos desde hace varios años por lo que tiene bastante conocimiento. El terreno sé que junto a su esposo trabaja lo heredo de sus abuelos. Sus clientes son los diferentes intermediarios de la zona los cuales están ubicada céntrica mente y con un fácil acceso. Su mayor preocupación son los diferentes cambios climáticos, las plagas una muy dañina es la roya y la broca la cual el año pasado afecto en gran cantidad las fincas. En esta ocasión ella solicita apoyo financiero para la compra de insumos agrícolas para poder prevenir que sus cultivos sean contaminados y deteriorados por los diferentes cambios climáticos y las enfermedades. Ella al igual que esposo tiene como meta que sus hijos sigan estudiando, obtengan un título universitario y que puedan defenderse en el futuro. Para con su negocio mantener la finca bien asistida ya existente y comprar más  terreno para sembrar café, también poder comprar un vehículo y hacer mejoras a su casa de habitacion lo cual es necesario.
texts.en:
María is a young, 22-year-old woman who did not complete secondary school. She attended school until then ninth grade because her parents did not want to support her studies since their financial situation was not great. Her husband Jerson supports her work in the fields and they have two children who are still too young to help with the business.

Planting and harvesting coffee has been a source of income for them for many years, so they are very knowledgeable. They inherited the land on which they work from their grandparents. Their customers are various intermediaries in the area who are centrally located and easily accessible. Their greatest worries include changes in the weather, and pests, like the very damaging blight and borers, which affected their fields greatly in the past year. 

She requests a loan to purchase agricultural supplies so that she will be able to prevent her crops from becoming contaminated and deteriorated by the different weather changes and pests. Her and her husband's goals include their children continuing to attend school to earn a university degree so that they can support themselves in the future. They would also like to maintain their farm, purchase more land on which to grow coffee, purchase a vehicle, and make necessary improvements to their home.

loans.use: to purchase agricultural supplies to help with her coffee crops.

loans.name: Lagimaina

texts.en:
Lagimaina is a 31-year-old unwed woman with 6 children. 

She makes and sells chicken, beef, and custard pies in her community to earn a living. She has 1 year of experience with this business. 

Lagimaina needs a loan to buy bags of flour, a large frying pan, soya sauce, onions, a new outdoor oven, foil, and paper plates. She plans to use her profits to pay for her familly's weekly expenses. Lagimaina has been a member of SPBD since 2014.

loans.use: to buy bags of flour, a large frying pan, soya sauce, onions, a new outdoor oven, foil, and paper plates

loans.name: Levalasi

texts.en:
Levalasi is a 31-year-old unwed woman with 4 children. 

She makes and sells pancakes in her community to earn a living. She has 1 year of experience with this business. 

Levalasi needs a loan to buy flour, sugar, a frying pan, cooking oil, yeast, plastic bags, and a jar of jam. She plans to use her profits to pay for her family's weekly expenses. Levalasi has been a member of SPBD since 2014.

loans.use: to buy flour, sugar, a frying pan, cooking oil, yeast, plastic bags, and a jar of jam

loans.name: Obaida

texts.en:
Obaida is a 23-year-old single young man from Qabatiya, a village near Jenin. He works with his family on their agricultural land where they plant seasonal crops. He has been working in this field for the past four years.

Obaida took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy farming tools and water pipes for the family farm. By taking this loan, Obaida will be able to improve the farm and increase its productivity.

Obaida appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy farming tools and water pipes for the family farm

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to help her and her husband to buy seeds and seedlings for the family farm

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy seeds and seedlings for the new season for the family farm.

loans.name: Tanja

texts.en:
Tanja is working in the cultural centre, and her husband works in an electrical company. They have two children who are students and they all live together in one of the minority communities of Kosovo. Because their combined salary is only enough to pay for their daily needs and their children’s education, they don’t have enough money left over to pay for any renovations. Their home is very old and has been in need of repair for some time now. 

For the first time, Tanja is requesting a loan in order to replace the doors and windows in their home. She hopes that this loan will improve their living conditions and help her to work towards her goal, which is to save money for her future and her children’s future. She promises to repay on time and is grateful for the opportunity.

loans.use: to replace the doors and windows of her home

loans.name: Tafaoata

texts.en:
Tafaoata is 22 years old and married with 2 children. She has a small vegetable garden where she grows cabbages and tomatoes that she can sell in her community or at the market. She has been doing this for 1 year. 

Tafaoata needs a loan to buy insect poison, fertilizer, a new wheelbarrow, a tiller, a rake, new gloves, and a watering hose. She has been a member of SPBD since 2014. 

Tafaoata will use the profits from her sales to pay for her family's weekly expenses.

loans.use: to buy insect poison, fertilizer, a new wheelbarrow, a tiller, a rake, new gloves, and a watering hose

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more raw materials to rebuild the greenhouses on his family's farm.

loans.name: Trebol Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “TREBOL” iniciará el cuarto tercer en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Guayaramerin, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Mahaly es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de prendas de vestir, venta de muebles, venta de comida, venta de abarrotes, venta de perfumes, repostería, servicio de limpieza.

Después de la inundación que hubo en Guayaramerin muchas microempresarias fueron afectadas, ya que perdieron gran parte de su mercadería y sus herramientas de trabajo. La señora Mahaly  indica que hace tres años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una amiga que es clienta de la institución; Ella cuenta que después de este desastre natural, que afecto a su familia,  ella decidió retomar su actividad económica, ya que es su única fuente de producción; el negocio que tiene es la venta de abarrotes y venta de carne, da a conocer que este negocio lo emprendió hace tres años, ya que en su barrio no existía este negocio pero la gente lo requería. 
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de víveres por mayor) que adquirirá de las vendedoras mayoristas de la ciudad y posteriormente implementará en su negocio. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia, ya que ella vive en concubinato y tiene tres hijos.  
Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el apoyo y el cuidado de su salud y de su familia que le ofrece la institución para restablecer su negocio con los consultorios médicos.
texts.en:
The “TREBOL” communal bank is starting their 4th cycle with Pro Mujer, as part of the Guayaramerin regional office. It is composed of eight members led by a board of directors with Mahaly as President. The businesses of the communal bank's members are varied amongst them are: the sale of clothing, furniture sales, food sales, selling groceries, perfume sales, selling pastries and a cleaning service.

After the flooding that occurred in Guayaramerin many micro-businesses were affected as they lost the greater part of their merchandise and their work tools. Mahaly says that she joined Pro Mujer three years ago on the invitation of a friend who is a client of the institution. She says that after the natural disaster which affected her family. she decided to restart her commercial activity as it is her only source of production. The business she has is selling groceries and meat. She says that she learned the business three years ago as there wasn't a similar business in her neighborhood and the people wanted one.

The loan that she is now taking out is to increase her working capital (buying supplies wholesale) that she will acquire from the wholesalers of the city and later sell in her business. This manner of work allows her to generate resources to support her family as she lives in a relationship and has three children.

When asked what she liked about pro Mujer she replies that she liked the support and the health services for her family that the institution provides to reestablish her business with medical visits.

loans.use: to buy supplies wholesale.

loans.name: Asolupe

texts.en:
Asolupe is 41 years old and married with 3 children. 

She has a small vegetable garden where she grows cabbages and tomatoes that she can sell in her community or at the market. She has been doing this for 1 year. 

Asolupe needs a loan to buy insect poison, fertilizer, a new wheelbarrow, a tiller, a rake, new gloves, and a watering hose. 

She has been a member of SPBD since 2014. Asolupe will use the profits from her sales to pay for her family's weekly expenses.

loans.use: to buy insect poison, fertilizer, a new wheelbarrow, a tiller, a rake, new gloves, and a watering hose

loans.name: Victor Alexander

texts.es:
Victor tiene 29 años de edad, estudió hasta 2º año de bachillerato, está acompañado y su esposa se dedica a vender tortillas, tiene un hijo que está estudiando 3º grado, con Victor vive su madre. 

Victor tiene una tortillería, tiene 5 años de dedicarse a este negocio, lo aprendió por medio de su mamá que toda la vida se ha dedicado a este negocio, con él trabaja su esposa. 

Él necesita el crédito para comprar maíz y para mejorar el local donde actualmente está vendiendo tortillas. 

Sus planes son que su negocio crezca y que pueda tener más ingresos para él y su familia.
texts.en: Victor is 29 years old and studied up to the second year of Secondary school. He is married and his wife works selling tortillas. He has a son who is studying in Grade 3. Victor's mother lives with them. Victor has a tortilla shop. He has been working in this business for 5 years and he learned it from his mother who worked at the business her whole life. His wife helps him with the work. He needs the loan to buy corn and to make improvements to the shop where he sells the tortillas. His plan is to expand his business so he can have more income for himself and his family.

loans.use: to buy corn and to make improvements on the place he sells tortillas.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy seeds and seedlings for the new season for his family's farm.

loans.name: Javier De Jesus

texts.es:
Javier es una persona muy simpática y siempre tiene una sonrisa para los clientes que visitan su cafetería.

Trabaja todos los días vendiendo productos como bebidas y algunos comestibles, además de frituras y cervezas; su negocio está ubicado en un pequeño modulo muy acogedor.

Gracias a su carisma y buen humor se ha podido ganar el corazón y reconocimiento de las personas del sector estadio de Medellín.

Todos los días trabaja para darle una buena calidad de vida  a su hijo de 19 años por el cual aspira a darle un excelente futuro.

Actualmente solicita un préstamo para la compra de estanterías y algunos elementos para la preparación de sus comestibles, estos comestibles son básicamente empanadas, pasteles, buñuelos, entre otros.

Con este crédito, Javier podrá seguir satisfaciendo los gustos de sus clientes.
texts.en:
Javier's a very nice person who always has a smile for the customers who visit his café.  He works every day selling products such as beverages and some food, as well as fried food and beer.  His business is located in a very welcoming little spot.

Thanks to his charisma and good humor he has been able to earn the heart and recognition of people in the stadium area of Medellín.  Every day he works to give his son, 19, a good quality of life; he wants to give him an excellent future.

Currently he's requesting a loan to buy shelving and some ingredients to prepare his dishes, which basically include empanadas, "pasteles" [traditional savory pastry], and "buñuelos" [fritters].

With this loan Javier will be able to keep on satisfying his customers' tastes.

loans.use: to buy shelving and cooking ingredients

loans.name: Amer

texts.en:
Amer is a 20-year-old single young man from Attell, a village near Tulkarm. He works with his family on their agricultural land. They plant seasonal crops using greenhouses. Amer has been working in this field for the past three years.

Amer took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy seeds and seedlings for the new season for the family farm. By taking this loan, he will be able to improve the farm and increase its productivity.

Amer appears in the photo on the family farm.

loans.use: to buy seeds and seedlings for the new season for his family's farm.

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad is a 29-year-old single young man from Qabatiya, a village near Jenin. He works with his family on their agricultural land. They plant olive trees. Mohammad has been working in this field for the past year.

Mohammad took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy olive seedlings for the new season for the family farm. By taking this loan, he will be able to improve the farm and increase its productivity.

Mohammad appears in the photo on the family farm.

loans.use: to buy olive seedlings for the new season for his family's farm.

loans.name: Anita

texts.en:
Anita is married and she has three children and she has a mini shop where many people come to buy every day. 

An $800.00 loan is requested so Anita can improve her business. She will buy some additional supplies such as trousers, shorts, jackets, and shirts (long sleeve and short sleeve). She has been involving herself in business activities since 2004. She feels so comfortable to run her business because she can earn money every day.

Running a business has made Anita independent because she can be responsible for herself and also help her family. She hopes to run a bigger business in the future.

loans.use: To buy trousers, shorts, jackets, and shirts (long sleeve and short sleeve).

loans.name: Adamu Boby

texts.en: Adamu Boby is a Babban Gona farmer from Shawai. Adamu Boby expressed that he is driven by one goal; to “make more money for myself and my family.” It is the desire to fulfill this ambition that led Adamu Boby to join Babban Gona. Now, as a Babban Gona member, he finally has the opportunity to access credit, good markets and a trained agronomist. Like all Babban Gona members, Adamu Boby can earn up to $2000/ha this season from growing maize, more than three times the Nigerian farmer’s average annual income. The average Babban Gona farmer yields 30 bags of maize/hectare, double the national average of 14. However, Adamu Boby, is ambitious and is aiming to reap more than 30 bags per hectare this season. By doing so, Adamu Boby will finally have enough money to make significant life changes. When asked what he plans to do with his income from this season, he said: “I plan to use the money I make to provide more food and clothing for my family”. With this loan, Adamu Boby will be able to access all the inputs and services to make this dream a reality.

loans.use: To purchase high-quality inputs in order to double maize yield and income

loans.name: Jairo Cesar

texts.es:
El señor Jairo siempre ha sido una persona independiente, años atrás manejaba una salsamentaría la cual tuvo que dejar por fuertes amenazas y constantes vacunas que le aplicaban. Después logro obtener un empleo de conductor pero el horario era demasiado extenso y la ruta era muy pobre por lo que gran gracias a la corporación quien le facilito un monto de dinero pudo comenzar con un negocios e venta de mercancía como perfumes, lociones, desodorantes, ropa para hombre y dama y conjuntos de niños, añadido a esto vende los fines de semanas papas fritas complementando sus ingresos. 
Quiere solicitar crédito para comprar mejor mercancía en ropa y lociones pues es la única fuente de ingreso que tiene en su hogar y mantiene a sus dos hijos y señora. 

Su sueño es poder tener un negocio estable y envejecer trabajando en su propio local.
texts.en:
Mr. Jairo has always been an independent person, some years ago he managed a meat-packing and charcuterie shop which he had to leave due to strong threats and constant extortion. He was then able to obtain employment as a driver, but the schedule was too extensive and the route was very poor.
