Therefore, thanks to the corporation who facilitated him an amount of money, he was able to start his merchandise sales business. He sells perfumes, colognes and deodorants, as well as men's, women's and children's clothing. Additionally, on weekends, he sells french fries to complement his income.

He wants to request a credit in order to purchase better merchandise in terms of clothes and perfumes as it is his household's only income stream and he provides for his two children and wife. 

His dream is to have a stable business and grow old working in his own locale.

loans.use: Purchase clothes for men and women, jeans, shirts, t-shirts, shorts, blouses and perfumes

loans.name: Maria

texts.es: Maria, tiene la edad  de 36 años, está casada, vive con el esposo y dos hijas que son su mayor prioridad. Con su crédito pretende hacer la compra de una navilla.Ella pretende poder sacar crias para hir aumentando el numero de animales y seguir creciendo con el proyecto de ganado de cria  y así mejorar las condiciones de vida de su Familia y también cumplir algunas metas.  Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. Élla no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Maria is 36 years old, married, and lives with her husband and two daughters who are her major priority. With her loan she wishes to purchase a heifer. She wants to produce calves to augment her number of cattle and continue her growth through this cattle raising project and, thus, to improve the conditions of life for her family and, also,  to reach certain goals.

This is Maria's first loan through FUDECOSUR. She has previously had no other loans from state banks, but FUDECOSUR has offered her the loan with all facilities and a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to buy a heifer to raise and sell.

loans.name: Anabelle

texts.en:
Anabelle is a married woman with two children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Anabelle is 29 years old and both of her children are currently in school.

Anabelle has a food vending business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for three years. Anabelle requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business. In the future, she would like to save enough money that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Analiza

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Analiza works hard to support her family. She has a business buying and selling ready-to-wear clothes in the Philippines. She also earns additional income from direct-selling personal collection products.

Analiza is borrowing PHP 16,000 through NWTF to purchase more stock of ready-to-wear items such as blouses, shoes, pants, etc. to sell. She has been sustaining her business activities through her past five loans from NWTF. Analiza hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of ready-to-wear clothes such as blouses, shoes, pants, etc. to sell

loans.name: Pedro

texts.es:
Pedro de 56 años de edad, estudió hasta 2º grado, está acompañado y ha procreado 3 hijos de los cuales 2 trabajan y uno está estudiando, de él depende una persona. 

Pedro se dedica a la agricultura, se ha dedicado al cultivo desde los 17 años, su padre le inculcó este negocio, y además realiza crianza de cerdos. 

Él utilizara el préstamo para comprar fertilizantes y también comprará ganado.

Sus planes son que su cultivo se desarrolle en buen estado y así tener más ingresos para él y su familia.
texts.en: Pedro is 56 years old and studied up to Grade 2. He is married and has 3 children, two of whom work and one is studying. Only one person is dependent on him. Pedro works in agriculture. He has been farming for 17 years. His father taught him this business. He also raises pigs. He will use the loan to buy fertilizer and also buy cattle. His plans are for his crops to grow well and have more income for himself and his family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and to buy cattle.

loans.name: Delfina

texts.en:
An $800 loan is offered to Delfina to improve her business. She is married and she has four children. She opened her kiosk in 2009 with her own effort and $700. 

Delfina will use this loan to buy stock to keep in her store like water, Coca Cola, Sprite, sagiko, eggs, bread, cigarettes, coffee, sugar, salt, and milk. She is generating a good income from selling things from her kiosk. Delfina has been thinking of running a big business after years of involving herself in this business. She lives in a town with her family.

loans.use: To buy water, Coca Cola, Sprite, sagiko, eggs, bread, cigarettes, coffee, sugar, salt, and milk

loans.name: Oscar René

texts.es:
El Sauce es un pequeño Municipio donde existen personas emprendedoras, con deseo de superar en su vida, es aquí donde habita el señor Oscar René De 65 Años. 

Oscar René Es un señor casado, cuenta con dos hijos bajo su cargo, con lo poco que el gana ayuda a mantener a sus hijos que tanto ama y estima. 

Su principal actividad es la venta de servicio, cuenta con dos molino uno eléctrico y el otro a base de combustible, esto son motores que ayudan a moler el maíz trigo, convirtiéndolo en masa para la elaboración de tortillas al mercado de consumo, y además muele arroz, cacao y cualquier otro complemento que sirva para la elaboración de fresco. 

 Se siente a Gusto con este tipo de actividad por lo que solicita un nuevo financiamiento para la compra de un motor de repuesto para sus molinos.  
 
El considera que esto sería de gran importancia por lo que ayuda a mantener mejor el servicio de sus clientes y así poder sacar adelante a su familia. 

Espera en Dios Una respuesta positiva y son de sus sueños llegar a obtener mejores condiciones en su trabajo.
texts.en:
El Sauce is a small municipality with many entrepreneurial people that wish to get ahead in life. This is where 65-year-old Oscar Rene lives.

Oscar Rene is married and has two children under his responsibility. With the little he earns, he helps support his two children, whom he loves and appreciates.

His main occupation is selling the services provided by two grinders: one is electric and the other one is fuel-powered. The grinders have engines that help grind corn and wheat, turning them into dough for making tortillas, which are later sold. They also grind rice, cocoa and any other supplement that is used for making soft drinks.

He feels satisfied with this occupation, which is why he is requesting a new loan to buy a spare engine for his grinders.

He considers that this would be of great use, as it would allow him to better maintain the service he provides to his customers and to get his family ahead in life.

He hopes God will provide a positive answer. His dream is to obtain better work conditions.

loans.use: to buy an engine for a grinder.

loans.name: Cecil

texts.en:
Cecil works hard to support her family. She is married and has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Cecil has been in this business for eight years now.

Cecil requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more fish to sell to her customers. She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to sell to her customers

loans.name: Maricel

texts.en:
Maricel is 29 years old and has two children. She is married and one of her children is still in school.

Maricel is in the agricultural business of pig fattening in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy piglets, feed, and vitamins for her business. Maricel has been in pig fattening for two years now, and has borrowed once in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Maricel would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy piglets, feed, and vitamins for her business

loans.name: Zulma Idalia

texts.es:
Zulma tiene 21 años de edad, estudió hasta bachillerato, está soltera y vive con sus 3 hermanas ya que están al cuidado de ella pues sus padres viajaron a los Estados Unidos para mejorar las condiciones de vida.


Zulma se dedica a los oficios domésticos, actividad que aprendió de su madre, ya tiene alrededor de 12 años de experiencia en esta actividad, sus padres la apoyan con lo necesario desde USA.


Ella invertirá el crédito para comprar productos de primera necesidad, ya que quiere tener una pequeña tienda para vender a los vecinos y también tener otra fuente de ingresos para ella y sus hermanas.

Ella espera que su negocio le genere ingresos para salir adelante ya que es una actividad nueva para ella.
texts.en:
Zulma is 21 years old and completed high school. She is single and lives with her three sisters, whom she supports since her parents went to the United States to seek better living conditions. Zulma works in domestic jobs, which she learned from her mother, and she has about 12 years of experience in this business. Her parents support her from the United States.

She will invest the loan in the purchase of convenience items since she wants to open a small store to sell products to her neighbors and to have another source of income for her and her sisters. She hopes that the business will generate income so that she can move forward, since it is a new business for her.

loans.use: to purchase convenience items because she wants to open a small store to sell products to her neighbors and to have another source of income for her and her sisters.

loans.name: Jose Antonio

texts.es:
José de 79 años de edad, no tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar, actualmente está soltero, tiene dos hijos que ya se acompañaron. 

José se dedica a la agricultura y a la ganadería, tiene 60 años de dedicarse a este negocio, lo aprendió por su familia que so lo inculcó desde pequeño a trabajar en el campo, el horario de su trabajo es de 7:00 am a 3:00 pm todos los días.

 El crédito lo utilizará para comprar una vaca parida. 

Su sueño es que su ganado se desarrolle en buen estado y así tener más ingresos en un futuro.
texts.en:
Jose, 79, did not have an opportunity to get an education.  At this time he is single, and is living with 2 of his children.

Jose works in agriculture and livestock production.  He's been in this line of work for 60 years.  He learned farming from his family, who taught him to work the fields as a child.  He works from 7am until 3pm every day.  

Jose will use this loan to buy a dairy cow.  His dream is to see his livestock develop in good condition so that he can have more earnings for his family.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow

loans.name: José Isidoro

texts.es:
José tiene 58 años de edad, estudió hasta 1º grado, está casado y su esposa se dedica a la crianza de aves de corral, tiene 5 hijos de los cuales los 5 trabajan en la agricultura. 

José se dedica a la agricultura desde pequeño y lo aprendió por sus padres, además se dedica a la carpintería. 
Su horario de trabajo es de 6:00 am a 6:00 pm. 

El crédito lo necesita para comprar fertilizantes para su cultivo. 

Él planea que su cultivo se desarrolle en buen estado y que tenga un rendimiento.
texts.en:
Jose, 58, has a first grade education.  He is married and his wife works raising barnyard fowl.  He has 5 children who all work in agriculture.

Jose has been farming since he was very young; he learned this trade from his parents.  He also works as a carpenter.  He works daily from 6am until 6pm.

Jose needs a loan to buy fertilizers for his crops.  His plan is to develop his crops in good condition so that he can have a high yield.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for his crops

loans.name: Juan Pablo

texts.es:
Juan se dedica al comercio de la distribución actividad que ha ejercido toda su vida distribuyendo productos en toda el sector con la ayuda de una moto que logro comprar gracias a un prestamos le cual tuvo muy buen habito de pago. 

Solicita un crédito para la compra de mercancía como rosquitas y papitas que serían básicamente Snack, con la ayuda de este crédito podrá hacer llegar sus productos a diferentes veredas y diferentes lugares ya que tendrá buenas existencias. 

Es padre de 3 hijos de 8, 14, y 17 años y sabe que por ellos tiene que luchar y darles la oportunidad de estudiar para que sean alguien en la vida. 


Sueña con tener un gran negocio con muchos distribuidores y forjarlo solo con personal necesitado de trabajo que valore lo que hace.
texts.en:
Juan works in the distribution sector, which he has been doing all of his life. He distributes products in his sector with the help of a motorcycle that he owns thanks to a loan, which he pays on time.

He requests a loan to purchase snack merchandise like rosquitas (pastries) and potatoes. With the help of this loan, he will be able to deliver his products to many different areas. 

He is the father of three children, ages 8, 14, and 17, and knows that he has to work hard for them and provide them with the opportunity to attend school so that they can make something of themselves.

He dreams of building a large business by himself with many distributors who value the work that they do.

loans.use: to purchase snacks like roscas (pastries) or fritters.

loans.name: Melissa

texts.es:
Melissa es una mujer joven de 19 años de edad, soltera sin hijos y su negocio es una tienda de barrio.
Ella es de carácter amigable, humilde, responsable, honesta, emprendedora, puntual y muy trabajadora. Su negocio lo realiza en el municipio de sacaba distante a 13 kilómetros de la ciudad de Cochabamba, su clima es cálido y medianamente húmedo.
Melissa es de tez morena, cabello negro largo estatura mediana, ella terminó sus estudios secundarios y por la necesidad de ayudar a su familia se dedicó al comercio pensando en realizar una carrera técnica cuando la situación económica de su familia mejore. Su rutina la realiza de lunes a sábado desde las seis de la mañana hasta las nueve de la noche, ella comienza su jornada muy temprano con la salida del sol, momento en que llega el repartidor de pan y deja sus canastas calientes llenas de pan recién horneado, seguidamente se ocupa de instalar su mostrador y acomoda producto por producto, para que sean atractivos para los posibles clientes. Melissa tiene metas, objetivos y sueños; uno de ellos es realizar una inversión en un nuevo negocio para incrementar sus ventas y tener un trabajo estable y rentable.
Es por esos motivos que Melissa solicita un préstamo para invertir en mejorar su negocio y ayudar a su familia.
texts.en:
Melissa is a young 19 year old woman who is single with no children. Her business is a neighborhood store. She has a friendly character and is humble, responsible, honest, enterprising, punctual and hard-working. Her business is located in Sacaba, 13 km from the city of Cochabamba. The climate is hot and fairly humid.

Melissa is dark-skinned with dark hair and medium stature. She completed her Secondary studies and started in business in order to help her family. She is thinking about technical studies when her family's economic situation improves. Her timetable is from Monday to Saturday, from 6 in the morning until 9 at night.

She starts her day early with the rising of the sun, the time when the bread delivery person arrives with their baskets full of bread fresh from the oven. Then she takes care of her display and places products, one by one, to be as attractive as possible for possible clients. Melissa has goals objectives and dreams. One of them is to invest in a new business to increase her sales and have a more stable and profitable work. For these reasons Melissa is requesting a loan to invest in improving her business and helping her family.

loans.use: to invest in improving her business.

loans.name: Amancia

texts.en:
Amancia is 61 years old and married with ten children.

Amancia works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items like canned goods, snack foods, biscuits, cooking oil, noodles, coffee, etc. to sell.

Amancia has borrowed and repaid four loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for six years and also earns additional income from dressmaking.

Amancia aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional items like canned goods, snack foods, biscuits, cooking oil, noodles, coffee, etc. to sell

loans.name: María Del Rosario

texts.es:
María tiene 52 años de edad, estudió hasta el 2º grado de educación  básica, ella está casada y su esposo trabaja en la agricultura, tienen 3 hijos que ya son mayores de edad y han formado sus propios hogares.
 
María tiene 8 años de ser vendedora de antojitos (yuca frita, yuca salcochada, enchiladas, empanadas, tacos y papitas), este negocio lo aprendió por medio de una amiga con quien ella vendía antes, luego se decidió a emprender el negocio sola; María sale por las tardes a vender de casa en casa, además cada vez que hay partidos de futbol en la cancha ella aprovecha de vender a los aficionados. 

Ella necesita el crédito para comprar una cocina que en su hogar le hace falta para cocinar sus alimentos. Lo demás del efectivo del crédito lo quiere utilizar para comprar insumos para su negocio (plátanos, yuca, aceite, harina, tomates, chile, cebolla etc.)

Ella sueña  a futuro ver  su vivienda en buenas condiciones, ya que el techo de su casa está dañado.
texts.en:
María is 52 years old and attended school until the second grade. She is married and her husband works in agriculture. They have three adult children who are married and have their own households.
 
María has been selling snack food like fried yucca, boiled yucca, enchiladas, empanadas, tacos, and potatoes for 8 years. She learned this business from a friend with whom she worked, and she later decided to start this business by herself. María sells her food from door to door in the afternoons. Additionally, when there are soccer games at the field, she takes advantage of the opportunity to sell food to the fans.

She needs a loan to purchase a stove on which to cook her food, since she does not currently have one in her home. She will use the rest of the loan to purchase supplies for her business (plantains, yucca, oil, flour, tomatoes, chilies, onions, etc.).

She dreams of having a home in good condition, since the roof of her home is damaged.

loans.use: to purchase a stove with which to cook her meals, since she does not currently have one in her home, and to purchase supplies for her business (plantains, yucca, oil, flour, tomatoes, chilies, onions, etc.)

loans.name: Francisca

texts.en:
Francisca  is applying for a loan of $800 from TRM (Tuba Rai Metin).She is married and and she has one child.  She is 29 years old. She is running a kiosk in front of her house and she will use the loan to buy stock to keep in her store such as slippers, candles, sugar, salt, coffee, shampoo, 'body loosen' and noodles. She is making good money from selling and she wants to apply for bigger loans in the future. 

Francisca is living in a town near the school; her kiosk is located in a strategic place where many people come to buy, including students.

loans.use: To buy slippers, candles, sugar, salt, coffee, shampoo, 'body loosen' and noodles

loans.name: Ayovi

texts.fr: Veuve âgée de 42 ans, Ayovi vit dans le quartier d’Agoè avec trois(03) enfants en charge. Elle  commercialise des produits alimentaires. Ayovi  s’approvisionne quatre fois  par mois au grand marché de Lomé et revend dans une boutique dont elle est propriétaire à son domicile. Ayovi  sollicite un prêt pour agrandir son commerce afin de satisfaire les clients et faire plus de bénéfices.
texts.en:
A widow at 42 years of age, Ayovi lives in the Agoè district and has three dependent children. She is a merchant of food items. Ayovi purchases her supplies four times per month at the Lomé Grand Market, and sells her merchandise in the shop she owns at her home.

Ayovi is requesting this loan so that she can expand her business and better serve her clientele, as well as earn more income.

loans.use: to purchase 7 cartons of tomatoes, and 2 sacks of rice.

loans.name: Llamiletk

texts.es:
La Joven Llamiletk habita en el municipio del Sauce departamento de león, una ciudad donde los habitantes se dedican a diversas actividades de comercio para sobrevivir. 

Llamiletk es una joven de 46 años de edad Madre soltera con 1 hija bajo su cargo, con lo poco que ella gana a duras penas ayuda a mantener el sustento diario a su hija y le brinda una buena educación, por lo que su pequeña de 15 años de edad está estudiando en la secundaria y en los próximos años estaría en la universidad. 

Desde hace ocho años ejerce el trabajo como maestra, pero son de sus sueños darle una mejor enseñanza profesional a su hijita. 

Es de su gran necesidad que Ceprodel y Kiva le brinde un crédito, para la compra de: un Equipo Sonido, esto lo ve de gran importancia, para que su hija que tanto ama y estima después de un dia cansado tanto su hija como ella se pueda mantener Informada de las noticia a trave z de la radio 

Se siente a gusto con este tipo de empleo porque le ha ayudado mucho con su familia. 

Agradece con el apoyo que Ceprodel y Kiva le ha brindado, ya que en el financiamiento anterior logro comprarle una computadora a su hija para sus estudios,  espera en Dios seguir recibiendo este privilegio, de estos pequeños créditos que le ayudan mucho.
texts.en:
Llamiletk lives in the town of Sauce in the department of Leon, a city whose inhabitants make a living through diverse commercial activities.

Llamiletk is a young woman of 46 and a single mother caring for one daughter. What little she earns is barely enough for providing for the daily necessities of her daughter and providing her a good education. However, her daughter, who is15 years old, is studying in high school and will be in university in the coming years. 

For the past eight years she has been working as a teacher, but one of her dreams is to give her little daughter a better, professional education. She is satisfied with this type of employment because it has helped her a lot with her family. 

She is in dire need of a credit from Ceprodel and Kiva for the purchase of a sound system. She sees this as very important so that her daughter, who she loves and esteems so much, and herself can stay informed of the news on the radio after a tiring day.

She is thankful for the support that Ceprodel and Kiva has given her. With the last loan she was able to purchase a computer for her daughter for her studies. She hopes to God that she will continue receiving the privilege of these small credits that help her a great deal.

loans.use: purchase a sound system.

loans.name: Amparo

texts.en:
Amparo is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a food vending business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 18,000 through NWTF to purchase ingredients like meat, vegetables, spices, fish, beans, etc. for her business.

Amparo has been in this business for 18 years. Amparo earns more income from her general store.

Amparo has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients like meat, vegetables, spices, fish, beans, etc. for her business

loans.name: Edna

texts.en:
Edna is 46 years old and married. She has three children, one of whom is currently in school.

Edna is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs. She has been in pig fattening for 20 years now, and has borrowed 15 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Edna would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Helena

texts.en:
Helena is taking out a loan of $800 to improve her business. She is married and runs a kiosk that helps her to generate income for her family. 

She will use the loan to buy stocks to keep in her store such as coca cola, sprite, oils, slippers, body loosener, beer, bread and noodles. She opened her kiosk in 2012 with her own working capital of $400. 

Helena is a hardworking woman and she hopes to run a bigger business in the future.

loans.use: To buy coca cola, sprite, oils, slippers, body loosener, beer, bread and noodles

loans.name: Meerimgul

texts.ru: Мээримгул 27 лет, замужем, 2 детей. У Мээримгул среднее образование, на протяжении многих лет занимается разведением скота  и полеводством. У Мээримгул в хозяйстве есть 5 коров, 30 овец, 10 ягнят и 3 теленка, также на земельном наделе выращивает картофель и эспорцет. Мээримгул известна, как принципиальный, честный, порядочный и надежный человек. На сегодняшний день ее деятельность приносит ежемесячную прибыль в сумме 9,000 сом (KGS). Для дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Мээримгул обратилась в Банк «Бай – Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на покупку телят. Доходы от кредита Мээримгул планирует использовать для развития своего хозяйства и намерена в будущем построить дом.
texts.en:
Meerimgul is 27 years old, and married with two children. She has a high school education and for many years has raised livestock and farmed. She has five cows, 30 sheep, ten lambs and three calves. She grows potatoes and sainfoin (a plant in the pea family grown in Asia). 

Meerimgul is known as a principled, honest, decent and trustworthy person. Her monthly profit from her business is 9,000 KGS. To further expand her business, Meerimgul took a loan from micro-finance bank, Bai-Tushum, for 100,000 KGS to buy calves. She will use the income from the loan to grow her business and intends to build a house in the future.

loans.use: To buy calves and invest in her business.

loans.name: José Miguel

texts.es:
José de 37 años de edad, estudio 2° pero manifiesta que solo aprendió a leer y a firmar.  La esposa se dedica a la elaboración de petates, sus hijos asisten a la escuela, y en sus tiempos libres le ayudan a a trabajar en el cultivo de maíz y frijol.

José es empleado de una empresa hidroeléctrica y su trabajo consiste en verificar que los terrenos que compro dicha empresa no sean utilizados para cultivos o con ganado, él tiene 10 años de trabajar con dicha empresa y siempre se ha dedicado a trabajar en la agricultura.

El préstamo que esta solicitando, es para pagar una deuda que adquirio hace varios meses, para la compra de una vaca y lo que paga de interese es muy alto y debido a eso esta solicitando el crédito en CREDICAMPO. 

Sus sueños son muy grandes, pero no piensa más que ver a sus hijos trabajando en una oficina, y no como Él trabajando en el campo, esto lo piensa lograr trabajando duro y educándolos de la mejor manera a ellos.
texts.en:
José is 37 years old. He has a second grade education, but he says that he only learned to read and sign his name. His wife earns her living making woven sleeping mats and his children attend school; in their free time, they help him work in his corn and bean crops.

José is employed by a hydroelectric company; his work consists of verifying that the properties purchased by that company are not being used for farming or livestock. He has worked for that company for 10 years, and he has always farmed.

The loan that he is requesting is to pay off a debt that he incurred several months ago to buy a cow. What he pays in interest is very high and that is why he is requesting a loan from CREDICAMPO.

José's dreams are very big, but his aim is just to see his children working in an office, and not working in the fields like he does. He plans to achieve this by working hard and giving them the best education.

loans.use: to pay off a very high-interest debt that he incurred several months ago to buy a cow

loans.name: Ariel Antonio

texts.es:
El Joven Ariel Antonio habita en el municipio de Santa Rosa del Peñon departamento de león, una ciudad donde los habitantes se dedican a diversas actividades comerciales.  

Ariel Antonio es una joven de 22 años de edad con deseo de llegar a mejorar en las condiciones de su vida, desempeña el cargo de cajero en uno de los puesto de la alcaldía de santa rosa del peñón, con lo poco que el gana de su salario mantiene el sustento de su hogar, pero son de sus sueños mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia.

Viendo la necesidad que presenta en su hogar decidió realizar un nuevo crédito con ceprodel para la compra de: cemento, Arena y ladrillo esto sería muy importante para el cliente porque lograría los sueños de su vida lograr a construir un dormitorio. 

Desde hace cuatro años ejerce el trabajo como cajero, pero hoy en día comenta que el haber encontrado a Kiva y Ceprodel se le abrirán las puerta de sus sueños de poder obtener lo que desea.  
Viendo que en un futuro la familia crecerá es de su gran necesidad mejorar las condiciones de vida. 
Se siente a gusto con este tipo de empleo porque le ha ayudado mucho en el desarrollo de su vida, le ha ayudado en sus estudio de lograr sus sueños de su vida.  

Agradece con el apoyo que Ceprodel y Kiva le ha brindado, y espera en dios seguir recibiendo este tipo de privilegio.
texts.en:
Ariel Antonio is a young man who lives in the town of Santa Rosa del Peñon in the Department of León. In his town, the inhabitants are engaged in various business activities.
Ariel Antonio is a 22-year-old with the desire to improve the conditions on his life. He has a position as a cashier at the mayor's office in Santa Rosa del Peñon. With what little he earns as salary is used for the livelihood of his household but his dream is to improve the living conditions of his family.
Seeing the need in his home, he decided to take out a new loan with CEPRODEL to purchase cement, sand, and bricks which are important for Ariel Antonio since he would achieve his dream of building a bedroom.
For four years he has worked as a cashier but today he says that, having found CEPRODEL and Kiva, he can open the door to his dreams and achieve what he desires which is seeing that the family will grow and see to the need to improve their living conditions in the future. 
He feels comfortable in his job because it has helped him a lot in the development of his life and it has helped him to study and achieve his dreams in life.
He is grateful for the support provided by CEPRODEL and Kiva and hopes that God continues to grant him this type of privilege.

loans.use: to purchase cement, sand, and bricks to improve his family's house

loans.name: Miguel Ángel

texts.es:
Miguel tiene 52 años de edad, estudió hasta bachillerato mientras aprendió el oficio de enderezado y pintura cuando le ayudaba a su cuñado, después dejó de estudiar y decidió darle más tiempo a su trabajo, él está casado y tiene 4 hijos pero solo do estudian.

Miguel es comerciante de zapatos, dejó el trabajo de enderezado porque era malo para su salud. 

El crédito lo necesita para ampliar su negocio de venta de zapatos e ir a vender a otros pueblos ya que esto le genera buena fuente de ingresos para el hogar. 

Él sueña con que sus hijos se gradúen de la universidad
texts.en:
Miguel is 52 years old. While in high school, he also learned automotive paint and bodywork by helping his brother-in-law. Then he stopped going to school and decided to dedicate more time to his job. He is married and has four children, of whom only two are going to school.

Miguel is a shoe salesman. He quit the paint and bodywork job because it was bad for his health.

He needs this loan to expand his shoe sales business by going out to other towns to make sales. This generates a good source of income for his household.

His dream is for his children to graduate from college.

loans.use: to expand his shoe sales business.

loans.name: Manuel Antonio

texts.es:
Manuel tiene 35 años de edad, no estudió, ahora está acompañado y su pareja se dedica a la agricultura, tiene 2 hijos que se encuentran estudiando. 

Manuel tiene 2 años de dedicarse a este negocio la agricultura, lo aprendió por un empleo que tenía anteriormente.

Él invertirá el crédito en una pequeña granja de aves de corral y también comprará aves para criarlas, mejorara su vida ya que tendrá más ingresos. 

Él sueña con que sus aves de corral se desarrollen bien y así tener más ingresos para él y su familia.
texts.en:
Manuel is 35 years old and did not study. He is accompanied by his partner who makes a living in farming, he has two children who are students.

For the past two years he has been working in this business of agriculture, he learned it from a job he used to have.

He will invest the credit in a small poultry coop as well as the purchase of birds for raising. In doing so he will improve his life as he will have more income.

He dreams that his poultry birds will develop well and in this manner have more income for himself and his family.

loans.use: invest in a small poultry coop and the purchase of poultry birds for raising

loans.name: Giorghino Felix

texts.es: Giorghino tiene 20 años de edad es soltero dedicado al estudio  de tecnología ambiental al cual se dedica 08 horas diarias. El se siente muy contento por haber obtenido el préstamo ya que le ayudara a pagar la matrícula y las pensiones del segundo ciclo. El quiere ser parte de una empresa dedicado  al monitoreo de contaminación ambiental del aire. Su mayor deseo es terminar su carrera profesional y ayudar a sus padres y a disminuir la contaminación en su país. Giorghino agradece a los inversionistas KIVA por el crédito brindado.
texts.en:
Giorghino is 20 years old and single. He is an Environmental Technology student; he studies eight hours a day. He feels very happy to have obtained this loan, as it will help him to pay his tuition and housing for the second semester. 

Giorghino wants to be part of a company that monitors air quality. His greatest dream is to finish his professional degree, to help his parents, and to reduce pollution in his country. 

Giorghino thanks the Kiva lenders for the loan provided.

loans.use: to pay for tuition and housing

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
Evangeline works hard to support her family. She is married and has a pig-raising business in the Philippines.

Evangeline requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs. She has been in this business for 16 years now.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Evangeline would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Irish

texts.en:
Irish is a hard-working entrepreneur who has a food-vending business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 13,000 through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy more packs of cookies, chicharon, and ingredients for her food-vending business.

Irish has been in this business for ten years. She earns additional income from a general store.

Irish has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts, with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy more packs of cookies, chicharon, and ingredients for her business.

loans.name: Jadgarzhan

texts.ru: Ядгаржан, 45 лет, вдовец, отец 4 прекрасных дочерей, двое старших, несмотря на свой юный возраст с радостью активно помогают отцу в его бизнесе. Ядгаржан частный предприниматель, занимается скупкой, продажей и ремонтом ювелирных украшений. Опыт в данном виде деятельности более 10 лет. Также он выпекает и продает самсы, дополнительно сдает часть своего помещения под реализацию гамбургеров, получая арендную плату в размере 7,000 сом (KGS), дополнительно Ядгаржан на вещевом рынке реставрирует одежду и продает головные уборы. Он очень ответственный и предприимчивый, всегда ищет новый источник дохода, так как нужно растить своих любимых дочерей. Однако, в ночь с 15 на 16 июля случилось несчастье, в его мастерской, где он реставрирует ювелирные украшения произошел пожар, который перекинулся и на крышу дома.  А это основной доход Ядгаржана, у него уже наработаны постоянные клиенты, а сейчас бизнес простаивает. Поэтому Ядгаржан обратился в Банк "Бай-Тушум" за кредитом в сумме 150,000 сом (KGS) на восстановление мастерской. Он уважаемый человек, доброжелателен, пунктуален, корректен в общении, имеет большой опыт работы и знает всю технологию деятельности. Умеет правильно вести бизнес и вкладывать средства в нужное направление. Доход от кредита поможет Ядгаржану восстановить его любимое дело и дать достойное образование своим дочерям.
texts.en:
Jadgarzhan is 45 years old, a widower and the father of four lovely daughters. The two eldest, despite their young age, happily help him with his business. He has been self-employed buying, selling and repairing jewelry for over ten years. 

He also bakes and sells samosa, and leases out part of his shop for hamburger sales. He makes 7,000 KGS in rent. In the clothing market he repairs clothing and sells hats. Jadgarzhan is very responsible and entrepreneurial, always looking for a new income source with which to support his beloved daughters. 

However, on the night of July 15 there was an accidental fire in his jewelry workshop which spread to the roof of the house. This impacted his main source of income and his regular customers--now his workshop stands idle. 

Thus Jadgarzhan took a loan of 150,000 KGS from micro-finance bank, Bai-Tushum, to restore his workshop. He is an honorable man: friendly, punctual, a good communicator with strong work experience and technical knowledge. He knows how to do business and invest wisely. The income from the loan will help him restore his favorite business and provide a decent education to his daughters.

loans.use: To repair his jewelry workroom damaged by a fire in order to pay for his daughters' education.

loans.name: Jeric

texts.en: Jeric, 18 years old, is studying Automotive Servicing at St. Paul College of Tarlac. He wants to finish college to help his family and he chose this course because he had a little knowledge about the field. He had difficulties paying his tuition fees. Thus he wants to request an educational loan of PHP10,000 from Kiva lenders to support his studies. He is hopeful that the lenders will approve his loan.

loans.use: to pay for tuition fees.

loans.name: Ciara Mae

texts.en: Ciara Mae is 18 years old and is studying Food and Beverage Services. She chose this course so she could easily apply for jobs abroad. She wants to finish college to help her family in the future. Sometimes their family has insufficient funds for her tuition fees. That's why she wants to take a loan of PHP10,000 from Kiva lenders so that she can just focus on her studies instead of thinking of her finances.

loans.use: to pay for her tuition fees.

loans.name: Ma. Dolores

texts.en:
Ma. Dolores works hard to support her family. Ma. Dolores is married and has a pig fattening business in the Philippines.

Ma. Dolores requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Ma. Dolores has been in this business for 17 years now.

Ma. Dolores would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Ma. Flora

texts.en:
Ma. Flora is 50 years old, married and has one child, who is in school.

Ma. Flora is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. Ma. Flora requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Ma. Flora has been in pig fattening for six years now, and has borrowed 23 times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Ma. Flora would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy machinery

loans.name: Melicia

texts.en:
Melicia is 42 years old, married and has six children, one currently in school.

Melicia is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Melicia requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to purchase feed, vaccines and vitamins for her pigs.

Melicia has been raising pigs for 20 years now, and has borrowed 14 times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Melicia would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase feed, vaccines and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Necitas

texts.en:
Necitas is 58 years old and married with two children.

Necitas works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 29,500 loan through NWTF to buy additional stock like chocolate drinks, eggs, milk, juice, sanitary pads, soft drinks and other groceries to sell.

Necitas has borrowed and repaid 13 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for six years and also earns an income from t-shirt printing.

Necitas aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy chocolate drinks, eggs, milk, juice, sanitary pads, soft drinks and other groceries to sell

loans.name: Nerissa

texts.en:
Nerissa is 42 years old, married and has five children, three currently in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. 

Nerissa has a general store business in the Philippines. Nerissa requested a PHP 15,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store.

Nerissa has been in this business for six years. In the future, Nerissa would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Norberta

texts.en: Norberta is taking a loan of $800 to improve her business. She is running a kiosk that helps her to generate income for her family. She will use the loan to buy stock to keep in her store such as  oil, candles, Coca-cola, milk, fish and coffee. She opened her kiosk a year ago with her own working capital of $600.  She is a hard-working woman and she hopes to run a bigger business in the future.

loans.use: To buy oil, candles, Coca-cola, milk, fish and coffee

loans.name: Ivania Del Rosario .

texts.es:
La Joven Ivania Pichardo habita en el municipio de El Jicaral departamento de león, una ciudad hermosa donde existen diversas actividades comerciales he industriales.

Es una joven de 42 años de edad casada, con 2 hijos bajo su cargo sus hijos están en la educación secundaria, con lo poco que ella gana a duras penas ayuda a mantener a sus hijos y el de su estudios.
 
Desde hace 18 años se dedica a trabajar como empleada, ejerciendo el cargo de Maestra de educación primaria.  

A llegado a Ceprodel por quinta vez con el objetivo de solicitar un nuevo crédito para la compra de: Zin y Madera, ya que sus sueños es mejorar el tejado de su hogar y vivir en mejores condiciones con su familia. 

Se siente a gusto a verse encontrado con ceprodel y Kiva porque este le han dado su mano a amigable y ha logrado construir partecita por partecita su vivienda y ahora quiere mejor una parte del techo.
texts.en:
Ivania Pichardo lives in the El Jicarel municipality in the León department.  It is a beautiful city with diverse commercial and industrial activities.

Ivania is 42 years old and married.  She has two children under her care, and they go to high school.  With the little that she earns, she barely helps support her children and their education.

For 18 years she has worked as an employee.  She works as a primary school teacher.

She has come to CEPRODEL for the fifth time to request a new loan.  She will use the loan to buy zinc sheeting and wood.  Her dreams are to improve the roof of her home and to live with her family under better living conditions.

She is pleased to have found CEPRODEL and Kiva because they have given her a friendly hand.  She has managed to build, part by part, her house.  Now she wants to improve a part of the roof.

loans.use: to buy zinc sheeting and wood.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
To improve their lives, Maria and her husband work together to improve their vegetable production business. She is 53 years old and blessed with nine children. 

She and her husband aim to increase their production and income to support their family and finance the education of her children. Maria wants to access financial assistance from Kiva lenders through ASKI for PHP 20,000 to buy fertilizers and herbicides needed for vegetable production. She is hoping that this loan will be a great help in improving their farming business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and herbicides needed for her vegetable farm.

loans.name: Justine Dale

texts.en: Justine Dale, 21 years old, is studying at St. Paul College of Tarlac, taking up front office services and housekeeping. He wants to finish college to help his family financially. Growing up in a family with a low income, shortage of funds is unavoidable. That’s why he seeks financial assistance of PHP 10,000 from Kiva lenders to help his father, who is a soldier, pay his tuition fee.

loans.use: to pay his tuition fee

loans.name: Rosalia

texts.en:
Rosalia works hard to support her family. Rosalia is married and has a general store business in the Philippines.

Rosalia requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy more stock to sell in her general store.

Rosalia has been in this business for 10 years now.

In the future, Rosalia would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell in her general store

loans.name: Maricel

texts.en:
As a married parent of eight children, Maricel works hard to support her family.

She has a food-vending business in the Philippines and earns additional income from selling bananas and running a general store. Maricel is borrowing PHP 24,000 through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food-vending business.

Maricel has been sustaining her business activities through her past nine loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Girlie

texts.en:
Girlie is 42 years old and married with four children. She earns a living by having a pig-fattening business in the Philippines. Girlie is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Girlie has been in pig-fattening for six years and also earns additional income from food vending.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Felomina

texts.en:
Felomina is 53 years old and married, with four children. 

Felomina is in the agricultural business, pig-fattening in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 22,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy feed, vitamins, and other supplies for her business.

Felomina has been in pig-fattening for 11 years now and has borrowed 16 times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Felomina would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed, vitamins, and other supplies for her business.

loans.name: Cherry

texts.en:
Cherry works hard to support her family. Cherry is married and has a food-vending business in the Philippines.

Cherry requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more food to sell to her customers.

Cherry has been in this business for three years now.

In the future, Cherry would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more food to sell to her customers

loans.name: Luzvina

texts.en:
Luzvina is 34 years old, married and has two children who are both in school.

Luzvina is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Luzvina requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Luzvina has been raising pigs for sxi years now, and has borrowed nine times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

Luzvina would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Crestilita

texts.en:
As a married mother of three children, Crestilita works hard to support her family.

She has a restaurant business in the Philippines, and earns additional income from fattening pigs. Crestilita is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy additional ingredients like spices, meat, fish, and eggs for her restaurant.

She has been sustaining her business activities through her past 25 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to repair and renovate her family home.

loans.use: to buy additional ingredients like spices, meat, fish, eggs, etc.

loans.name: Elmar

texts.en:
Elmar is a 50-year-old married woman with four children, three of whom are in school.

She is in the agricultural business, farming rice in the Philippines. Elmar requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to pay for laborers' salaries for land preparation, and to buy sacks of fertilizer.

Elmar has been farming rice for ten years, and has borrowed five times in the past from NWTF.

In the future, she would like to build and expand her business to create financial stability for her family.

loans.use: to pay for laborers' salaries for land preparation, and to buy sacks of fertilizer.

loans.name: Las Orquideas Group

texts.es: Rosana tiene 38 años de edad es conviviente con 04 hijos dependientes. Ella implemento una pequeña bodega en su vivienda. Y a la vez se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza. De esa manera puede apoyar a su esposo quien se dedica a la construcción. El crédito lo invertirá  en la compra de más arroz azúcar aceite y productos de limpieza. En el grupo “LAS ORQUIDEAS” cumple la función de presidenta. El grupo agradece a los inversionistas KIVA por el crédito brindado. Rosana es la primera del lado derecho. Y de la misma manera se encuentra adjuntada la foto de Betty en la parte superior derecha por motivos laborales no pudo estar presente en la reunión.
texts.en:
Rosana is 38 years old and lives with her partner, with whom she has four dependent children. She set up a small neighborhood shop in her residence. At the same time, she also earns her living selling beauty products. In this way, she is able to help her husband, who works in construction. 

Rosana fills the role of President in the "Las Orquideas" ["The Orchids"] group. She will invest the loan in the purchase of more rice, sugar, oil, and cleaning products. The group is grateful to the Kiva lenders for the loan provided.

Rosana is the first person on the right side. The photo attached on the upper right is of Betty; for work reasons, she was not able to be present at the meeting.

loans.use: to buy more rice, sugar, and cleaning products

loans.name: Adijjah's Group

texts.en:
Hadijah's group is composed of hard-working women. Hadijah is 19 years old and lives in the town of Kabwohe in the Kabwohe region of Uganda. She is married and has two children, both currently in school. For the past three years, Hadijah has been working hard to manage her food stall business.

To help expand her business, Hadijah has requested a loan of 300,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more bananas, and will help Hadijah generate greater profits and earn more income. Hadijah hopes that in the future she will be able to provide for her children. 

Hadijah is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to buy more bananas

loans.name: Sonia Estela

texts.es:
Sonia tiene 60 años de edad, estudió hasta 5º grado, estaba acompañada pero lamentablemente hace un mes falleció su compañero de vida que era agricultor. Actualmente vive con 4 de sus hijos, un hombre y 3 mujeres, sus otros 4 hijos viven en sus propios hogares. 
Sonia se dedica a los oficios domésticos sus ingresos dependen de sus hijos que la apoyan económicamente. 

Ella necesita el crédito para la construcción de un cuarto para su hijo que está soltero y quiere tener su propia habitación para cuando se case. 

Ella planea a futuro seguir haciendo ampliaciones y mejorar la casa ya que la familia ha crecido.
texts.en:
Sonia, age 60, went to school through the fifth grade.  She was in a relationship.  Sadly, her life partner, a farmer, passed away a month ago.  She currently lives with four of her children, one boy and three girls.  Her other four children live in their own homes.

Sonia devotes herself to the household chores.  Her income is dependent upon her children, who financially support her.

She needs the loan to build a room for her son.  He is single, and he wants to have his own room for when he gets married.

In the future she plans to continue expanding and improving the house because the family has grown.

loans.use: to build a room for her son.

loans.name: Estrella

texts.en:
Estrella is 66 years old and married with eight children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell (eggs, sugar, noodles, salt, shampoo, and other groceries).

Estrella has borrowed and repaid nine loans from NWTF. She has been running her general store for five years and also earns an income buying and selling dried coconut.

Estrella aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell (eggs, sugar, noodles, salt, shampoo, other groceries).

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en:
Imelda is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fish vending business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 30,000 through NWTF to buy additional boxes of fish to sell.

Imelda has been in this business for six years. She earns additional income from raising chickens.

She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional boxes of fish to sell.

loans.name: Sumitra

texts.en:
Sumitra is a 44-year-old married woman from Dhupguri. She is a homemaker and is blessed with only one son. She passed grade four, and her husband studied until grade three. They live in a small village, Baroghoria, in Jalpaiguri district. They cannot give proper education to their only son, who now works as an electrician but has no fixed income.

Sumitra's husband is a farmer by profession. He has been working on his own land for many years. He learned his profession from his parents. He mainly grows paddy along with other seasonal vegetables. Sumitra looks after her household work, and after that she helps her husband in his activities. As a farmer, he has a great passion for his profession, as all day long, without regard for climate, he goes to look after his crops and works tirelessly to provide financial sustenance to his family. He gained a good many customers for his polite and simple behavior and good-quality crops at a cheaper rate. Like the other farmers, he also dreams of extending and improving his production.

That is why Sumitra is requesting a loan for the purchase of good-quality paddy seed, compost and fertilizer. This loan will be a great help because it will allow her to maintain a work rhythm and ensure a vigorous crop so that she can give good wellbeing to her family.

She is very much thankful to her generous lenders (BJS and Kiva) for their financial support.

loans.use: to purchase paddy seeds and fertilizers for paddy cultivation.

loans.name: Angella

texts.en:
Angella is a hard-working woman. Angella is 19 years old and lives in the town of Kabwohe in the Kabwohe region of Uganda. She is single and has no children. For the past two years, Angella has been working hard to manage her retail shop/canteen, which sells tea, bananas, and snacks. 

To help expand her business, Angella has requested a loan of 300,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase tea leaves, bananas, snacks, sugar, and baking flour, and will help Angella generate greater profits and her personal development. Angella hopes that in the future, she will be able to move to a bigger business. 

Angella is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to purchase tea leaves, bananas, snacks, sugar, and baking flour.

loans.name: Scovia

texts.en:
Scovia is a hard-working woman. Scovia is 18 years old and lives in the town of Kayunga in the Mukono region of Uganda. She is single and has no children. For the past two years, Scovia has been working hard to manage her shop, which sells clothes. 

To help expand her business, Scovia has requested a loan of 500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more clothes and will help Scovia generate greater profits and increase her business. Scovia hopes that in the future, she will be able to buy a plot of land. 

Scovia is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to buy more clothes

loans.name: Joan

texts.en:
Joan is a hard-working woman. Joan is 22 years old and lives in the town of Kayunga in the Mukono region of Uganda. She is single and has two children, one in school. For the past two years, Joan has been working hard to manage her restaurant, which sells local cooked food. 

To help expand her business, Joan has requested a loan of 950,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy charcoal, a refrigerator, and tables, and will help Joan generate greater profits and increase her capital. Joan hopes that in the future, she will be able to construct rental houses. 

Joan is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to buy charcoal, a refrigerator, and tables

loans.name: Edisah

texts.en:
Edisah is a hard-working woman. Edisah is 23 years old and lives in the town of Kayunga in the Mukono region of Uganda. She is single and has three children, two currently in school. For the past four years, Edisah has been working hard to manage her business, which sells fish and fried cassava. 

To help expand her business, Edisah has requested a loan of 600,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy fish, cooking oil, and charcoal, and will help Edisah generate greater profits and increase her business. Edisah hopes that in the future, she will be able to buy a plot of land. 

Edisah is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to buy fish, cooking oil, and charcoal.

loans.name: Esfuerzo De Mujeres Group

texts.es: Las socias del grupo “ESFUERZO DE MUJERES” se dedican al comercio minorista y a prestar servicios. Emilia tiene 55 años de edad es soltera dedicada a la venta de comida. Años atrás de dedicaba a la venta de queso. El crédito lo invertirá en la implementación de su negocio con sillas y mesas. Ella cumple la función de secretaria en el grupo. El grupo agradece a los inversionistas KIVA por el crédito brindado. Emilia es la primera del lado izquierdo.
texts.en:
The members of the Esfuerzo de Mujeres group devote themselves to retail and services.  

Emilia, age 55, is single, and she sells food.  Years ago she sold cheese.  She will use the loan to set her business up with tables and chairs.  She is the secretary of the group.

The group is grateful to the Kiva lenders for the loan.  Emilia is the first one on the left.

loans.use: to buy tables and chairs.

loans.name: Jelen

texts.en:
Jelen is 44 years old and married with three children who are in school. Jelen works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a direct sales business, selling MSE, Natacha and Avon products in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 19,500 loan through NWTF to purchase more products to sell.

Jelen has been in this business for nine years.

In the future Jelen would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more products to sell

loans.name: Kerana

texts.en:
As a married parent of one child, Kerana works hard to support her family.

She has a retailsl banana business in the Philippines, and earns additional income from buying and selling native products and vegetables. Kerana is borrowing PHP 11,000 through NWTF to buy additional sacks of bananas to sell.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and now is requested an additional loan to further build her business.

Kerana has been sustaining her business activities through her past 22 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of bananas to sell.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
Rosa, no fue a la escuela, pero el esposo que tenía anteriormente le enseño a leer y escribir. Rosa se dedica a la confección de ropa, más que todo trabaja haciendo uniformes para los alumnos de las escuelas, sus hijos asisten a la escuela, y le ayudan en el trabajo que ella hace, también con ella vive una nieta que la tiene desde que tenía 3 meses de edad, pero a la fecha ella tiene 14 años.

 El trabajo lo aprendió de los 12 años, pero inicio a trabajar independiente de 16 años, el dinero del crédito lo necesita para comprar tela y materiales para la costura, pues las personas de su comunidad llegan y le compran la tela y ahí mismo ella les elabora la ropa.

Sus planes a futuro son tener una mejor máquina, y mejorar su casa, enseñarles bien el trabajo a sus hijos para que puedan tener opciones de trabajo en el  futuro.
texts.en:
Rosa never went to school, but her ex-husband taught her to read and write. Rosa earns her living making clothes. Her most common task is making uniforms for school children. Her children go to school, and help her with her work. Also, she lives with a grand daughter that has been with her since she was 3 months old. Today the grand daughter is 14. 

Rosa learned dressmaking when she was 12 years old, but started working independently when she was 16. She needs the money from the loan to buy fabric and sewing materials, because people in her community come to her to buy the fabric, and she makes the clothes right there. 

Her plans for the future are to have a better sewing machine and improve her house, as well as teaching her children her craft so that they can have opportunities to work in the future.

loans.use: to buy fabric and sewing materials, because people come to her to buy their fabric, and she makes the clothes right there.

loans.name: María Irene

texts.es:
María de 46 años de edad, no asistió a la escuela, es soltera, no se dedica a ningún trabajo debido a que en la zona no hay donde trabajar, y también porque vive solo con 2 niñas (una de 10 y la otra de 5 años) y no las puede dejar solas, de las niñas una asiste a la escuela, de los hijos de ella 3 están en los estados unidos, pero solo 2 le ayudan para los gastos de la familia, y ella aprovecha que de lo que le mandan saca crédito para invertir en la mejora de su casa, ella anteriormente trabajaba en las fincas, sembrando, podando, peinando, abonando café, etc, 

El préstamo que esta solicitando a CREDICAMPO,  es para comprar piedra, arena y cemento, para construir un muro de retención de la casa, pues está construido en un terreno pendiente, y teme que se le lave y se deteriore la casa.

 Sus sueños son tener su casa en buenas condiciones, que sus dos últimas hijas estudien hasta la universidad.
texts.en:
Maria, 46, did not attend school. She is single and does not have a job because in her area there is no paid wage work to be found. Because she lives alone with her two girls (one is 10 and the other is 5), she cannot leave them alone. Her young girls are attending school and her other three children are in the United States with two of them helping the expenses of the family. She takes advantage of what she is sent in remittances for the household. She is seeking a loan to improve her house. She previously as worked on the farms planting, pruning, clearing, and fertilizing coffee, and more.
The loan she is applying to through CrediCampo will be used to buy stone, sand, and cement to build a retaining wall of the house as it is built on sloping ground. She fears that her house will wash away and deteriorate without it. 
Her dreams are to have a house in good condition and that her youngest daughter go to the university to study.

loans.use: to purchase stone, sand, and cement to construct a wall in her home to make it more stable

loans.name: César Enrique

texts.es:
César tiene 51 años de edad, estudió hasta 6º grado de educación básica, está casado y su esposa solo hace los oficios domésticos, sus 3 hijos viven con ellos y se encuentran estudiando. 

César se dedica al enderezado y pintura automotriz, este oficio lo aprendió durante el conflicto armado en el país, él fue soldado y le dieron un curso el cual le sirvió para ganarse la vida luego que perdiera una pierna en el conflicto armado. 
Luego de parte de una institución recibió otro curso para aprender a reparar televisores y equipos de sonido, sus hijos le ayudan en el taller cuando hay trabajo. 

El préstamo lo necesita para comprar algunas herramientas para el taller y pinturas para los trabajos que realiza en el mismo. 

Su sueño es tener un lugar propio para poner su taller ya que actualmente alquila.
texts.en:
César is 51 years old, and went to school through the 6th grade. He is married and his wife takes care of their home. Their three children live with them and go to school. 

César does bodywork and painting for vehicles, a job he learned during the armed conflict in the country when, as a soldier, he was put through a course. This know-how helped him earn a living after he lost a leg in the conflict.
Later, an institution allowed him to follow a course on repairing televisions and sound equipment. His children help him in the workshop when there is work. 

He needs this loan to buy some tools for the workshop and paint that he uses in his jobs.

His dream is to have his own place for the workshop, because for the moment he is renting.

loans.use: to buy some tools for his workshop and paint that he uses in his jobs.

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
As a married parent of seven children, Lydia works hard to support her family.

She has a rice business in the Philippines, and earns additional income by selling ready-to-wear products and farming rice. Lydia is borrowing PHP 17,000 through NWTF to buy additional sacks of rice to sell.

Lydia has been sustaining her business activities through her past 17 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of rice to sell.

loans.name: Majallon

texts.en:
Majallon is 46 years old and married with three children who are in school.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell like sacks of rice and charcoal, dozens of eggs, shampoo, sugar, groceries, etc. 

Majallon has borrowed and repaid 26 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for four years and also earns an income from buying and selling rice.

Majallon aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell like sacks of rice and charcoal, dozens of eggs, shampoo, sugar, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Ermelinda

texts.en:
Ermelinda is 35 years old and she is now applying for a loan of $800 to improve her business. She opened her kiosk in 2001 with her own working capital of $700. She earns a good income from her business.

 She will use her loan to buy some stock to keep in her store such as oil, noodles, cigarettes, coffee, sugar, salt, milk, shampoo,'body loosen', bread and candles. She is a very hard-working woman and doing business has become her regular activity for the past 13 years. She wants to make her business bigger and improve her living conditions in the future. She is happy with this loan because it will help to improve her living conditions in the future. Her husband is a teacher.

loans.use: To buy oil, noodles, cigarettes, coffee, sugar, salt, milk, shampoo, 'body loosen', bread and candles.

loans.name: Iliya

texts.en: Iliya is a Babban Gona farmer. Iliya expressed that he is driven by one goal; to “make more money for myself and my family.” It is the desire to fulfil this ambition that led Iliya to join Babban Gona. Now, as a Babban Gona member, he finally has the opportunity to access credit, good markets and a trained agronomist. Like all Babban Gona members, Iliya can earn up to $2000/ha this season from growing maize, more than three times the Nigerian farmer’s average annual income. The average Babban Gona farmer yields 30 bags of maize/hectare, double the national average of 14. However, Iliya, is ambitious and is aiming to reap at least 80 bags per hectare this season. By doing so, Iliya will finally have enough money to make significant life changes. When asked what he plans to do with  his income from this season, he said: “I plan to use the money I make to provide more food and clothing for my family”. With this loan, Iliya will be able to access all the inputs and services to make this dream a reality.

loans.use: To purchase high-quality inputs in order to double maize yield and income

loans.name: Shyamali Bala

texts.en:
Shyamali is 48 years old.  She is a homemaker from Dhupguri. Her family comprises her husband, Bamacharan, and her three sons. She attended school until grade two. Her husband is a farmer. He did not get the opportunity to study and as a result, he has had a difficult time obtaining well-paying jobs due to his illiteracy. Due to this, he has had to work in agriculture to support his family. All their sons attend school. His wife supports him a lot so their children can get ahead.

Shyamali's husband has worked in agriculture since he was small. He wakes up very early to go to the fields near his house to work. He sells his produce at his locality. But, his income is so scant that it is hardly possible for him to cover the expenses of his family along with his children's educational expenses. He lacks the capital to expand his business.

So, in order to improve his business, his wife Shyamali has taken a loan from Kiva's partner, BJS, to purchase farm supplies to cultivate paddy. Being the principle food of the regional people, the crop has a good demand in the regional people. With this loan, he will buy agricultural products such as manure, pesticides, and seeds. 

Shyamali's dream is to have a big harvest so he can repay the loan on time. She also hopes to have her own decent and better home and pay for her children to attend the university so they have better job opportunities and can ultimately improve their quality of life.

She is thankful to both the lenders.

loans.use: to purchase good-quality paddy seeds and fertilizers for cultivation.

loans.name: Brendah

texts.en:
Brendah is a hard-working woman. Brendah is 16 years old and lives in the town of Kayunga in the Mukono region of Uganda. She is single and has no children. For the past two years, Brendah has been working hard to manage her dairy shop, which sells milk and bread. 

To help expand her business, Brendah has requested a loan of 500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more milk and a fridge, and will help Brendah to generate greater profits and increase size of the business. Brendah hopes that in the future she will be able to open up a milk-processing factory. 

Brendah is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to purchase more milk and a fridge

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes is a hard-working woman. Agnes is 16 years old and lives in the town of Kayunga in the Mukono region of Uganda. She is single and has no children. For the past two years, Agnes has been working hard to manage her retail shop, which sells soap, sugar, posho (cornmeal), rice, and cooking oil. 

To help expand her business, Agnes has requested a loan of 300,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy soap, sugar, posho, rice, and cooking oil, and will help Agnes to generate greater profits and increase on her stock. Agnes hopes that in the future she will be able to construct rental houses. 

Agnes is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: buy soap, sugar, posho (cornmeal), rice, and cooking oil

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy products for making smoothies

loans.name: Dayyabu

texts.en: Dayyabu is a Babban Gona farmer.  As a Babban Gona member, Dayyabu is excited about the opportunity to finally have access to credit, good markets and a trained agronomist. Like all Babban Gona members, Dayyabu can earn up to $2000/ha this season from growing maize, more than three times the Nigerian farmer’s average annual income. The average Babban Gona farmer yields 30 bags/hectare; double the national average of 14. However, Dayyabu is ambitious and is hoping that as a result of this loan, he will be able to access quality inputs such as fertilizer and improved seeds that will  result in a yield of at least 35 bags of maize per hectare this season.  Dayyabu is hopeful about what the future holds; he hopes that with the increased income as a result of a high yield, he will finally be able to afford to educate his children; Abdul, and  Abubakar. Dayyabu’s dreams do not end here: “ultimately, I want to ensure my children are educated and have professional jobs”, he expressed.

loans.use: To purchase high-quality inputs in order to double maize yield and income

loans.name: Ali

texts.en: Ali is a Babban Gona farmer.  Ali expressed that he is driven by one goal; to “make more money for myself and my family.” It is the desire to fulfil this ambition that led Ali to join Babban Gona. Now, as a Babban Gona member, he finally has the opportunity to access credit, good markets and a trained agronomist. Like all Babban Gona members, Ali can earn up to $2000/ha this season from growing maize, more than three times the Nigerian farmer’s average annual income. The average Babban Gona farmer yields 30 bags of maize/hectare, double the national average of 14. However, Ali is ambitious and is aiming to reap at least 40 bags per hectare this season. By doing so, Ali will finally have enough money to make significant life changes. When asked what he plans to do with his income from this season, he said: “I plan to use the money I make to build a better home”. With this loan, Ali will be able to access all the inputs and services to make this dream a reality.

loans.use: To purchase high-quality inputs in order to double maize yield and income

loans.name: Sahima

texts.en:
Sahima hails from Dhupguri. She is a 43-year-old woman. She is an energetic and active woman who lives with her husband, Aijul (aged 46 years), and their sons. Of her three sons, two attend school and are in grade five and grade ten. The eldest son does not live with them. He works abroad. They live in a small village, Baroghoria, in the district of Jalpaiguri. She and her husband both are uneducated and can sign their names only.

Sahima's husband is a farmer who grows paddy on his farmland. He is the only breadwinner for the family and has to cover all the necessary expenses with his income. Though Sahima is a housewife, she helps her husband in his agricultural activities.

In search of higher production, Sahima's husband has investigated how he can maximize his business, and he always arrives at the same conclusion: he needs inputs to get a better benefit from his product. This is a problem because he doesn't have the capital to buy things like compost, seeds and fertilizers, which are widely used by farmers when they want to maximize the output of their crops.

For this reason, Sahima asks for a loan from BJS (Kiva's partner) to buy those goods. With the help of the loan, they will be able to continue working on their land and increase their economic output. She wants to feed and educate her sons in order to better their future that they work so hard for. She also dreams to purchase more land with the profit.

Her hearty thanks go to both BJS and Kiva.

loans.use: to buy agricultural inputs for cultivating paddy.

loans.name: Santos Simona

texts.es:
Santos es una mujer trabajadora de 55 años de edad, estudió hasta 3º grado de educación básica, está casada desde hace muchos años y su esposo es albañil, sus 4 hijos son mayores de edad y ninguno vive con ella pues ya son independientes. 

Santos realiza los oficios domésticos en su casa y ayuda a su hijo y a su nuera a aliñar pollos que ellos mismos crían en una pequeña granja familiar. 

El préstamo será invertido para mejorar su casa, específicamente la cocina artesanal y lavadero ya que actualmente están al aire libre, expuesto a la lluvia y sol. 

Su sueño es seguir mejorando su casa para sentirse cómoda.
texts.en:
Santos is a hard-working woman, 55 years old, who studied till third grade.  She has been married for many years and her husband is a mason.  Her sons are adult and none live with her since they are independent.  Santos does the housework at home and helps her son and daughter in law to prepare chickens for cooking, ones they raise themselves in a small family coop.
