Santos will use the loan to improve her house, specifically the traditional kitchen and laundry area since those are currently outside, exposed to sun and rain.  Her dream is to continue improving her home in order to live more comfortably.

loans.use: to improve her house, especially the traditional kitchen and laundry area since currently they are outside, exposed to sun and rain

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce is a hard-working woman. She is 21 years old and lives in the town of Nakifuma in the Mukono region of Uganda. She is single and has one child who is currently in school. For the past three years, Joyce has been working hard to manage her boutique, which sells clothes. 

To help expand her business, Joyce has requested a loan of 500,000 UGX from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy clothes, and will help Joyce to generate greater profits and expand the business. Joyce hopes that in the future she will be able to build her own house. 

Joyce is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to buy clothes

loans.name: Lorena Idalia

texts.es:
Lorena es una mujer de 31 años de edad, está casada y su esposo es agricultor, tiene 2 hijos de 4 y 6 años de edad, ella solo pudo estudiar hasta 9º grado de educación básica pues su posición económica no se lo permitió.

Lorena tiene casi 6 años de trabajar en la agricultura, trabajo que aprendió con su padre y hoy lo realiza junto a su  esposo, ellos se sienten muy bien al cultivar el maíz pues esto les genera ganancias al momento de venderlo  además es una fuente de alimentación para ellos.

Ella necesita el crédito para comprar los insumos agrícolas tales como fertilizantes, mina, gramoxone, etc. 

Su sueño es llegar a ser una gran administradora, y conocedora de la agricultura y poder darles a sus hijos una educación que les permita ser grandes personas en el futuro.
texts.en:
Lorena is a 31-year-old woman. She's married and her husband is a farmer. She has two children, 4 and 6 years old. She was only able to study to 9th grade of basic education because her economic position didn't allow her to.

Lorena has been working in agriculture for almost 6 years, a job she learned with her father. Now, she does it together with her husband. They feel very good at growing corn, and this generates income when it's sold, as well as being a source of food for them.

She needs the loan to buy agricultural inputs, such as fertilizers (Amina and Gramoxone), etc.

His dream is to become a great manager, and knowledgeable about agriculture, and to be able to give her children an education that allows them to be great people in the future.

loans.use: to buy agricultural inputs, such as fertilizers (Amina and Gramoxone), etc.

loans.name: Yahaya Jalo

texts.en: Yahaya Jalo is a Babban Gona farmer from Yalwan Pegi. Yahaya Jalo expressed that he is driven by one goal: to “make more money for myself and my family.” It is the desire to fulfil this ambition that led Yahaya Jalo to join Babban Gona. Now, as a Babban Gona member, he finally has the opportunity to access credit, good markets and a trained agronomist. Like all Babban Gona members, Yahaya Jalo can earn up to $2000/ha this season from growing maize, more than three times the Nigerian farmer’s average annual income. The average Babban Gona farmer yields 30 bags of maize/hectare, double the national average of 14. However, Yahaya Jalo is ambitious and is aiming to reap at least 35 bags per hectare this season. By doing so, Yahaya Jalo will finally have enough money to make significant life changes. When asked what he plans to do with his income from this season, he said: “I plan to use the money I make to build a better home”. With this loan, Yahaya Jalo will be able to access all the inputs and services to make this dream a reality.

loans.use: To access high-quality inputs such as fertilizer and seed in order to double income and yield.

loans.name: Alhassan Alh.

texts.en: Alhassan Alh. is a maize farmer who has expressed that he is driven by one goal: to “become the most profitable farmer in my community.” It is the desire to fulfil this ambition that led Alhassan Alh. to join Babban Gona. Now, as a Babban Gona member, he finally has the opportunity to access credit, good markets and a trained agronomist. Like all Babban Gona members, Alhassan Alh. can earn up to $2000/ha this season from growing maize, more than three times the Nigerian farmer’s average annual income. The average Babban Gona farmer yields 30 bags of maize/hectare, double the national average of 14. However, Alhassan Alh. is ambitious and is aiming to reap at least 35 bags per hectare this season. By doing so, Alhassan Alh. will finally have enough money to make significant life changes. When asked what he plans to do with his income from this season, he said: “I plan to use the money I make to expand my farmland”. With this loan, Alhassan Alh. will be able to access all the inputs and services to make this dream a reality.

loans.use: To access high-quality inputs such as fertilizer and seed in order to double income and yield.

loans.name: Erika

texts.es:
La Joven Erika habita en el municipio el sauce departamento de león, una ciudad hermosa donde existen diversas actividades comerciales.

Es una joven de 45 años de edad casada, cuenta con 1 hijo bajo su cargo, con lo poco que ella gana a duras penas ayuda a mantener a su hijita que tanto ama y estima, le brinda una buena educación, actualmente estudia en la universidad. 

Desde hace 20 años inició su negocio el cual consiste en la venta de cosméticos, y alimentación para la población, este negocio lo empezó con un pequeño capital que con esfuerzo propio lo logro a obtener trabajando fuera del país.

La forma de vender su producto, esto lo hace en su propia habitación, esta idea le surgió porque cuando emigro fuera del país logro a trabajar en una pequeña pulpería y desde ahí le surgió la idea de obtener su propio negocio como es la pulpería. 
Se siente a gusto con su negocio porque le da para vivir dignamente y le ayuda a sobrevivir con su familia. 

Este es el crédito numero 3 solicitado con ceprodel para el desarrollo de esta actividad, ella comenta que sus sueños lo ha ido cumpliendo a través de la mano amigable que le ha brindado ceprodel y kiva realizándole pequeños créditos que han ayudado a mejorar su vivienda. 

Espera en Dios seguir recibiendo este obsequio, porque para ella asi le llama, ya que en su vida le llegan de gran importancia estos pequeños créditos.
texts.en:
This young lady, Erika, lives in the town of El Sauce, in the district of Leon. It is a beautiful city with commercial activity. She is a young lady, she is 45 years old, she is married, and she takes care of a child. She struggles to support her beloved daughter because she doesn't make a lot of money. She offers her a good education, she is attending college currently. She opened her business 20 years ago. She sells cosmetics and food. She started this business with some money she made working outside the country. 

She sells her products in her house. She got this idea when she was working out of the country. She worked in a convenience store, and she thought she could have her own business just like that one. She is happy with her business because she can live with dignity and it helps to support her family.

This is the third loan she requests to CEPRODEL, for the development of her occupation. She states that her dreams have become real thanks to CEPRODEL and KIVA. They have offered her little loans that have help her to improve her home. 

She hopes God keeps helping her with these loans. She calls them "gifts" because they mean a lot to her.

loans.use: to buy: corn, beans, sugar, oil, rice, and cosmetics to supply her business better.

loans.name: Yahuza

texts.en: Yahuza is a 38-year-old farmer from Sabon Layi. As a Babban Gona member, Yahuza is excited about the opportunity to finally have access to credit, good markets and a trained agronomist. Like all Babban Gona members, Yahuza can earn up to $2000/ha this season from growing maize, more than three times the average Nigerian farmer’s annual income. The average Babban Gona farmer yields 30 bags/hectare, double the national average of 14. However, Yahuza is ambitious and is aiming to reap at least 35 bags per hectare this season due to the high quality inputs that he will obtain with this loan, such as disease resistant seed. When asked how he plans to spend the money he makes from selling his maize, Yahuza said “I plan to use the money I make to expand my farmland. In 5 years, I want to become the most profitable farmer in my community.” With this loan, Yahuza is on his way to achieving this dream.

loans.use: To access high quality inputs such as fertilizer and seed in order to double income and yield

loans.name: Isuwa

texts.en: Isuwa is a maize farmer from Yalwan Pegi.  As a Babban Gona member, Isuwa is excited about the opportunity to finally have access to credit, good markets and a trained agronomist. Like all Babban Gona members, Isuwa can earn up to $2000/ha this season from growing maize, more than three times the average Nigerian farmer’s annual income. The average Babban Gona farmer yields 30 bags/hectare,  double the national average of 14. However, Isuwa is ambitious and is aiming to reap 35 bags per hectare this season.  When asked how he plans to spend the income he will make as a Babban Gona member, he said, “I plan to use the money  to educate my children; La'azaru,Hajara, and Tabula. My overall goal is to ensure my children are educated and have professional jobs”. With this loan, he is well on his way to achieving these goals.

loans.use: To purchase high-quality inputs in order to double yield and income

loans.name: Arlindo

texts.pt:
O senhor Arlindo tem 45 anos de idade é casado pai de quatro filhos dos quais um ja maior dois a estudar, vive na casa própria sustenta dois sobrinhos que vivem com ele.
Com o valor do crédito irá comprar cimento, areia e fazer o pagamento da mão de obra de seus pedreiros.
Diz que no futuro espera construir na sua casa três dependências para arrendar reforçando assim a renda familiar.
Diz também que além de ser biblitecário é também electricista por conta própria e faz a actividade regularmente. Irá solicitar mais emprestimos para concretizar o seu plano.
texts.en:
Arlindo, 45 years old, is married and has four children, the two eldest of whom are in school. He lives in his own home and also supports two nephews who live with him.
He will use this loan to buy cement and sand and to pay bricklayers for their labor.
He says that in the future he hopes to build a house with three rooms to rent out to bolster his family's income.
He also says that in addition to being a librarian, he also regularly works as a freelance electrician. He will request more loans in the future to carry out his plans.

loans.use: to buy cement and sand and to pay bricklayers for their labor.

loans.name: Belarmino

texts.pt:
O Sr. Belarmino de 28  anos de idade casado e pai de 1 filho que frequenta escola no ensino primario. Ele è negociante informal de produtos da 1ª necessidade seus produtos vende a porta da sua casa e por encomendas, seus produtos são adquerido na vizinha Africa do Sul.
Com o presente emprestimo será aplicado para comprar produtos da 1ª necessidade (arroz, feijão manteiga, batata doce, amendoim, refregerantes e mais diversos produtos) para aumentar o volume do seu negocio.
texts.en:
Belarmino, 28 years old, is married and has one son who is in elementary school. He has an informal business selling staple goods out of his home and by delivery. He purchases the products in neighboring South Africa.
He will use this loan to purchase staple goods (rice, beans, butter, sweet potato, peanuts, perishables, and other items) to increase the stock he carries.

loans.use: to purchase staple goods (rice, beans, butter, sweet potato, peanuts, perishables, and other items) to increase the stock he carries.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to install electricity (paying for cables and a lamppost and buying an energy contract) in his home.

loans.name: Armando

texts.pt:
O Sr. Armando de 31 anos de idade casado e pai de 3 filhos dos quais 2 estao a  frequentar ascola no ensino primario e secundário e outro sem idade para frequentar  escola. Ele è supervisor na empresa de produção de banana a mais de 3 anos.
Com o presente emprestimo será aplicado para comprar material de construção (cimento, area, barrotes, janelas e pagamento de mao –de-obra) para dar continuidade com a construção da sua casa.
texts.en:
Armando, 31 years old, is married and has three children, two of whom are in school and one of whom is not yet of school age. He has been working as a foreman in a banana company for more than three years.
He will use this loan to purchase construction materials (cement, sand, beams, and windows) and to pay for labor to continue the construction on his house.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials (cement, sand, beams, and windows) and to pay for labor to continue the construction on his house.

loans.name: Elsa

texts.pt:
A Sra. Elsa de 71 anos de idade, mãe de 1 filho que frequenta escola no ensino secundário. Ela è criadora de frangos a mais de 25 anos, actividade que explora junto com seu filho, seus frangos vende na sua casa e em diversos mercados de Maputo.
O presente emprestimo será aplicado para comprar (pintos, vitaminas e bebidores) para aumentar o volume da criação de modo garantir a sua reforma.
Tem como grande desafio melhorar as condições de habitação e adquirir mais fundo na Hluvuku-Adsema.
texts.en:
Elsa is 71 years old and has one son who is in high school. She has been raising chickens for more than 25 years. She and her son raise them together and sell them out of their home and in various markets around Maputo.
She will use this loan to buy chicks, vitamins, and other supplies to increase the number of chickens she can raise and improve her facilities.
Her biggest goal is to improve her family's living conditions and receive more funding from Hluvuku-Adsema.

loans.use: to buy chicks, vitamins, and other supplies to increase the number of chickens she can raise.

loans.name: Wakili

texts.en: Wakili is a maize farmer and member of Babban Gona. Wakili joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for his children Haru, Yahaya and Hamza. Wakili is excited that Babban Gona offers a lasting solution to ending the cycle of poverty. For the first time, Wakili will have access to quality inputs such as fertilizer and seed. Without this loan, he would be subjected to buying these products in the open market where the products are not only very expensive but are often diluted with external products like sand. With access to high quality inputs, Wakili can reap up to 30 bags/hectare, double the national average of 14  and  earn up to $2000/ha, more than three times the average Nigerian farmer’s annual income.  When asked, Wakili said “I plan to use the money I make this year to expand my farmland.” Wakili is not thinking about just this year. In 5 years, he wants to become the most profitable farmer in his community.

loans.use: To access high quality inputs such as fertilizer and seed in order to double income and yield

loans.name: Isia Shugaba

texts.en: Isia Shugaba remembers not being able to feed  his family during a particularly bad harvest. This was before he became a Babban Gona member. Now, Isia Shugaba, like all Babban Gona members, can earn up to $2000/ha this season from growing maize, more than three times the Nigerian farmer’s annual income. The average Babban Gona farmer yields 30 bags/hectare, double the national average of 14. However, Isia Shugaba is ambitious and is aiming to reap 35 bags per hectare this season.  “In 5 years, I want to make more money for myself and my family”, Isia Shugaba. With this loan, he is well on his way to achieving this dream.

loans.use: To access high-quality inputs such as fertilizer and seed in order to double income and yield.

loans.name: Sita

texts.en:
Sita is a young and active woman of 23 years. She is from DhupgurI and married, with one young son who is below school-going age.  She lives with her family in a rural village, Altagram, in the Jalpaiguri district where crop farming is a common way to make a living. As with other villagers, rice farming and growing have been her family’s main source of income for nine years. Sita and her husband Dipu both attended school till eighth grade.

Sita's husband works as a farmer in the village to earn an income for the family's household.  He has cultivable paddy land where he grows paddy.  Although Sita is a homemaker, she helps with her husband's work.  They sell the produce in the local market.  The major part of their locality is covered with agricultural land and paddy is cultivated widely in the region, so they have to face competitors in the market. The income generated from this cultivation is insufficient to support the family.

In order to improve their business, Sita has sought a loan from BJS (Kiva's partner). She wants to purchase paddy seeds, fertilizers, and pesticides with the loan.

She hopes the loan will enable her to earn additional income to provide better lifestyle to her family and build a better and decent house for them. She conveys her thanks to both BJS and Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase farm supplies for paddy cultivation.

loans.name: Yakubu

texts.en: Yakubu is a Maize farmer from Yalwan Pegi.  As a Babban Gona member, Yakubu is excited about the opportunity to finally have access to credit, good markets and a trained agronomist. Like all Babban Gona members, Yakubu can earn up to $2000/ha this season from growing maize, more than three times the average Nigerian farmer’s annual income. The average Babban Gona farmer yields 30 bags/hectare,  double the national average of 14. However, Yakubu is ambitious and is aiming to reap 35 bags per hectare this season.  When asked how he plans to spend the income he will make as a Babban Gona member, he said, “I plan to use the money  to educate my children; Anas,Suleiman, and Shafiu. My overall goal is to become the most profitable farmer in my community”. With this loan, he is well on his way to achieving these goals.

loans.use: To purchase high-quality inputs in order to double yield and income

loans.name: Liman

texts.en: Liman is a 55-year-old farmer from Sabon Layi.  As a Babban Gona member, Liman, is excited about the opportunity to finally have access to credit, good markets and a trained agronomist. Like all Babban Gona members, Liman can earn up to $2000/ha this season from growing maize, more than three times the Nigerian farmer’s average annual income. The average Babban Gona farmer yields 30 bags/hectare; double the national average of 14. However, Liman is ambitious and is hoping that as a result of this loan, he will be able to acces quality inputs such as fertilizer and improved seeds that will  result in a yield of at least 35 bags of maize per hectare this season.  Liman is hopeful about what the future holds; he  hopes that with the increased income as a result of a high yield, he will finally be able to afford to educate his children; Aminu and  Yahaya. Liman’s dreams do not end here: “ultimately, I want to ensure my children are educated and have professional jobs”, he expressed.

loans.use: To purchase high-quality inputs in order to double maize yield and income

loans.name: Andrawus

texts.en: Andrawus remembers not being able to pay school fees  during a particularly bad harvest. This was before he became a Babban Gona Member. Now,  Andrawus, like all Babban Gona members,  can earn up to $2000/ha this season from growing maize, more than three times the Nigerian farmer’s annual income. The average Babban Gona farmer yields 30 bags/hectare, double the national average of 14. However, Andrawus  is ambitious and is aiming to reap more than 30 bags per hectare this season.  “In 5 years, I want to make more money for myself and my family” expressed Andrawus.   With this loan, Andrawus is well on his way to achieving  this dream.

loans.use: To access high-quality inputs such as fertilizer and seed in order to double income and yield.

loans.name: Shehu

texts.en: Shehu is a maize farmer and member of Babban Gona. Shehu joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for his children Idi, Yakubu and Yusuf. Shehu is excited that Babban Gona offers a lasting solution to ending the cycle of poverty. For the first time, Shehu will have access to quality inputs such as fertilizer and seed. Without this loan, he would be subjected to buying these products in the open market where the products are not only very expensive but are often diluted with external products like sand. With access to high quality inputs, Shehu can reap up to 30 bags/hectare, double the national average of 14  and  earn up to $2000/ha, more than three times the average Nigerian farmer’s annual income.  When asked, Shehu said “I plan to use the money I make this year to expand my farmland.” Shehu is not thinking about just this.  In 5 years, he wants to become the most profitable farmer in his community.

loans.use: To access high-quality inputs such as fertilizer and seed in order to double income and yield.

loans.name: Sonali

texts.en:
Sonali is only 24 years old, a very active and energetic woman. She hails from Dhupguri. She is married and the mother of an adorable toddler. She lives with her husband, Sanjay, and their only son in the village of West Magurmari in the district of Jalpaiguri. She has a secondary education. Their kid is in grade one. Sonali's husband, aged 31 years, passed eighth standard.

Sonali, along with her husband, runs a milk supply business. Being the head of a family, Sumitra's husband has lots of responsibilities, and he is required to do hard work to give a decent lifestyle to his family. He started cattle farming a few years back. He never advanced his education because of the financial needs of his family. After marriage, Sonali started helping him, and together they rear cattle, which is the only source of income for the family. They have two dairy cows, and they sell milk to their neighbours, who are their main clients. They are very much appreciated by their clients because they supply good-quality milk and comparatively at a cheaper rate. 

Sonali's husband is a visionary and enterprising person and has always wanted to do dairy farming on a large scale, but one of the challenges he has faced is the lack of enough capital. This is why Sonali is seeking a loan from BJS (Kiva’s partner) to purchase another dairy cow. Sonali is confident that their future will be transformed, and her dream of providing a secure future for her family will be achieved with the profit from her business.

Sonali's aspiration is to build a concrete-made house for them.

She and her husband are much grateful to her lenders, BJS and Kiva.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow for her milk supply business.

loans.name: Kusumi

texts.en:
Kusumi is a rural woman of 42 years from the village of Baroghoria in the Jalpaiguri district. She is married and a mother of four sons.  Two of them are students of grade 9 and grade 10. Another two work as laborers outside India.  Kusumi's husband is engaged in agriculture. Both are uneducated and can only sign their names. They have a kachha house (made of wood, mud, straw and bamboo).

Kusumi's husband works in agriculture and earns his income selling the crops in the local markets. He has an ancestral plot of land where he grows potatoes, beans, eggplants, etc., on a crop rotation basis. He has ten years' experience in the sector. But these days it has become difficult to maintain his family with his small income, when the prices of essential goods are increasing by leaps and bounds. So Kusumi and her husband have decided to grow a profitable crop like paddy in their farmland. For this, they need financial support.

Kusumi came to know about BJS ( Kiva's partner) and has taken a loan from them to buy farm supplies like seeds and fertilizers to cultivate paddy in the next planting season. She hopes this will increase her crop production and thus give additional profit.

Her dreams are to give a proper education to her sons, strengthen the family economy, and save money for the future to purchase a car for them.

She is grateful to BJS and Kiva for lending her the money.

loans.use: To purchase agricultural supplies for paddy cultivation.

loans.name: Dhanobala

texts.en:
Twenty-four-year-old Dhanobala is from Dhupguri. She is an active, energetic and enterprising lady. Her family consists of two members: she and her husband. They have no children. They live in a small village, Gosairhat, in Jalpaiguri district in their own small kachha house (mud, wood and straw-made). Dhanobala studied up to grade ten and then got married, due to her parental poverty. Her husband, Kamal, is illiterate and can sign his name only.

Dhanobala's husband (27 years old) is a green grocer who sells vegetables in the local market. His monthly income just covers their food expenses. It is getting difficult to manage the household expenses. So, very recently Dhanobala has started a milk supply business. She sells milk to her neighbours. Now she wants to purchase a dairy cow to improve her business by selling more milk to her clients. She is a very polite and soft-natured woman. So, her clients like her, and the demand for milk in the rural area is more; thus, her business is also increasing.

In order to purchase a cow, she borrowed a loan from BJS (Kiva's partner). She is hoping that buying a cow will increase her income and financial security at present and in the long run by giving them an asset that they can sell during hard times.

She dreams to give their children higher education with the profit from the business and upgrade their house to a concrete-made house.

She is thankful to both BJS and Kiva.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow for her milk selling business.

loans.name: Nida

texts.en:
Nida is 31 years old and married, with two children, one of whom is in school.

Nida works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and she has requested a PHP 30,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to purchase additional items to sell, like shampoo, rice, charcoal, dozens of eggs, soft drink products, and groceries.

Nida has borrowed and paid 27 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for two years and also earns an income from pre-paid mobile load.

Nida aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell, like shampoo, rice, charcoal, dozens of eggs, soft drink products, and groceries.

loans.name: Marvin

texts.es:
Marvin  de 36 años de edad, estudio  hasta 7° grado,  sabe leer y escribir, es acompañado pero anteriormente se casó con otra pareja, con la que tiene una hija, con la que tuvieron problemas y no pudieron seguir juntos, aunque él le dejo la casa y siempre está pendiente de ayudar a su hijo, aunque ya tiene otra esposa con la que también tiene una hija, con quien vive muy feliz, la niña que tiene no asiste a la escuela, pues solo tiene 10 meses, la esposa se dedica solo a los oficios domésticos, mientras que el cliente trabaja como albañil, construyendo casas en la zona, quien manifestó que tiene 2 años de dedicarse de lleno a este trabajo, aunque vivio en estados unidos 10 años donde trabajo en una imprenta.

El préstamo que esta solicitando, es para comprar una novilla, para a futuro hacerse de animales, y tener leche, queso para los gastos de la familia. Su meta a futuro es que su hija y su otro hijo, estudien y sean profesionales, también piensa instalar una tienda y ampliar la casa, para mejorar las condiciones de la familia.
texts.en:
Marvin, 36 years of age, studied until the 7th grade. He knows how to read and write. He is in a relationship, but previously he was married to a different partner with whom he has a child and with whom he had problems so that they weren't able to stay together. However, he left her the house and is always conscious of helping his child, even though he already has another wife with whom he also has a daughter and with whom he is very happy.

The girl that he has doesn't go to school, since she is only 10 months old. His wife spends her time on household chores, while he works as a construction worker, building houses in the area. He explained that he has been working full-time in this job for 2 years, although for 10 years he lived in the U.S., where he worked in a printing house.

The loan for which he is applying is to buy a heifer, in order to have animals in the future, and to have milk and cheese to cover family expenses. His future goal is for his daughter and his other child to study and become professionals. He also would like to set up a store and expand his house, in order to improve living conditions for his family.

loans.use: to buy a heifer, in order to have animals in the future, and to have milk and cheese to cover family expenses.

loans.name: Bridget

texts.en:
Bridget is a hard-working woman. She is 19 years old and lives in the town of Nakifuma, in the Mukono region of Uganda. She is single and has no children. For the past five years, Bridget has been working hard to manage her restaurant in which she sells cooked food. 

To help expand her business, Bridget has requested a loan of UGX 600,000 (Ugandan shillings) from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy crates of soda and a refrigerator and will help Bridget to generate greater profits and expand the business. Bridget hopes that, in the future, she will be able to build rental houses. 

Bridget is a member of BRAC Uganda's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: buy crates of soda and a refrigerator.

loans.name: Sergio Alberto

texts.es: Sergio Alberto, está casado, tiene 26 años y vive con su esposa  e hija que son su mayor prioridad. El con el crédito va comprar los insumos como abonos, plaguicidas y herbicidas necesarios para la siembra y asistencia de sus cultivos. El se dedica ya desde hace varios años atrás y espera poder mantener sus plantaciones en buenas condiciones para obtener mayores ingresos este año, pues los precios de pago se mantienen muy buenos. El espera poder ofrecerle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida y a su vez también generar una mejor economía en su hogar. Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. El no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Sergio Alberto is married. He is 26 years old, and lives with his wife and daughter, who are his highest priority.

With the loan, he is going to buy inputs such as compost, insecticides, and herbicides necessary to plant and tend to his crops. He has made his living in this way for many years now, and hopes to be able to maintain his plantations in good condition in order to get better earnings this year, since the prices are staying very good.

He hopes to be able to offer his family a better quality of life and at the same time, generate better finances for his home.

This is the first loan that he has received from FUDECOSUR. He hadn't had loans before in state banks, but FUDECOSUR has provided him with the loan with greater ease and much lower interest rates.

loans.use: to plant corn, tiquisque [yautia], and beans.

loans.name: António

texts.pt:
O senhor António e auxiliar administrativo na unidade sanitária  tem 33 anos de idade, pai de 3 filhos dos quais dois estudam outro ainda menores vive na casa prápria e sustenta também sua mãe enviando lhe dinheiro.
Diz que com o valor vai comprar areia, pedra, chapas de zinco para ampliar a sua casa com mais um quarto, uma cozinha e casa de banho interna, actualmente é tipo dois.
Projectos para o futuro além do sίtio onde vive  quer ampliar sua casa tem um espaço onde no futuro irá fazer a casa de seus sonhos e mudar se para lá deixando a actual a arendar.
Diz comprometer se a pagar pontualmente e voltar a solicitar mais empréstimos e que além de seu trabalho tem uma lanchonete onde vende diversos produtos.
texts.en:
António is an administrative assistant at the local health clinic. He is 33 years old and has three children, two of whom are in school and the other of whom is still too young. He lives in his own home and also supports his mother by sending her money.
He says that he will use this loan to buy sand, stone, and sheet metal to expand his house by building another bedroom, a kitchen, and an indoor bathroom.
In the future he would like to expand his house. He has a plot of land where he would like to build his dream house and then move there while renting out his current home.
He plans to make his payments on time and then request additional loans. In addition to his job, he has an eating establishment where he sells a variety of products.

loans.use: to buy sand, stone, and sheet metal to expand his house.

loans.name: Baião

texts.pt:
O senhor Baião é operário  agricola, casado e pai de 5 filhos todos a estudarem vive na casa propria sustenta um sobrinho que vive com ele.
O valor do empréstimo irá comprar cimento, areia, pedra, varrões para a construção de sua casa.
Tem como projectos e sonhos terminar  a casa para dar um lar condigno a sua famίlia e depois da casa construir também um aviário para criar frangos para refoçar  a renda familiar.
Diz que os principais desafios que tem enfrentado sao os financeiros para a conclusao de sua casa, e que ira solicitar mais emprestimos para concretizar seu plano.
texts.en:
Baião is an agricultural worker. He is married and has five children, all of whom are in school. He lives in his own home and also supports a nephew, who lives with them.
He plans to use this loan to buy cement, sand, and stone to continue building his house.
He dreams of finishing his home so he can offer his family a decent place to live. He would also like to build a chicken coop and raise chickens to boost his family's income.
He says his major challenge is finding the funds to finish his home and that he will request further loans to carry out his plan.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand, and stone to continue building his house.

loans.name: Adelina

texts.pt:
A  senhora Adelina  é mãe solteira de 3 filhos todos a estudarem vive na casa própria e sustenta a também seus pais apenas enviando.
Com o valor irá comprar portão, cimento, ferro para a contrução de seu muro de vedação que neste momento está na fase da viga. 
Para o futuro a cliente tem como sonho abrir uma barraca em sua casa e um salão de cabelereiro também em sua casa como forma de reforçar a sua renda familiar.
Os principais desafios que a cliente tem são financeiros para ultrapassar tem recorrido ao subsίdio mensal do pai de seus filhos. Diz que vai solicitar mais créditos para concretizar seu plano.
texts.en:
Adelina is a single mother of three children, all of whom are in school. She lives in her own home and also supports her parents by sending them money.
She will use this loan to buy a gate, cement, and iron to build a wall around her home that is currently in its beginning stages. 
In the future, she dreams of opening a little shop and a hair salon in her home to boost her family's income.
Her major challenge is financial, finding a way to supplement her children's father's monthly support payment. She says that she will request more loans to carry out her plan.

loans.use: to buy a gate, cement, and iron.

loans.name: Carlitos

texts.pt:
O senhor  Carlitos é electrecista e comeciante tem 30 anos de idade, casado pai de três filhos ainda menores vive na casa propria e sustenta mais uma sobrinha e um cunhado que vive com ele.
Com o valor  quer comprar fios, tomadas, quadros,  bocais, interruptores, tubos para usar nas instalações electricas onde é contrado e também revender
Tem como planos para o futuro montar uma ferragem para venda de material de construção e eléctrico.
Diz que vai solicitar mais empréstimos com vista a concretizar o se projecto
texts.en:
Carlitos is an electrician and retailer. He is 30 years old and his married with three young children. He lives in his own home and also supports a niece and grandson, who live with them.
He will use this loan to buy wire, sockets, breaker panels, conduit, and interrupters to use in his contracted electrical work and also for resale.
In the future he plans to set up a hardware store to sell construction and electrical materials.
He says he will request additional loans to carry out his project.

loans.use: to buy wire, sockets, breaker panels, conduit, and interrupters.

loans.name: Laila

texts.pt:
Laila de 24 anos de idade, órfã de pai e solteira, vive na casa dos pais com sua mãe, seu irmão, seus dois filhos e um sobrinho. Dos seus filhos um vai a escola e outro ainda não tem direito a frequência escolar devido a sua idade, apoia sua mãe em satisfazer as despesas domésticas. 
É Retalhista, compra gado bovino dentro das localidades de Magude com seu irmão, abate na matadora e vende a carne a retalho e graças a sua mãe aprendeu o trabalho.
 Com o presente empréstimo de 30.000,00 (trinta mil meticais) irá comprar duas cabeças de gado bovino no sentido de aumentar seu volume de mercadoria.
Tem como sonhos expandir seu negócio e ter sua própria casa.
O principal desafio é a falta de fundos para investir nessas aspirações
texts.en:
Laila is 24 years old. Her father is dead and she is unmarried. She lives her family's home with her mother, her brother, her two children, and a nephew. One of her children is in school and the other is still too young for school. She helps her mother cover household expenses. 
She is a retailer, buying cattle in the villages around Magude with her brother, slaughtering them, and selling the meat. She learned how to do this work from her mother.
She will use the current loan of 30,000 meticals to buy two cows in order to increase the volume of meat she carries.
Her dreams are to expand her business and to own her own home.
Her biggest challenge is finding the funds to pursue her goals.

loans.use: to buy two cows in order to increase the volume of meat she carries.

loans.name: Jossefa

texts.pt:
Jossefa de 32 anos de idade, vive maritalmente na casa própria, pai de dois filhos menor de idade e ambos sem idade de frequência escolar. Para além dos seus filhos não sustenta mais ninguém. 
É docente de carreira com nomeação defenitiva. 
Com o presente empréstimo de 30.000,00 (trinta mil meticais) irá comprar uma geleira e um jogo de sofás no sentido melhor condicionar sua habitação.
Tem como sonhos concluir a sua obra e terminar seus estudos no ensino superior.
O principal desafio é a falta de fundos para investir a curto prazo nessas aspirações.
texts.en:
Jossefa is 32 years old. He lives with his partner in a home they own. They have two young children who are not yet of school age. Apart from his children, he does not support anyone else. 
He is a tenured teacher. 
He will use this loan of 30,000 meticals to buy a refrigerator and a sofa set in order to improve his home.
His dreams are to finish this project and complete his post-high-school education.
His biggest challenge is finding the funds to pursue his goals.

loans.use: to buy a refrigerator and a sofa set in order to improve his home.

loans.name: Arleta

texts.pt:
A Sra. Arleta de 52 anos de idade casada e mãe de 5 filhos dos quais 4 são maiores de idade e independentes 1 esta a frequentar escola no ensino secundário. Ela è operaria agricola na empresa de produção de banana a mais de 6 anos.
Com o presente emprestimo sera aplicado para comprar material de construção (cimento, pedra, barrotes e pagamento de mao-de-obra) para dar continuidade com a construção da sua casa.
texts.en:
Arleta, 52 years old, is married and the mother of five children, four of whom are adults living on their own and one of whom is still in high school. She has been working for a banana company for more than six years.
She will use this loan to purchase construction materials (cement, sand, and beams) and to pay for labor to continue the construction on her house.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials (cement, sand, and beams) and to pay for labor to continue the construction on her house.

loans.name: Angelica

texts.pt:
Angelica de 41 anos de idade, nasceu em Chokwe, vive na casa própria, separada e mãe de um filho que não vai a escola. Sustenta suas mães que vivem juntas. 
É comerciante a mais de 8 anos e aprendeu com ajuda da sua mãe.
 Com o presente empréstimo de 20.000,00 (vinte mil meticais) irá pagar material de coferagem e mão-de-obra dos trabalhadores que estão a construir sua casa.
Tem como sonhos concluir sua casa e construir dependências para arrendar.
O principal desafio é a falta de fundos para investir nessas aspirações
texts.en:
Angelica, 41 years old, was born in Chokwe. She lives in her own home, is divorced, and has one son who is not in school. She also supports her mother, who lives with her. 
She has been a shopkeeper for more than eight years and learned the trade from her mother.
She will use this loan of 20,000 meticals to pay for the materials for supporting formwork and to pay two laborers who are building her home.
Her dreams are to finish her home and build rooms to rent out.
Her biggest challenge is finding the funds to pursue her goals.

loans.use: to pay for the materials for supporting formwork and to pay two laborers who are building her home.

loans.name: Violeta

texts.pt:
Violeta de 53 anos de idade, vive na casa cedida pelos serviços, viúva e mãe de 4 filhos, desses 2 vão a escola e os outros envolvidos em projectos de geração de rendimento. Sustenta apenas os 2 filhos que vivem consigo. 
Desde 1986 que faliu a empresa onde trabalhava, tornou-se comerciante onde exerce está actividade a porta da unidade sanitária de Magude. Este é o 3 empréstimo na hluvuku, onde levantou 8.000,00 e 16.000,00 ambos para comercio.
 Com o presente empréstimo de 25.000,00 (vinte e cinco mil meticais) irá comprar arroz, farinha, óleo, e cebola no sentido de aumentar seu volume de mercadoria.
Tem como sonhos comprar um congelador, uma casa e desenvolver mais seu negócio.
O principal desafio é a falta de fundos para investir nessas aspirações.
texts.en:
Violeta, 53 years old, lives in public housing. She is a widow and has four children, two of whom are in school and the others of whom are able to support themselves. She supports only the two children who live with her. 
Since 1986, when the company where she was working went bankrupt, she has been a vendor outside the clinic in Magude. This is her third loan with Hluvuku, having previously received 8,000 and 16,000 meticals for her business.
 She will use the current loan of 25,000 meticals to buy rice, flour, oil, and onions to increase the stock she carries.
Her dreams are to buy a freezer and a house and to expand her business.
Her biggest challenge is finding the funds to pursue her goals.

loans.use: to buy rice, flour, oil, and onions to increase the stock she carries.

loans.name: Leonel

texts.pt:
Leonel de 22 anos de idade, órfão de pai e solteiro, vive na casa dos pais com sua mãe, sua irmã, seu filho e duas sobrinhas. Seu filho ainda não tem direito a frequência escolar devido a sua idade e além deste menor, apoia sua mãe em satisfazer as despesas domésticas. 
É Talhante, compra gado bovino dentro das localidades de Magude, abate na matadoura e vende a carne a retalho e graças a sua mãe aprendeu o trabalho.
 Com o presente empréstimo de 30.000,00 (trinta mil meticais) irá comprar duas cabeças de gado bovino no sentido de aumentar seu volume de mercadoria.
Tem como sonhos adquirir uma viatura caixa aberta para lhe facilitar no transporte do gado.
O principal desafio é a falta de fundos para investir nessas aspirações.
texts.en:
Leonel is 22 years old. His father is dead and he is unmarried. He lives in his family's home with his mother, his sister, his son, and two nieces. His son is not yet old enough to attend school. Leonel helps his mother cover household expenses. 
He is a butcher, buying cattle in the villages around Magude with his sister, slaughtering them, and selling the meat. He learned how to do this work from his mother.
He will use the current loan of 30,000 meticals to buy two cows in order to increase the volume of meat he carries.
His dream is to acquire a truck so he can transport the livestock.
His biggest challenge is finding the funds to pursue his goals.

loans.use: to buy two cows in order to increase the volume of meat he carries.

loans.name: Cristina

texts.pt:
Nasceu na Matola Província de Maputo tem 37 anos de idade, solteira mãe de 3 filhos apenas 1 é maior de idade, todos frequentam a escola, responsabiliza-se pela sua irmã que vive em sua casa.
É vendedora de sapatos no mercado informal vulgo shoprit, ganha um valor que aplica nas despesas da sua casa e no seu negócio. Com este empréstimo pretende aumentar o volume do seu negócio adquirindo sapatos usados para a venda. Este é o seu 3º empréstimo na hluvuku.
Futuramente pretende iniciar um negócio de venda de carne de vaca e garantir o ensino da sua filha até ao nível superior.
texts.en: Cristina was born in the province of Matola in Maputo. She is 37 years old and unmarried. She has three children, one of whom is an adult. They are all in school, and she also supports her sister, who lives with her. She has an informal business selling shoes and earns enough to cover her household and business expenses. She will use this loan to buy secondhand shoes to resell. This is her third loan with Hluvuku. In the future, she intends to start a business selling beef so she can pay for her daughter's higher education.

loans.use: to buy secondhand shoes to resell.

loans.name: Haydee Leticia

texts.es:
Haydee  de 25 años de edad, esta estudiando en la universidad, ella es soltera pues manifiesta que su idea es terminar sus estudios universitarios, para posteriormente tener un trabajo,  a ella le ayudan de estados unidos para los gastos de alimentación, es poco pero ella lo invierte en estudio, y saca los créditos para el pago de la colegiatura, y con lo poco que le ayudan paga las cuotas, ella no se dedica a ningún trabajo o negocio, pues su tiempo libre lo dedica a estudiar para estar preparada en los exámenes,.

El préstamo que esta solicitando a CREDICAMPO, es para pagar la colegiatura del segundo ciclo del año, pues dará inicio la semana del 21/07/2014. Con el préstamo se le ayudara mucho pues se le da la oportunidad de continuar sus estudios, por eso se siente muy contenta porque se le ha confiado los préstamos y manifiesta que contara el esfuerzo a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Haydee is 25 years old, single, and is studying at university. She states that her plan is to finish her university studies so that later she can get a job. She has support from the United States for food expenses. It's very little but she invests in her studies and takes out loans to pay for her tuition. With the little help she gets, she makes her payments. She does not work or have a business as she spends her free time studying in order to be prepared for exams.

She is requesting this loan from CrediCampo to pay tuition for the second semester which began on July 21, 2014. This loan will help her a lot as it will give her the opportunity to continue her studies. She is very happy because of the trust given through these loans and she states that she will teach her children to be hard workers.

loans.use: to pay tuition for a second semester.

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.es:
Yolanda tiene 53 años de edad, estudió hasta 3º grado de educación básica, está acompañada y su compañero de vida es agricultor. Sus hijos son mayores de edad pero solo uno vive con ellos.

Yolanda se dedica a la venta de tortillas, tiene 2 años de realizar esta actividad, esto le resultó una oportunidad de negocio por  la gran demanda de sus vecinos. Antes solo trabajaba su esposo pero cuando sus hijos se acompañaron era necesario generar mas ingresos para la casa. Ella trabaja en el corredor de su casa, el maíz que es la materia prima que ocupa, la compra en la ciudad a 8 km de su casa, viaja en autobús cada 4 días para realizar la compra.  

Ella necesita el crédito para comprar maíz y pagar unas deudas que tiene vigentes. Esto le dará oportunidad de tener mejores ganancias ya que el precio del maíz subirá por la escases de lluvia en la zona del país.

 Ella desea que el negocio sea estable y poder hacer mejoras en su casa.
texts.en:
Yolanda is 53 years old. She went to school through the third grade of primary education. She has a life partner, who is a farmer. Their children are adults, but only one lives with them.

Yolanda sells tortillas. She has had this business for two years. This turned out to be a business opportunity for her because of the great demand of her neighbors. Before, only her husband was working, but when their children got married, it was necessary to generate more income for the household. She works in the corridor of their home. She buys the corn that is the basic ingredient that she uses in the city 8 kilometers from her house. She travels by bus every four days to make the purchase.

She needs the loan to buy corn and pay some debts that she has. This will give her the opportunity to have better earnings, since the price of corn will go up due to the scarcity of rain in this zone of the country.

She wants her business to be stable and to be able to make improvements in her house.

loans.use: to buy corn and pay some existing debts. This will give her the opportunity to have better earnings, since the price of corn will go up due to the scarcity of rain in that zone of the country.

loans.name: Irene's Group

texts.en:
Irene's group is comprised of  hard-working women. Irene is 20 years old and lives in the town of Nakifuma in the Mukono region of Uganda. She is single and has three children with two of them currently in school. For the past three years, Irene has been working hard to manage her retail shop, which sells rice, sugar, posho (cornmeal), and cooking oil. 

To help expand her business, Irene has requested a loan of 700,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy rice, sugar, posho, and cooking oil, and will help Irene to generate greater profits and increase her working capital. Irene hopes that in the future she will be able to build her own house. 

Irene is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: buy rice, sugar, posho (cornmeal), and cooking oil

loans.name: Miria

texts.en:
Miria is a hardworking woman. She is 20 years old and lives in the town of Kabwohe in the Kabwohe region of Uganda. She is single and has no children. For the past year, she has been working hard to manage her salon business, which deals in hair dressing. 

To help expand her business, Miria has requested a loan of 300,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy chemicals and weaves, and will help her to generate greater profits and personal development. Miria hopes that in the future she will be able to expand the business. 

Miria is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to micro-finance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to buy chemicals and weaves.

loans.name: Hanifa

texts.en:
Hanifa is a hard working woman. Hanifa is 16 years old and lives in the town of Nakifuma in the Mukono region of Uganda. She is single and has no children. For the past 3 years Hanifa has been working hard to manage her food stall business, which sells raw food like cassava and potatoes. 

To help expand her business Hanifa has requested a loan of 300,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy bananas, tomatoes and cassava, and will help Hanifa to generate greater profits and expand the business. Hanifa hopes that in the future she will be able to build her own house. 

Hanifa is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to buy bananas, tomatoes and cassava.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is a hard working woman. Fatuma is 17 years old and lives in the town of Nakifuma in the Mukono region of Uganda. She is single and has no children. For the past 5 years Fatuma has been working hard to manage her soft drinks business, which sells cold soft drinks. 

To help expand her business, Fatuma has requested a loan of 700,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more soft drinks, and will help Fatuma to generate greater profits and pay school fees. Fatuma hopes that in the future she will be able to build rental houses. 

Fatuma is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to buy more soft drinks to sell.

loans.name: Stella

texts.en:
Stella is a hard working women. Stella is 22 years old and lives in the town of Nakifuma in the Mukono region of Uganda. She is single and has 3 children who are all currently in school. For the past 3 years, Stella has been working hard to manage her tailoring business, which deals in sewing clothes. 

To help expand her business, Stella has requested a loan of 300,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy material, and will help Stella to generate greater profits and expand the business. Stella hopes that in the future she will be able to buy a sewing machine. 

Stella is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to buy material for her business.

loans.name: Mahsuda

texts.en:
Mahsuda was born in 1972. She is a kind and hardworking woman. She is married and brought up 3 children. Mahsuda has been busy with processing and selling dried fruits. She began this business 12 years ago. Every season she buys a garden of apricots, collects the apricots and processes them. Then she sells the dried apricots in a local market. Her children help her with managing her business. 

Mahsuda also has additional income from animal husbandry. She feeds 2 milk cows and sells milk to local people. She is going to buy dried fruits for increasing her working capital. She is asking for a loan of 10,000 somoni to buy dried fruits. She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: to buy dried fruits for increasing her working capital.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Elizabeth is 45 years old and has four children. They live in a rural community and make their living through farming. Due to financial hardship, they help each other in planting various vegetables and root crops for sale.  They aimed to expand their plantation but they have limited capital. For this reason, Elizabeth wants to access a  loan of PHP 27,000 to buy fertilizers and herbicides needed in vegetable production. They are hoping that they will increase their production and income through this financial assistance.

loans.use: to buy herbicides and fertilizers needed in vegetable production

loans.name: Valentina

texts.en:
Valentina is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a dried fish vending business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 25 years. Valentina earns more income from pig fattening. She is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to purchase more fish to make dried fish for her business.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and now she has requested an additional loan to further build her business. She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. Valentina wants to save money to repair and renovate her family home.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to make dried fish.

loans.name: Normelita

texts.en:
Normelita is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a rice farming business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 11,000 through NWTF to buy additional sacks of fertilizers and other farm supplies for her rice farming business.

Normelita has been in this business for 3 years. Normelita earns more income from selling rice.

She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts, with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Tarasisi

texts.en:
Tarasisi is a forty-four-year-old married man living in Kamwenge, Uganda, with six children between the ages of eighteen and six years. He deals in livestock and also practices crop farming. He began this business in order to educate his children. However, he faces the challenges of prolonged droughts and lack of capital. He has dreams of becoming a model farmer.

He is requesting a loan to buy more cattle to sell.

loans.use: to buy more cattle to sell.

loans.name: Ear's Group

texts.en:
Originally from a village of the Bovel district where rice farming is a common way to make a living, Ear is a 47-year-old mother of two children. Rice farming and sesame growing are the main sources of her family’s income. She and her husband have been in this business for 11 years.
 
This is the fourth microloan for Ear with VisionFund. Now she is leading her group to seek a loan. She wants to use her portion to buy school materials for her children to study. She hopes this loan will enable her children to have enough school supplies to study.

loans.use: to buy school materials for her children to study.

loans.name: Hellen's Group

texts.en:
Hellen's Group is comprised of hard working women. Hellen is 16 years old and lives in the town of Nakifuma in the Mukono region of Uganda. She is single and has no children. For the past 1 year, Hellen has been working hard to manage her craft shop, which sells handcrafts. 

To help expand her business, Hellen has requested a loan of 300,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy craft materials, and will help Hellen to generate greater profits and expand the business. Hellen hopes that in the future she will be able to have more crafts for the market. 

Hellen is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to buy craft materials.

loans.name: Hadija

texts.en:
Hadija is a hard working woman. Hadija is 16 years old and lives in the town of Nakifuma in the Mukono region of Uganda. She is single and has no children. For the past 2 years, Hadija has been working hard to manage her food stall business, which sells raw food like cassava, potatoes and egg plants.

To help expand her business, Hadija has requested a loan of 500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy bananas, tomatoes and cassava, and will help Hadija to generate greater profits and expand the business. Hadija hopes that in the future she will be able to build retail shops.

Hadija is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to buy bananas, tomatoes and cassava.

loans.name: Lorie

texts.en: Lorie, aged 48, is married to a farmer and blessed with three children. She has managed a retail store in their village for almost two years, earning a net income of about PHP 400 daily. Due to insufficient funds from her business she would like to get a loan amounting to PHP 14,000 to purchase noodles, soft drinks, canned goods, frozen foods and rice grains to sell. She's hoping that her requested loan will be granted so that she will be able to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase noodles, soft drinks, canned goods, frozen foods and rice grains to sell.

loans.name: Norol

texts.en:
As a widowed parent of eight children, Norol works hard to support her family.

She has a farming rice business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from buying and selling rice. Norol is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to purchase additional fertilizers and other farm supplies for her rice farming business.

Norol has been sustaining her business activities through her past 14 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Vivencia

texts.en:
As a married parent of ten children, four of whom are in school, Vivencia works hard to support her family.

She has a dried fish making business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from pig fattening.  She is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to buy additional boxes of fish to make dried fish for her dried fish making business.

Vivencia has been sustaining her business activities through her past 25 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional boxes of fish to make dried fish.

loans.name: Keleb

texts.en:
Kaleb is a hardworking married man living in Kamwenge, Uganda, with four children between the ages of four and ten. He deals in livestock and also practices crop farming. He started this business in order to educate his children. Inadequate capital causes a threat to his business. He has dreams of becoming a modernized farmer.

He will use the loan to buy more cattle to sell.

loans.use: to buy more cattle to sell.

loans.name: Rowena

texts.en:
Rowena is 28 years old and married with two children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a buy and sell charcoal business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy more sacks of charcoal to sell.

Rowena has borrowed and paid off 10 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the buy and sell charcoal business for 10 years and also earns an income from farming vegetables. She aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more sacks of charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Justine

texts.en:
Justine is a hardworking woman. She is 21 years old and lives in the town of Njeru in the Jinja region of Uganda. She is single and has one child who is currently in school. For the past 2 years, Justine has been working hard to manage her clothing shop, selling clothes. 

To help expand her business, Justine has requested a loan of 300,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more clothes, and will help Justine to generate greater profits and educate her child. Justine hopes that in the future she will be able to expand on the clothing business. 

Justine is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to micro-finance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to buy more clothes.

loans.name: Christian

texts.en: Christian, 21 years of age, is taking up Information Technology in St. Paul College of Tarlac. His mother is an OFW (overseas Filipino worker) who sends a monthly remittance, which is sometimes not sufficient. For Christian to push through his studies he wants to avail himself of a loan of PHP 10,000 from Kiva lenders. He is hopeful that he will finish college for he knows that this is the key to a better future.

loans.use: to pay his tuition fees.

loans.name: Riza

texts.en: Riza is 20 years old from Tarlac City. She is taking up Food and Beverage Services in St. Paul College of Tarlac. She works in real estate but she doesn't have a fixed income. She is hopeful that she will finish college to find a stable job and to help her family. To be able to pay for her tuition fees she wants to ask for financial assistance of PHP 10,000 from Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to pay her tuition fees.

loans.name: Zyndel Marie

texts.en:
Zyndel Marie is 24 years old and single. She works very hard to provide for her parents. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo and groceries, etc.

She has been in this business for 10 years and sells a variety of items at retail prices. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell, like shampoo and groceries, etc.

loans.name: Thelma

texts.en:
Thelma is 61 years old and married with four children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stocks like canned goods, eggs, soap, shampoo, etc. to sell.

Thelma has borrowed and repaid 12 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 5 years and also earns an income from raising livestock and farming vegetables.

Thelma aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stock like canned goods, eggs, soap, shampoo, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en: Emmanuel is a hardworking forty-year-old married man living in Kamwenge, Uganda. He deals in livestock and also runs a retail shop. He started this business in order to educate his children. Inadequate capital hinders his business. He has dreams of becoming a modernized farmer. He intends to use the loan money to buy more cattle to sell from his farm.

loans.use: to buy more cattle to sell from his farm.

loans.name: Bol's Group

texts.en:
Bol is aged 45 years and married with three children living in a rural village of Battambang province’s Bovel district. All of his three children are still in school. He and his wife earn a living through farming rice and growing chili peppers. They have been in this business for twelve years. To supplement the income, they also work as paid workers. The current business earns them about 65,000 KHR per day, and they manage to save about 40,000 KHR each day for future needs. 

Bol’s group consists of two members, and he has been with VisionFund for two cycles. He is now leading his group to seek a loan. As the leader, he is going to use his portion to buy school materials and clothes for supporting his child’s education. He hopes to have enough school materials for his children.

loans.use: to buy school materials and clothes for supporting her child’s education

loans.name: Azimio  Bunda Bunda Group

texts.en:
Dotto, who is in his early 40s, is married with four kids who are still at school.  He has been selling clothes of different types for men, women and kids for two years now.  He works from 07 am to 08 pm daily and is able to make a fair monthly profit.

This will be Dotto's 1st loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. He will use it to buy up-to-date clothes to match his customers' choices. He dreams of building a big place for buying and selling clothes from outside the country.

Dotto will share this loan with his loan group, "AZIMIO BUNDA", which has five members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy up-to-date clothes to match her customers' choices.

loans.name: Zenaida

texts.en:
Zenaida is 52 years old, married, and has three children. She is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. Zenaida requested a PHP 23,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

She has been raising pigs for 6 years now, and has borrowed 12 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it. In the future, Zenaida would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Julius

texts.en: Julius is a thirty-three-year-old hardworking married man living in Kamwenge, Uganda. He deals in selling produce as his main source of income, though he also practices farming. He started this business to sustain his family and have better standards of living. He faces a challenge of competition and weather changes that affect his produce business. He has a vision of owning a big modern store of produce in years to come. With the loan money, Julius intends to buy more maize and beans to sell.

loans.use: to buy more maize and beans to sell.

loans.name: Vanessa

texts.en:
Vanessa is 30 years old and married with three children. With two children in school, Vanessa works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell like coffee, egg, sugar, soap, shampoo, etc.

Vanessa has been in this business for 5 years.

In the future Vanessa would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional items like coffee, egg, sugar, soap, shampoo, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Sulainah

texts.en:
Sulainah is a forty-seven-year-old woman living in Kamwenge, Uganda. She owns a boutique and that is her major source of income although she also practices farming. She started this business so as to earn herself a living. She dreams of becoming a prominent business woman though she faces a problem of inadequate capital.
 
She intends to use the loan to buy more shoes to sell.

loans.use: to buy more shoes to sell.

loans.name: Monica

texts.en:
Monica is a forty-two-year-old hard working married woman living in Kamwenge, Uganda. She deals in decorations to earn a living, alongside farming. She started this business to sustain her family and have better standards of living. She faces a challenge of competition though she has future ambitions of becoming a prominent business woman. 

She is requesting a loan to buy more decorations so as to provide variety to her customers.

loans.use: to buy more decorations for her business.

loans.name: Bienvinido

texts.en: Bienvinido, 37 years of age, is married and blessed with two children. He has managed a transportation business in their village for almost three years and earns a net income of about PHP 400 daily. Due to insufficient funds from his business, he would like to get a loan amounting to PHP 8,000 to pay for the repairs and maintenance of his motorcycle. He's hoping that his requested loan will be granted so that he can improve his business to earn more income for his family.

loans.use: To pay for the repairs and maintenance of his motorcycle.

loans.name: Guillerma

texts.en:
Guillerma is 46 years old and lives in Tangub City, Philippines. She is married with three children. 

Guillerma has a carenderia. She has had this business for 20 years. She requested a loan to purchase meat and spices.

Guillerma has been a member of PMPC for three years.  In the future, Guillerma hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase meat and spices for her carenderia.

loans.name: Nora

texts.en: Nora has been engaged in a hog-raising business to supplement her husband's income. She is 37 years old and has two schooling children. Despite the hardship of living, she and her husband aspire to improve their status of living and to educate their children. In this regard, she aims to acquire more pigs to raise. Due to capital insufficiency, she would like to get a loan of PHP 45,000 to buy hog feed, vitamins and additional pigs to raise. Being a patient and hardworking mother, she believes that someday she will further improve the business.

loans.use: to buy hog feed, vitamins and additional pigs to raise.

loans.name: Babra

texts.en:
Babra is a hardworking twenty-eight-year-old, married woman living in Kamwenge, Uganda. She owns a milling machine as her main source of income alongside agriculture. She started this business so that she can educate her children. Her main hardship is inadequate capital to buy more cereals and pay high bills like electricity and rent. She has hopes of becoming a prominent businesswoman.

Babra is requesting a loan to buy more maize to make maize flour for selling.

loans.use: to buy more maize to make maize flour for selling.

loans.name: Jean

texts.en: Jean works hard to support her family, living in Kamwenge, Uganda. She is married and has a fishing business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 21,000 loan through NWTF to buy materials for fishing like nets, wood, gasoline, etc. In the future, Jean would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy materials for fishing like nets, wood, gasoline, etc.

loans.name: Francis

texts.en: Francis is a hardworking sixty-year-old married man living in Kamwenge, Uganda. He deals in livestock and also practices crop farming. He started this business in order to educate his children and improve his standard of living. However, he faces a challenge of insufficient capital. He has dreams of becoming a modernized farmer. Francis is requesting a loan to buy more cattle to sell from his farm.

loans.use: to buy more cattle to sell from his farm.

loans.name: Kimhav's Group

texts.en:
Living in a rural village of the Chaom Ksan district, Kimhav is 58 years old and married with one son. 

The main sources of the family’s income are rice farming and raising chickens and pigs. He and his wife have been in these businesses for five years to make a living. 

Kimhav’s group consists of four members and he has been with VisionFund for two cycles. He successfully used the past loans to better support his family. Now he can earn about 22,000 KHR per day. 

Now leading his group to apply for a loan, Kimhav will use his portion to buy a solar panel. He hopes to have electricity to use, especially at night time, for his family.

loans.use: to buy a solar panel.

location.town: Preah Vihear Province, Chaom Ksan District

loans.name: Nyabange Grp Group

texts.en:
Mzee, a businessman in his early thirties, is married and has two schooling daughters. He runs his family by managing a cereals business, which he has been with for ten years now. A barbershop is his second business. He works from 07 am to 06 pm daily and is able to make a small profit each month. 

Mzee is requesting his second loan via Kiva's partner, Tujijenge Tanzania. He used the previous loan, which he repaid, to purchase cereals (corn and beans) for his business. He managed to resell his stock and earned extra income which he used to cover school fees and home food expenses. In the coming days, Mzee would like to grow his business portfolio. With his new loan request, he will buy stocks of beans and corn, and also salon equipment. 

He will share this loan with his loan group,"NYABANGE", which consists of four members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy stocks of beans and corn and also salon equipment.

loans.name: Viebeth

texts.en:
Viebeth is 36 years old and married with four children, who are in school. Viebeth works very hard to provide for them. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stocks to sell, like canned goods, eggs, milk, sugar, etc.

Viebeth has been in this business for three years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks to sell, like canned goods, eggs, milk, sugar, etc.

loans.name: Amina

texts.en:
Amina hails from Dhupguri.  She is a young entrepreneur of 28 years.  She is married and blessed with two children (one son and one daughter). They are students of fourth and sixth grades.  Amina is illiterate but can sign her name.  They live in West Magurmari in the district Jalpaiguri.

Amina's husband Shahidul, who is 46 years old and illiterate, is a farmer by profession.  He tills his own small piece of land and cultivates different kinds of vegetables throughout the year.  His income is insufficient for the family's household expenses.  

Amina understands that the growing needs of their children cannot be met with the current earnings.  So besides handling her household responsibilities, she rears cattle.  She has a dairy cow.  She sells the milk locally and earns additional income for the family.  

She wants to expand her business by selling milk products such as paneer (cottage cheese), butter, curd, etc.  She wants to start this because of the high demand of the products in the area.  So she needs one more dairy cow.  A financial help will make her dream comes true.

So Amina is seeking a business loan from BJS (Kiva's partner), who give loans to needy rural women.  She will utilise the loan to purchase a cow, which will provide her with more milk to start a milk products business.  The money earned from the business will contribute towards improving her savings and providing better education for her children in renowned schools.

She is thankful to BJS and Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase a cow to expand her business.

loans.name: María

texts.es:
María de 40 años de edad,  solo asistió a primer grado, pero ya se le olvido lo que le enseñaron, aunque puede sacar cuentas y firmar, ella se dedica a la elaboración de petates con sus dos hijas, mientras que los hijos varones y su esposo se dedican a la agricultura, (siembra de maíz, frijol), elaboración de canastos y venta de petates, canastos en los pueblos lejanos, ella y su familia desde pequeños han aprendido a elaborar petates y canastos, pues en el lugar son los trabajos que realiza la mayoría de personas, son heredado de sus padres.

El préstamo que esta solicitando a CREDICAMPO,  es para comprar  3 sacos de maíz, pues en el país paro de llover por más de un mes y los cultivos de maíz se perdieron y el saco de maíz esta por el momento a $56 y se cree que por las perdidas a futuro habrá un aumento muy considerable, por lo que pretende prevenirse, también comprara 9 maletas de tule para la elaboración de petates y varas de bamboo para hacer canastos.
