 Ella sueña con que uno de sus hijos el que estudia, sea profesional y a futuro comprar un carro, para trasladar la mercadería, pues cuando el esposo la saca a vender les toca pagar un vehículo.
texts.en:
40-year old María only has a grade 1 education and has already forgotten what she was taught. However, she can do sums and sign her name. She earns her living making bed mats with help from her two daughters. Her sons and husband work on the land growing maize and beans. They also make baskets and bed mats and sell them in distant markets. María and her family have been making bed mats and baskets since they were young, a skill they learned from their parents. In the area they live, most people earn their living this way.

The loan that María is seeking from CrediCampo is to buy three bags of maize because it stopped raining for over a month and they lost their maize crop. At the moment a bag of maize costs $56, but it may cost much more in the future because of the failed harvest. For this reason she is trying to avoid the problem. María also wishes to buy nine bundles of reeds to make bed mats and bamboo for the baskets.

Her dream is to see one of her sons continue his education and get a good job so that in the future he can buy a vehicle to take the merchandise to market. At the moment her husband has to pay for transportation of the mats and baskets.

loans.use: Buy three bags of maize, nine bundles of reeds, and bamboo to make bed mats and baskets

loans.name: Señor Nazareno Group

texts.es: Los socios del grupo “SEÑOR NAZARENO” están dedicados al comercio ambulatorio y en sus puestos de trabajo. Zusana tiene 54 años de edad es conviviente. Ella se dedica a la venta de frutas confitería y comida rápida en forma ambulatoria. El crédito lo invertirá en la compra de más frutas confitería y gaseosas aguas para obtener una ganancia extra. El grupo agradece a los inversionistas KIVA por el crédito brindado. Zusana es la que se encuentra para en el lado izquierdo viste polo marrón.
texts.en:
The members of the group “SEÑOR NAZARENO” work in street sales and in sales from food stalls. 

Zusana is 54 years old. She will invest the loan on the purchase of more fruit, pastries and carbonated drinks to derive extra income.

The group is grateful to KIVA for the loan to be provided.

Zusana is on the left side and is seen wearing a brown top.

loans.use: with the purchase of more fruits, pastries, water, and sodas.

loans.name: Bijay

texts.en:
Bijay is a 40-year-old differently-abled man living in a small village in the Puri District of Odisha, India with his mother, wife and two children who are in school. Bijay is engaged in coconut and coconut water selling. On summer days, people like to drink coconut water as they think coconut water is good for the stomach. Bijay serves fresh and good quality coconut water to his customers. He wants to open a fruit stall and for that reason, he has requested this loan to buy fruits in bulk.

He is the only person in his family who earns money and all of the family expenses depend on his business. He has a dream of making a house for his family. He is very thankful to Kiva for this kind help and support.

loans.use: to buy fruits in bulk for his fruit stall

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy livestock and food for his livestock   .

loans.name: Arati

texts.en:
Arati is only 29 years old. She is married to Dhanakanta. They have two children (one son and one daughter). Arati is a homemaker and is illiterate. She can only sign her name. Her husband is also uneducated. Both their children are students and are in grades 9 and 6.  Arati's husband is associated with agribusiness. They have a small kachha house (made of straw, mud and bamboo) in the small town of Dhupguri in the district of Jalpaiguri.

Arati's husband, aged 44 years, is a farmer and earns a living by farming green vegetables like chili, cabbages, and different vegetables in different seasons on their plot of land. She and her husband work hard and always grow high quality products that they sell in the local market to make their livelihood. She needs to expand her existing business to give additional financial support to her family. She thought of cultivating paddy on their land, which is a crop that is in great demand in West Bengal and used in many states of India as a staple food.

Arati heard that BJS gives loans to rural women for their businesses. She has taken a loan from them to purchase high quality paddy seeds and fertilizers to start cultivation. Her dream is to improve the family's finances and to secure her children's career with the profit generated from this business.

She also aspires to construct a concrete and mortar-built house for them. She is very grateful to BJS and Kiva for funding her loan.

loans.use: To purchase seeds and other farm supplies to cultivate paddy.

loans.name: José Sabas

texts.es:
José de 42 años de edad,  no estudio la escuela le quedaba muy lejos y la situación en ese tiempo estaba un poco critica debido al conflicto armado que se dio, pero en medio de todo eso aprendió a leer y a escribir; esta casado su esposa es ama de casa y atención de un pequeño negocio que tienen en su casa, son padres de un hijo que estudia.  

Desde hace 6 años inicio ha trabajar con una pequeña tienda, el cual le ha sido rentable hasta el momento debido a eso es que solicita un financiamiento, para comprar detergentes, pan, frijoles, azúcar, fósforos, sal, leche,etc  y que los clientes encuentren en un lugar accesible los artículos de primera necesidad para el hogar y sobre todo los de la canasta básica; pues en ocasiones recorren grandes distancias para encontrar lo que buscan.  Las ventas serán mayores y sus ingresos por las ganancias que le ayudaran a mejorar su calidad de vida.

Él planea a futuro que su hijo se prepare academicamente y que tenga un mejor futuro, ademas de mejorar su casa y sobretodo cancelar el crédito y ampliar su negocio constantemente y que su calidad de vida también cambie.
texts.en:
42-year old José did not go to school as it was far away from where he lived. Also the situation at the time was very difficult because of the war. However, in the midst of all this, he learned to read and write. He is married; his wife looks after the house and runs the little store they have in their home. They have a son who is a student.

Six years ago José started the small store and it has done well. Now he is seeking a loan to buy detergent, bread, beans, sugar, matches, salt, milk etc. so that his customers can find what they need on a daily basis in one place. Sometimes they have to go long distances to find what they are looking for. Sales would then increase and help him improve his standard of living.

José hopes that in the future his son will complete his education and have a better future. He also plans to make improvements to his house and above all pay off his loan. He dreams too of expanding his business and improving his quality of life.

loans.use: Buy stock for his store so that his customers can find all they need in one place

loans.name: Foud Sana'a Group

texts.en: Foud Sana'a is a group which consists of four members of women who live in Sana'a, Yemen. They applied for a loan of 90,000 YER from AMB.Mona is the leader of the group. She is a 32-year-old married woman with two children, living with her family in their own house in Sana'a. She is a very active and dynamic woman. Her husband works in the private sector. In order to help him with the expenses of the family, Mona decided to work as a beautician for women. She started in this business many years ago. She earns a good amount of money. In reality, the money that she earns is not enough to cover all the expenses of the family. Therefore, Mona applied for a loan of 20,000 YER from AMB in order to purchase food materials for her house to face the needs of the family.Mona looks forward to save all kinds of foods materials to provide her children with a secure future.

loans.use: to purchase food materials for her house to face the needs of the family.

loans.name: Mullai Shg - Lalgudi Group

texts.en:
Paisunisha is the leader of the Mullai Self Help Group, which is managed by the local NGO People Action for Transformation (PAT) in Tamil Nadu. She lives in Lalgudi village with her children and husband in her own house. Her husband is running a printing press.
 
Paisunisha and the other four members are requesting a loan to purchase a smokeless stove that is manufactured by Greenway Grameen Infra Pvt, Ltd. It costs 1,400 INR per stove. Smokeless stoves emit less carbon dioxide, which reduces smoke. Traditional stoves consume more time and money. The smokeless stove is highly efficient and designed for the long term use. This will allow a reduction in problems related to health, deforestation and climate change.

loans.use: to purchase a smokeless stove

loans.name: Muthukaliamman Shg - Kalyanapuram Group

texts.en:
Latha is a member of the Muthukaliamman Self Help Group, which was formed by the local NGO, People Action for Transformation (PAT) in Tamil Nadu, India.  

Latha lives in Kalyanapuram village, Tanjore in her own house with her two children and husband. Latha’s husband is farmer and works for a daily wage. Latha has repaid all her previous loans on time, which she used to improve her livelihood.

Latha and the other four members of the group need a loan to purchase a smokeless stove manufactured by the Greenway Grameen Infra Pvt Ltd. The price of the smokeless stove is 1,400 INR. These women use firewood stoves. Handling the wood logs around the fire requires caution to avoid injury as a result of the flame, and the tools used for manipulating the wood can get very hot and injure an individual if they touch them while hot. As logs are burned, they deposit creosote in the chute or chimney, which must be cleaned out, as it can lead to fires. Unfortunately, these women are putting themselves at the brink of contracting fatal lung diseases such as lung cancer, pneumonia, bronchitis, etc as they inhale a high volume of smoke emanating from burning firewood every day.

They all hope the smokeless stove will let them have healthier families.

loans.use: to purchase a smokeless stove

loans.name: Tableroja Shg - Gunamangalam Group

texts.en:
Kolanji is 30 years old and the leader of the Tableroja Self Help group, which consists of 14 other members. This group is managed by the local NGO, People Action for Transformation (PAT) in Tamil Nadu, India.

Kolanji is living in her own house with her children and husband. Her husband is a vegetable seller in their village Gunamangalam. Kolanji has taken loans from PAT previously to improve her livelihood and always repaid on time.
  
Kolanji and the other members of the group want a loan in order to buy a Greenway Smart Stove, a sustainable stove that reduces smoke emissions up to 80%, resulting in better long-term health due to decreased inhalation of smoke. 

They all hope this stove will let them have healthier families and are extremely excited about the possibility of saving on fuel and having less smoke emissions in their houses.

loans.use: to buy a sustainable stove

loans.name: Al- Ameer Group

texts.en:
Al-Ameer is a group comprising four members who are women who live in Sana'a, Yemen. They have applied for a loan of 100,000 YER from AMB.

Ghadir is the leader of the group. She is a 30-year-old married woman, living with her spouse in their own house. She studied until secondary school but she could not complete her studies because she married when she was a very young girl. 

Ghadir's husband is an employee in the private sector with a small salary. Due to his small salary, his family experiences a financial crisis in their household on most days. Also, most people purchase many kinds of food materials during this whole month (Ramadhan) in order to face all the needs of the fasting. The people fast in the day this month and they need to a delicious and good food. For this reason, Ghadir wants to a financial support to purchase many kinds of foods materials to the house in order to make a delicious food for her family who fast in the day of (Ramadhan). As a result, she applied for a loan of 20,000 YER from AMB in order to purchase food materials to save all the foods for the family during the holy month.
Ghadir looks forward to renovating her house which is very old.

loans.use: to purchase food materials to save all the foods for the family during the holy month.

loans.name: Siridi Sai Group

texts.en:
Arati, aged about 32 years, is the group leader of a four-member group from Jagannath Vihar, Gopal Basti of Bhubaneswar of Odisha, India. Her family comprises four members: her husband and two sons, aged 5 and 8 years. The member sitting second from right in front of the sewing machine is Arati. At present, she has been sewing dresses for ladies only for the last eight years and became a ladies’ tailor master in her locality. She is a very active lady who wants some extra income out of her own efforts.

Arati’s husband is assisting her to run the business smoothly by purchasing in bulk of thread, blouse pieces etc. from town. At present, her family income is Rs. 6,000 per month, which is not sufficient to maintain the family. 

To improve her living condition and to earn some extra income, she wants to avail a loan from Mahashakti. With the loan amount, she will purchase a sewing machine and stitching materials in bulk quantities. She has a dream to increase her business, stitch readymade dresses, supply them to the market and educate her children in a better school.

The other three members of her group are Sakuntala, Banalata and Subhadra, who are running dairy farm and tailoring businesses in their locality.

loans.use: to purchase a sewing machine and stitching materials.

loans.name: Chinmayee Group

texts.en:
Amita, aged about 32 years, is the group leader of a four-member group from Rental Colony, Baramunda of Bhubaneswar, Odisha, India. Her family comprises four members: her husband, one son and one daughter of 12 and 6 years respectively. The member sitting second from the right in front of the sewing machine is Amita. At present, she is sewing dresses for ladies for the last two years and became a ladies’ tailor master in her locality. She is a very active lady who wants some extra income out of her own efforts.

Amita’s husband is assisting her to run the business smoothly by taking thread, blouse piece, clothes, etc. At present, her family income is Rs. 5,000 per month, which is not sufficient to maintain the family. 

To improve her living condition and to earn some extra income, she wants to avail a loan from Mahashakti. From the loan amount, she will purchase a sewing machine and stitching materials in bulk quantities. She has a dream to increase her business, stitch readymade dresses, supply them to the market and educate her children in a better school.

The other three members of her group are Tilotama, Sumitra and Bulilata, who are running a saree shop, tea shop and tailoring unit respectively.

loans.use: to purchase a sewing machine and stitching materials in bulk quantities.

loans.name: Mahalaxmi Narayani Group

texts.en:
Lalita, the lady sitting second from right with her hand raised in the photo is a very active woman of 38 years. She resides in a small house with her five-member family in a rural village named Larka in the Nuapada district in Odisha, India.

Lalita has been running a general grocery shop in her small house with items like soap, shampoo, washing powder, sugar, tea, oil, etc. for last 12 years. She started the business with a small investment of her own. Her monthly net income is around 4,000 INR. With this small income, it is very difficult on her part to maintain the family with the educational expenses of her children. So to expand the business for some more income, she and 12 other women of her village formed a Self Help group named Mahalaxmi Narayani to take a loan from Mahashakti Foundation. She will use the loan to purchase items like rice, wheat, lentils, oil, soap, potatoes etc. for her general store. This will help her to reduce her purchasing and transportation costs as she replenishes her stock frequently from a distance of 15 miles away. She hopes that this investment will give her more income and with enough savings, she will be able to construct a permanent cabin for her shop, purchase a moped for easy movement of her husband and give a better education to the children. The other 12 members of the group are running cycle repair centers, fabrication units, cloth-vending and tailoring centers.

loans.use: To purchase rice, wheat, lentils, oil, soap, and potatoes for her general store

loans.name: Adiba

texts.en:
Adiba is a 45-year-old married mother of four, who opened a year ago a clothes selling shop to support her retired husband in covering their family's living expenses.

Adiba is new in this domain, but she is working hard on developing her career properly. Today she is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner, Al Majmoua, to increase her business merchandise with the newly released summer collection especially for the end of Holy month of Ramadan celebrations.

She hopes that one day she can expand and diversify her business with clothes that suits all family member's needs.

loans.use: To increase her business merchandise with the newly released summer collection

loans.name: Bob

texts.en:
Bob is a 26-year-old, single man, living in Kamwenge, Uganda. He deals in the mobile selling of clothes, although he also owns rentals and practices the selling of maize and coffee. 

He started this business, so as to earn himself a living and to boost and diversify income. He desires to become a diversified businessman, although he still has less capital.

He intends to use the loan to buy more clothes to sell.

loans.use: to buy more clothes to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine and fabric.

loans.name: Gull Kiran

texts.en:
Thirty-three-year old Gull Kiran has been running a school for three years. She is quite enthusiastic regarding the provision of education to young children. With the aim of promoting education in her locality, she opened up a small school in her area. Now the school has over 100 students, of which more than half are girls. 

She has availed a loan of 100,000 PKR (Pakistani rupees) to purchase more desks and chairs for the school so that she can ensure a comfortable environment for her students that is conducive to learning.

loans.use: to purchase more desks and chairs.

loans.name: Saima

texts.en:
Twenty-two-year-old Saima runs the school along with her older brother. When the brother-sister team took over the school in 2012, it was in bad shape and only had 12 students. Now it has 159 students. They quickly turned things around by working hard to improve the management and quality of the school. 

They need the loan to purchase new furniture to make the school environment more comfortable for their students, and to accommodate their increasing enrollment. That is why Saima has applied for a loan of 100,000 PKR (Pakistani rupees). She is eager to provide quality education to her students for their prosperous future.

loans.use: to purchase new furniture.

loans.name: Al- Mahaba Wal Ikha Group

texts.en:
Al- Mahaba Wal Ikha is a group which comprises of four members of women who live in Sana'a, Yemen. They applied for a loan of 90,000 YER from AMB.
Intsar is the leader of the group. She is a 28 years old married woman with only one child. She studied till the Secondary education, but she couldn't complete her study. Her husband is an employee as a solider, and she works as a housewife, living with her family in a rented  house. Her husband is the sole breadwinner of the family. His salary is not enough to cover all the expenses of the family. Most of people purchase many kinds of food  materials in this hole month ( Ramadhan) in order to face all the needs of the fasting. The people fast in the day this month and they need to a delicious and good food. For this reason, Intsar wants to a financial support to purchase many kinds of foods materials to the house in order to make a delicious food for her family who fast in the day. As a result, she applied for a loan of 20,000 YER from AMB in order to purchase food materials to her house to save all the needs of the foods inside the home during the holy month.
Intsar looks forward to preparing her house with all kinds of foods materials in order to save a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase food materials to make meals at the end of the day for her family who is fasting during Ramadan

loans.name: Estéfani Yamileth

texts.es:
Estefani tiene 22 años de edad, está acompañada y vive en casa de sus suegros, estudió hasta  bachillerato y no pudo seguir estudiando debido a la situación económica, su pareja se dedica a la agricultura y albañilería.


Ella tiene experiencia en la agricultura, ya que desde muy pequeña le gustaban los trabajos del campo y trabajaba con su papá, hoy en día junto a su esposo se dedican la agricultura para tener los alimentos de cada día y obtener ingresos para comprar lo mas necesario en el hogar.


EL crédito lo necesita para comprar materiales ya que esta construyendo unos cuartos y necesita del crédito para poder  terminar la construcción.


Ella planea seguir trabajando en la agricultura para poder vender los granos básicos y obtener mejores ingresos para ayudar a su hija a salir adelante y poder darle lo necesario.
texts.en:
22-year old Estefani is married and lives with her in-laws. She graduated from high school but couldn't afford to continue her education. Her husband works on the land and in construction. She herself has experience working on the land, and ever since she was small she has enjoyed farming and helping her father. Now she works alongside her husband so they can buy food and other household necessities.

The loan Estefani needs is to buy building materials as she is having some rooms added to her house and requires the money to complete construction.

She plans to continue farming so she has grains to sell and can earn money to help her daughter get ahead and provide her with the necessities of life.

loans.use: Buy building supplies to finish the construction of additiinal rooms

loans.name: Kishwar

texts.en:
Kishwar is a 40-year-old married woman and runs the school with her husband, who started the school in 1998. After their marriage, Kishwar took over the day-to-day management of the school guided by her husband. The couple wants their school to be child-centered, and wants to create a child friendly environment that students and parents will be happy with. 

This is the couple’s first loan as Kishwar has requested a loan of 100,000 PKR (Pakistnai rupees) and wants to use it to buy furniture and stationery items for the over 180 students enrolled in the school.

loans.use: to buy furniture and stationery items

loans.name: Marikolunthu Shg-Parukkal Group

texts.en:
Kalaiselvi is unmarried and the leader of the Marikolunthu Self-Help Group(holding a board with the SHG name written on it) which is managed by the local NGO, People’s Action for Transformation, in Tamil Nadu.

Kalaiselvi lives in her own house with her family. Her father is a farmer. They live in Parukkal, a small village in Ariyalur district. Kalaiselvi has taken loans from the PAT previously and has repaid the loan amounts on time.

Kalaiselvi and the other members of the group need a loan to purchase smokeless stoves, which are better than traditional stoves. Smokeless stoves produce less carbon dioxide and maintain a healthy environment. It’s convenient for cooking and designed for daily use.

loans.use: to buy a smokeless stove.

loans.name: Mullai Shg-Parukkal Group

texts.en:
Vasuki is 35 years old and lives in Parukkal village. She is the leader of the Mullai Self-Help Group(holding a board with the SHG name written on it) which was formed by the local NGO, People’s Action for Transformation (PAT), in Tamil Nadu, India. Vasuki lives in her own house with her two children and her husband. Her husband is a small, marginal farmer. Vasuki had taken loans from PAT previously and has promptly repaid her loans on time. 
 
Vasuki wants to purchase a smokeless stove, which is made by Greenway Grameen Infra Pvt., Ltd. The cost of a smokeless stove is INR 1,400 INR. The smokeless stove is comfortable for cooking and is high-efficiency designed for daily use. It produces less carbon dioxide, which is very harmful for children and pregnant women. Smokeless stoves produce 70% less smoke and are fuel-efficient compared to traditional stoves.

The other members of the group are requesting a loan to purchase smokeless stoves to have healthier families.

loans.use: to buy a smokeless stove.

loans.name: Throupathiamman Self Help Group - Athanur

texts.en:
Kalaiselvi is the leader of Throupathiamman Self Help group(holding a board with the SHG name written on it). She is the featured borrower. She is 40 years old. She stays with her husband and their child.
  
The group consists of 11 women from Athanur, Tanjore district, Tamilnadu. They all make a living from various small income-generating activities.  These hardworking women, before commencing their business every morning, prepare breakfast and lunch for their families using primitive cook stoves that operate on firewood. They prepare dinner after closing their businesses at night. They spend 3-4 hours every day cooking, and inhaling harmful smoke released by the burning of firewood. They are worried about exposing themselves and other family member to diseases such as bronchitis, lung cancer, pneumonia, etc. These women don’t want to turn a blind eye towards the adversities of using the primitive cook stoves. Rather, they wish to replace the old cook stoves with new, low-smoke ones. However, their marginal savings every month are not sufficient. So, they wish to procure a loan of INR 1400 each to purchase the cook stoves.

loans.use: to purchase a smokeless cook stove

loans.name: Dorren

texts.en:
Dorren is 20 years old and lives in the town of Busia in the Iganga region of Uganda. For the past one year Dorren has been working hard to manage her salon business, which deals in hair dressing. 

To help expand her business, Dorren has requested a loan of 150,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more hair dressing items such as hair braids for the business, and will help Dorren to generate greater profits and buy basic needs for her family. Dorren hopes that in the future she will be able to expand the salon into a bigger one and even start training. 

Dorren is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to buy more hair dressing items such as hair braids for the business

loans.name: Scovia Group

texts.en:
Scovia's group is comprised of 2 hard-working women. Scovia is 17 years old and lives in the town of Namutumba in the Iganga region of Uganda. For the past year, Scovia has been working hard to manage her small business, which sells a local drink called malwa. 

To help expand her business, Scovia has requested a loan of 700,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more millet that will help her in making the local drink, and will help Scovia to generate greater profits and pay rent for her workplace. Scovia hopes that in the future she will be able to open up a restaurant. 

Scovia is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.


"

loans.use: to buy more millet that will help her to make the local drink

loans.name: Lily Self-Help Group - Rajagiri

texts.en:
Alexmary is the leader of the “Lily” Self-Help Group (holding a board with the SHG name written on it) managed by the local NGO “People’s Action for Transformation” (PAT). Alexmary is married to a farmer and is living in Rajagiri, a small village in Tanjore District. She is 40 years old and has two children.

Alexmary has recently learned about the Greenway Smart Stove, a sustainable stove that reduces smoke emissions up to 70% resulting in better long-term health due to decreased inhalation of the poisonous gas.
 
Alexmary and the other seven members of the group are requesting a loan to buy this stove. All of them are extremely excited about the possibility of saving on fuel, having less smoke emissions in their houses and leading a healthier life.

loans.use: to buy a sustainable stove

loans.name: Maria Fe

texts.en:
Maria Fe works hard to support her family. Maria Fe is married and has a fish vending business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 16,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell.

Maria Fe has been in this business for 3 years now.

In the future Maria Fe would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell.

loans.name: Yowasi

texts.en:
Yowasi is a fifty-nine-year-old hardworking married man living in Kamwenge, Uganda. He has a retail shop as his main source of income. He faces competition and inadequate capital to buy more stock to sell. He has hopes of owning a wholesale shop.
  
He intends to use the loan to buy more sugar, beer, soda and other items to sell.

loans.use: to buy more sugar, beer, soda and other items to sell.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is 31 years old and married with three children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a business direct selling Natasha products (shoes and apparel) in the Philippines and requested a PHP 16,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more products to sell.

Susan has borrowed and repaid 10 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the direct selling business for four years and also earns income from fishing.

Susan aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more Natasha products to sell

loans.name: Bendita

texts.en:
A loan of USD $800 is offered to Bendita to improve her business. She has a kiosk where many people come to buy food items and other goods every day. She will use the loan to buy sugar, eggs, coffee, noodles, bread and slippers.She has been in business since 2008. She feels comfortable running her business because she can earn money every day.
Running a business has made Bendita independent because she can be responsible for herself and also help her family. She hopes to run a bigger business in the future.

loans.use: To buy sugar, eggs ,coffee, noodles, bread and slippers

loans.name: Saverino

texts.en:
Saverino is a 57-year-old coffee farmer who also sells produce and milk to earn extra income. He started this business to earn a living. He faces a challenge of price fluctuation. In spite of the challenges, he has a dream of becoming a model farmer.

He is requesting a loan to mulch his coffee plantation and buy more coffee to sell.

loans.use: to mulch his coffee plantation and buy more coffee to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a new refrigerator and products to sell in her store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy hog feed, vitamins, vaccines and materials needed to improve the pigpen

loans.name: Suzette

texts.en:
Suzette is 37 years old, married and has two children, one in school.

She is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. Suzette requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Suzette has been raising pigs for three years now, and has borrowed three times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Suzette would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Ruby

texts.en:
Ruby is 43 years old and married with two children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Ruby runs a buy and sell charcoal business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional charcoal to sell.

Ruby has been in this business for 4 years. 

In the future Ruby would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Santos De Jesús

texts.es:
Santos de 44 años de edad, no asistió a la escuela, pero cuando estuvo en el cuartel por 8 años, aprendió a leer y a escribir, la esposa hace petates y de sus hijos uno asiste a la escuela, mientras que el otro no; porque necesita educación especial, pero por la situación económica de la familia no lo puede hacer.

 Desde el 2007 trabaja como vigilante, aunque manifestó que su juventud la paso prestando servicio en el cuartel, cuando salió de ahí trabajo de cargador de materiales en camiones, luego trabajo en albañilería, trabajo que aun hace en sus tiempos libres.

El préstamo que esta solicitando, es para comprar maíz,  pues el precio va en aumento y para comprar tule para que trabaje sus esposa haciendo petates, y la otra parte para cancelar una deuda que tiene con la institución. 

Él sueña con que a su hijo enfermo le ayude una institución, para que se cure de su enfermedad, pero mientras tanto pretende apoyar a su otro hijo en el estudio y a futuro mejorar su casa, para darle mejores condiciones a su familia.
texts.en:
Santos, 44 years old, did not attend school, but when he was in the military for 8 years, he learned to read and write. His wife makes backpacks, and of his children one attends school, though the other does not, because he needs special education; however, due to the economic situation of the family they can't afford it.

Since 2007 he has worked as a watchman, though he expressed that he passed his youth paying service in the military. When he left, he worked as a truck freighter, then he later worked in masonry, work he still does in his free time.

The loan that he is asking is to buy corn, as the price is rising, and to buy tule, since his wife works making backpacks, and the rest to cancel a debt that he has with the institution.

He dreams that an institution will help his sick child, so that it cures him of his illness, but meanwhile intends to support his other son in his studies and improve his house in the future, to give better conditions to his family.

loans.use: to buy corn, as the price is rising, and to buy tule, since his wife works making backpacks, and the rest to pay off a debt that he has with the institution.

loans.name: Gloria Elizabeth

texts.es:
Gloria tiene 37 años de edad, estudió hasta 2º año de bachillerato, está acompañada y su pareja es empleado, tiene 2 hijos, de los cuales uno trabaja como comerciante vendiendo ropa, sus dos hijos viven con ella. 

Gloria vende ropa americana, tiene 7 años de dedicarse a este negocio, el trabajo lo aprendió por medio de una amiga, aparte de este negocio vende productos de belleza, ella tiene el local en su casa y en el mercado en donde vende ropa, trabaja de 7:00 am a 6:00 pm. 

Ella necesita el crédito para comprar ropa (blusas, camisas, pantalones, ropa interior) para surtir su negocio y así tener más ingresos para ella y su familia. 

Ella planea que su negocio crezca y que su familia tenga más ingresos y así tener una mejor condición de vida.
texts.en:
Gloria is 37 years old. She studied until the second year of a Bachelor's Degree. She is married and her significant other is employed. She has two kids, one of whom works in clothing sales. Both of her children live with her.

Gloria sells American clothing -- she has made a living doing this for seven years and learned about her work from a friend. Apart from this business, she sells beauty products. She has the shop in her house and at the market where she sells the clothing, and works from 7am until 6pm.

She needs the loan in order to buy clothes (blouses, shirts, pants, and underwear) to stock her business, and therefore earn more income for her and her family.

She plans for her business to grow, so her family with have more income and therefore have a better condition of life.

loans.use: to buy clothing (blouses, shirts, pants, and underwear) to stock her business, and therefore earn more income for her and her family.

loans.name: Isabel Alberto

texts.es:
Isabel tiene 26 años de edad, estudió hasta bachillerato, está acompañado y su pareja se dedica a las labores del hogar, tienen una hija que vive con ellos por lo que son dos personas las que dependen de el.

Isabel actualmente se dedica a trabajar en la agricultura y lo aprendió de sus padres desde que era  un niño, además trabaja como empleado de seguridad privada, lo hace en turnos de 24 horas y se traslada 15 kilómetros en bus para llegar.


El dinero del préstamo será utilizado para realizar otra siembra de cultivo.

Sus sueños son ver crecer a su hija y poder darle todo lo necesario para que sea una persona de bien, tener una casa propia pues actualmente vive en una propiedad de su suegro.
texts.en:
Isabel is 26 years old, studied until high school, and has a life partner who is engaged in household chores. They have a daughter who lives with them, making them the two people that the daughter depends on. 

Isabel is currently engaged in farm work that he learned from his parents since he was a child. He also works as a private security guard, in 24-hour shifts and has to travel 15 kilometers by bus to work.
.
The loan will be used for planting another crop. 

His dreams are to see his daughter grow and to be able to give her everything she needs to become a good person, to own his own home since he currently lives with his father-in-law.

loans.use: To plant another crop of corn.

loans.name: Marío Antonio

texts.es:
Mario de 70 años de edad, estudió hasta 2º grado, está casado y su pareja se dedica al comercio de verduras, con él vive su hijo que está estudiando. 

Él cliente se dedica a la agricultura y también a criar ganado, además tiene un automóvil, lo cual lo usa para hacer viajes a muchos lugares. 
Su horario de trabajo es de 6:00 am a 6:00 pm. 

El préstamo lo utilizará para invertir en sus trabajos agrícolas y para comprar cerdos. 

Él sueña con que su negocio crezca y que su cultivo se desarrollen en buen estado.
texts.en:
Mario is 70 years old. He studied until 2nd grade. He is married, and his partner makes a living in vegetable sales. His child, who is studying, lives with him.

He makes a living in agriculture, and also in raising cattle. In addition, he has an automobile, which he uses to take trips to many different places.

He works from 6am to 6pm. He will use the loan to invest in his agricultural work, and to buy cattle. He dreams that his business will grow, and that his crops will develop in good condition.

loans.use: to invest in his agricultural work and to buy pigs.

loans.name: José Santos

texts.es:
José de 43 años de edad, no estudio porque en ese entonces la escuela quedaba demasiado lejos y por el problema del conflicto armado. Sin embargo, se esforzó por aprender a leer y escribir y lo logro.

Está casado tienen una familia de 4 hijos, su esposa es ama de casa realiza los quehaceres del hogar, en su casa ya solo viven 3 hijos con él pero económicamente solo depende una.

José se dedica a la agricultura por más de 25 años, aprendió con su padre, camina 10 minutos para llegar a su lugar de trabajo todos los días fuertemente sin horario.  Su hijo le ayuda ocasionalmente, pero a pesar de eso él siempre se esfuerza por salir adelante y tener una vida mejor.

El préstamo que esta solicitando, es para comprar fertilizantes y pesticidas para aplicarlo a su cultivo de maíz en el momento más oportuno, también cancelara mano de obra que le ayudara a realizar las diferentes actividades que hay que hacer y así lograr una buena producción y tener alimento disponible para el consumo en su casa.

 Él espera a futuro obtener ganancias con esta inversión que realizara, cancelara el crédito y volverá a invertir en la próxima temporada agrícola, además desea que sus hijos se superen, que trabajen para que salgan adelante y que le ayuden para mejorar su vivienda, pues él también pondrá todo su empeño y juntos lo lograran.
texts.en:
José is 43 years old. He did not study as at that time school was too distant and the armed conflict was ongoing. However he managed to make the effort to learn to read and write, which he can now do. He is married and has four children. His wife does the housework. Only three of his children live with them and only one is economically dependent on him. José has worked in agriculture for more than 25 years, which he learned from his father. He walks 10 minutes to get to where he farms and he works hard with no timetable. His son helps him sometimes but in spite of this he always makes the effort to get ahead and have a better life.

The loan that he is requesting is to buy fertilizer and pesticide to apply to his corn crops at the opportune time. He also needs to pay for labor to help him carry out the various tasks that must be done to ensure a good harvest and to have food for the household's consumption. He hopes in the future to make a profit from this investment, pay off his debt and reinvest in the next agricultural season. He also wants his children to better themselves, that they work to get ahead and help him to make improvements on his house. He will also add his determination and together they will achieve this.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and pesticide.

loans.name: Milton Elias

texts.es:
Milton tiene 36 años de edad, no fue  escuela porque no le dieron esa oportunidad de estudiar, está acompañado y se esfuerza por apoyar a sus hijos para que vayan a la escuela.

Milton tiene mucha experiencia en la agricultura ya que desde muy joven trabajaba con sus padres, hoy en día él cultiva maíz y  puede manejar bien la actividad debido a que sabe como sos las diferentes etapas que el cultivo.


Él necesita el crédito para darle el mantenimiento a su cultivo ya que necesita darle una buena nutrición para que le genere buen rendimiento.


Sus planes a futuro son cultivar  mas maíz y sorgo para poder vender y que le genere mas ingresos para  ayudar a sus hijos con sus estudios a que saquen una carrera universitaria.
texts.en: Milton is 36 years old. He never attended school as he was never given the opportunity. He is married and makes an effort to support his children who go to school. Milton has much experience in agriculture as he worked with his parents since he was quite young. Today he grows corn and manages this activity well as he understands the different stages of it's growth. He needs a loan to provide maintenance for his crops as he needs to give them good nutrients so he can generate a good yield. His plans for the future are to plant more corn and sorghum to sell and generate more income. He wants to help his children with their studies so they can study at university.

loans.use: to assist his crops with the necessary maintenance.

loans.name: Rossellza

texts.en:
Rossellza is 57 years old and married with six children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF to buy items like shampoo, groceries, etc. to sell.

Rossellza has borrowed and repaid 10 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 3 years and also earns an income from fishing.

She aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items like shampoo, groceries, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Carlita

texts.en:
Carlita works hard to support her family. She is married, and has a weaving bamboo business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional bamboo to weave.

Carlita has been in this business for six years now.

In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional bamboo to weave

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a refrigerator to keep her fish fresh to attract more customers

loans.name: Peres

texts.en:
Peres is 29 years old, married to Lucy, and blessed with three children aged 22, 18 and 11 years. She has been selling clothes for the last five years, and earns a monthly income of KES.60,000 Kenyan Shillings (KES).
	 
She has applied for her second loan of 100,000 KES from VisionFund Kenya, and intends to use the loan amount to buy more stock of both new and second hand clothes to sell.

Peres will use the anticipated profits to provide for the family's basic needs. She hopes to grow her business and open a bigger boutique.

loans.use: to add more stock of both new and second hand clothes

loans.name: Edisa

texts.en:
Edisa is a thirty-six-year-old, hardworking, married woman living in Kamwenge, Uganda. She owns a carpentry workshop and sells furniture like chairs, tables and cupboards. She also earns extra income from agriculture. She has a challenge of inadequate capital to fully fund her business. She has ambitions of raising money to build a personal permanent house and buying a car.
 
She intends to use the loan to buy timber to ensure that in case of any orders she has the required materials.

loans.use: to buy timber to make furniture.

loans.name: Letecia

texts.en:
Letecia is 63 years old, a widow with eight children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

She has a food vending business in the Philippines. Letecia requested a PHP 22,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy additional ingredients like sugar, cooking oil, flour, etc.

Letecia has been in this business for 12 years. In the future, she would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional ingredients like sugar, cooking oil, flour, etc

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.en:
Yolanda is 58 years old and married with seven children. She works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines, and requested a PHP 24,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc.

Yolanda has been in this business for three years. 

In the future Yolanda would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy skirts, long pants, shorts, long and  short sleeve shirts

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase cement and bricks to renovate the house

loans.name: Mbuni Group

texts.en:
Tatu, who is in her early 30s, is a divorcee and has two schooling sons. She manages a grocery selling beers, sodas, water, and juices. She also sells fish oil, a business she has been with for one year and six months. Tatu works from 8am to midnight daily and is able to make a very good profit each month. 

This is her third loan request from Tujijenge Tanzania, which she will use to buy stock of beer, sodas, water, and juices. She used the previous loan, since repaid, to start her grocery business (bought tables, chairs, crates of beers and sodas). She made a profit, part of which she used to cover school fees and part of which she plowed back into her businesses. Tatu is so proud to be with Kiva. She believes her business will grow and that she will be able to build a house. 

She will share this loan with her loan group "Mbuni," which consists of seven members. The group members will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy stock of beer, sodas, water and juices.

loans.name: Jhoana Paula

texts.en:
Jhoana Paula is 19 years old, the third daughter of Elsa. She is taking up a Bachelor of Science in Business Administration, and wants to become a successful businesswoman someday. Her mother is a vegetable vendor, while her father is a construction worker. The family only acquires minimal income that is why she is now asking for an educational loan of P6,000 to pay for her tuition fees and daily allowances. 

This will help her continue her education and achieve her dreams for her family.

loans.use: to pay for tuition fees and daily allowances

loans.name: Salome

texts.en: Salome is 47 years old, married and has two children. Her eldest child, Jocelyn, is taking up an Agricultural Engineering course and is currently in her first year of college. Salome only relies on income in the farming business, while her spouse is a government employee. Salome is now asking for a loan of PHP 10,000 to pay for the tuition fees and allowances of her child. This will definitely help give a good education to her child.

loans.use: to pay for tuition fees and allowances for her child.

loans.name: Sherly

texts.en:
Sherly is married with five children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Sherly is 39 years old, and has five children who are in school.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines. Sherly requested a PHP 13,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase an additional bundle of fishing net.

Sherly has been in this business for 12 years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase an additional bundle of fishing net

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en:
Nenita works hard to support her family. Nenita is married and has a fishing business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional fishing net and other fishing materials.

Nenita has been in this business for 6 years now.

In the future Nenita would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional fishing net and other fishing materials.

loans.name: Fe

texts.en:
Fe works hard to support her family. She is married and has a fishing business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy materials needed for the maintenance of her boat.

Fe has been in this business for seven years now.

In the future, Fe would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy materials needed for the maintenance of her boat

loans.name: Carlota

texts.en:
A $800 loan is offered to Carlota to improve her business. Carlota opened her kiosk in 2008 with her own working capital of $ 500. 

She will use the loan to buy stock to keep in her store like noodles, bread, body lotion, shampoo, shop, fish and cigarettes. She is generating a good income from selling.

She has been thinking of running a big business after years of involving herself in doing business. Carlota is living in a town with her family.

loans.use:
To buy noodles, bread, body lotion, shampoo, shop,
fish and cigarettes

loans.name: Marjorie Vanessa

texts.es:
Marjorie es una mujer joven de 20 años de edad, soltera sin hijos, su ocupación es la venta de ropa y sus estudios superiores.
Ella es de carácter sociable, comunicativa, amable sencilla, humilde, honesta, trabajadora, emprendedora, luchadora y muy trabajadora, su negocio lo realiza en la feria; ‘las mañaneras de la Tumusla’, esta feria se realiza en inmediaciones de las calles: Tumusla, Buenos Aires, Garcilaso de la Vega, Isaac Tamayo, Illampu, Graneros, Murillo y pasaje Ortega, los vendedores ya están arribando desde las cinco de la mañana y ofrecen sus productos a partir de esa hora hasta las nueve de la mañana.
Marjorie es de tez morena, cabello negro largo, estatura mediana, su rutina diaria comienza a las cuatro de la madrugada para llegar a su puesto de venta (cargada de diversas prendas de vestir para niños) a las cinco. Sus clientes llegan de ciudades vecinas para comprar por docenas; cuyas tallas, diseños y colores atraen la atención de todo tipo de familias. A las nueve de la mañana  ella y los demás comerciantes deben abandonar las calles para dar paso a la apertura de las galerías comerciales. Marjorie cargada de sus prendas se dirige a su depósito, acomoda y guarda todo, y esta vez sale cargada de su material escolar con rumbo a la universidad a continuar con sus estudios superiores. Ella sueña terminar su carrera profesional para encontrar un trabajo y ayudar a su familia, para lograrlo necesita una computadora laptop para poder estudiar y terminar sus estudios.
Es por esos motivos que Marjorie solicita un préstamo para la compra de una computadora laptop para terminar sus estudios y ayudar a su familia.
texts.en:
Marjorie is a young adult of 20 years, single, and without children. Her jobs are clothing sales, and college studies.

She is of sociable character, communicative, genuinely friendly, humble, honest, hard-working, entrepreneurial, a fighter and a very hard worker; she created her business in the fair: "Las Mañaneras de la Tumusla." This fair is performed in the nearby streets: Tumusla, Buenos Aires, Garcilaso de la Vega, Isaac Tamayo, Illampu, Graneros, Murillo y pasaje Ortega. The vendors begin arriving at 5 in the morning and offer their products from then until 9AM.

She is of a swarthy complexion, with long black hair and medium build. Her daily routine starts at 4 in the morning to arrive at her selling post (full of different types of clothing for children) at 5. Her customers come from neighboring cities to buy by the dozens; her sizes, designs, and colors attract the attention of all types of families. At 9 in the morning, she and the other vendors must leave the streets to give way for the opening of the shopping malls. Marjorie, laden with her garments, goes directly to make her deposit; she keeps and saves everything, and now goes forth with her school supplies and university courses to finish her higher education. She hopes to finish her professional career to find a job and help her family, for which she needs a laptop computer to be able to study and complete her education.

It is for these reasons that Marjorie asks a loan to buy a laptop computer to finish her studies and help her family.

loans.use: to buy a laptop to finish her studies and help her family.

loans.name: Rina

texts.en:
Rina, 27, is a young and active housewife. She is married to Aabiul, and together they are raising their only daughter, who reads in grade three. Rina didn't have the economic resources to finish school. With a lot of sacrifice, she was barely able to finish ninth grade. They live in their own kachha house (made of bamboo, mud and straw) in a small village, South Jhumurpara .

Rina's husband is engaged in a small business, and Rina helps him arduously to get their daughter ahead. As Rina's husband has an inconsistent income, it has become difficult for them to run the family in a better way. Rina is a woman with strong determination. She wants to go ahead and earn income for the family. 

Rina is associated with a jute business. She purchases raw jute from farmers and sells it to her neighbors and in the market to those who prepare jute handicrafts items such as bags, table mats, etc. She is now a great source of income for the family. She is very enterprising and enthusiastic. Rina has applied for a loan from BJS to purchase more jute to increase her business.

Her dream for the future is to expand her business so she earns more profit, and to improve the quality of life of her family. She also aspires to construct a better and concrete-made house for them.

She gives her thanks to BJS and Kiva.

loans.use: to purchase more jute for her business.

loans.name: Melecio

texts.en:
Melecio is 46 years old and a farmer, living at Solana with his family. He plants and harvests rice to sell. 

He wanted to improve his farming output, but had insufficient funds to buy fertilizers, pesticides and insecticides to use in farming. So, he is asking for PHP 15,000 to buy these farm inputs. 

If he will gain good profit, he will save it for education expenses.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, pesticides and insecticides to use in farming.

loans.name: Maria Luz

texts.en:
Maria Luz is 51 years old, married and had two children. She and her spouse are farmers, planting and harvesting rice to sell. The income generated was used as revolving capital in the business and for school expenses. She usually gains minimal income from the business, but she still hopes for a good harvest every harvest season. 

She is now asking for additional capital of PHP 20,000 to buy fertilizers and insecticides to use in farming. This will help maintain good crop growth and nutrition. 

Someday, Maria Luz hopes to achieve a profitable harvest to save for her family's future expenses.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and insecticides to use in farming.

loans.name: Nora

texts.en: Nora, aged 38, is married to a farmer and blessed with two children. She has managed a hog raising business in their village for almost three years, earning a net income of PHP 5,000 for every hog that she sells. Her net income from this business is usually spent on their daily expenses. Nora is asking for a loan amounting to PHP 10,000 to purchase hog feed and hogs to raise. She's hoping that her business will continue to grow and become more productive.

loans.use: To purchase hog feed and hogs to raise.

loans.name: Moriel

texts.en: Moriel lives at Enrile, Cagayan with her husband and three children. She gets income by selling food for daily meals and snacks at the school canteen while her husband is a driver. She divides her income for meals, bills at home and education expenses. She is now asking for educational loan of P6,000 to pay the tuition fees and daily allowances of her second child, Jollybeth, who is a freshman student taking up Bachelor of Science in Information Technology. Jollybeth aims to finish her course so she will get stable job someday.

loans.use: to pay tuition fees and daily allowance for her child

loans.name: Richelle

texts.en:
Richelle is 27 years old and married with two children.  With one child in school, Richelle works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc.

Richelle has been in this business for 3 years. 

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Na'aem 26 Group

texts.en:
This group is called Na'aem 26 . It consists of four women. They all live in traditional and simple families in Taiz, Yemen. They know one another through friendship and neighborhood connections. They applied for a loan of 280,000 YER from AMB. 
Na'aem is a 59-year-old married woman and a mother of four children. She is the leader of the group. Na'aem lives with her children in their own house. She is an uneducated woman and works a s a housewife. She is very dynamic and vigorous. Na'aem lives in a very small house and most of it is not renovated from the inside. As a result, Na'aem is requesting a loan of 80,000 YER from AMB. She will use the loan to purchase construction materials such as cement, bricks, and steel in order to add other rooms for make the house more spacious and comfortable. 

Na'aem 's dream in the future is building more of one floor and renovating. She hopes to send her children to a private school.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials such as cement, bricks, and steel in order to add other rooms to her house

loans.name: Luzviminda

texts.en:
Luzviminda is 60 years old and married with five children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15000 loan through NWTF to purchase items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc.

Luzviminda has borrowed and repaid 3 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running her general store for 3 years and also earns an income from food vending.

She aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Amelia

texts.en:
Amelia is 31 years old and married with one child.

She earns a living by pig fattening in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Amelia has been pig fattening for four years and also earns additional income from buying and selling rice.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Noraida

texts.en:
Noraida works hard to support her family. She is married and has a business making dried fish in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional fish to make dried fish.

Noraida has been in this business for 11 years now.

In the future, Noraida would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional fish to make dried fish

loans.name: Tessie

texts.en:
Tessie works hard to support her family. She is married and has a butcher meat business in the Philippines. Tessie has been in this business for 20 years now.

She requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional meat to sell.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional meat to sell

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
Emma is 53 years old and has seven children. She is married and has five children who are in school.

She is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. Emma requested a PHP 8,000 loan through NWTF to purchase sacks of feed and vitamins for her pig.

Emma has been raising pigs for eight years now, and has borrowed five times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Emma would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of feed and vitamins for her pig

loans.name: Angeline

texts.en:
Angeline is a 21-year-old lady, married and blessed with one child who is three years old. Angeline has been running a retail shop for the last two years and gets a monthly income of KES 15,000.

She has applied for her first loan of KES 15,000 from Vision Fund Kenya which she will use to buy more stock of flour, sweets, and washing detergents for sale .She paid her previous loan successfully.

Angeline will use the anticipated profits to provide for the family's basic needs and in the future to grow her business and be financially stable.

loans.use: to add more stock of flour, sweets, and washing detergents

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay for his upcoming semester fees

loans.name: Vengie

texts.en:
Vengie works hard to support her family and has a business buying and selling vegetables in the Philippines. Vengie has been in this business for 10 years now.

She requested a PHP 6,000 loan through NWTF to buy vegetables to sell in her food stall.

In the future, Vengie would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy vegetables to sell in her food stall

loans.name: Lyakisana Mixed Farmers Group

texts.en: Amos is an agriculturalist who does both farming and animal rearing on a small scale. He supplements the agriculture through selling agricultural produce. He needs the loan to buy cow dung that he will use to spread onto his plantation along with mulches so that he can improve the productivity of his crops. He is hardworking and hopes he will break through financially with this continuous financial boost. He thanks the Kiva lenders for supporting their group.

loans.use: to buy cow dung and mulch

loans.name: Marivic

texts.en: Marivic lives in Solana with her spouse and three children. She operates a store for income. She sells grocery items such as canned goods, noodles and eggs. She is now asking for a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy shampoo, soap, sugar, coffee and biscuits to sell. It will help improve her sales and income. She hopes to keep improving her income for the overall welfare of her family.

loans.use: to buy shampoo, soap, sugar, coffee and biscuits to sell

loans.name: Nason

texts.en:
Nason is a 33-year-old married man with eight children living in Kasese, Uganda. 

He has been in the retail business for fourteen years, and has been farming as additional income. He started his business to become rich and to provide for his family. 

He hopes to expand his business and educate his children to higher levels. He is acquiring a loan to buy soap, cooking oil, and salt to sell.

loans.use: to buy soap, cooking oil, and salt to sell.

loans.name: Jovie Marie

texts.en:
Jovie Marie works hard to support her family. She is married and has a business buying and selling ready to wear in the Philippines. She has been in this business for three years now.

She requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items like shirts, pants, etc., to sell.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional items like shirts, pants, etc., to sell

loans.name: Mark

texts.en:
Mark lives in Masindi, Uganda. He is an education provider. He started the school so as to support the community with education and self employment. He hopes to introduce a vocational training centre. However, limited capital hinders the expansion of his business.

He wants a loan to buy computers for use by his students.

loans.use: to buy computers.

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David lives in Masindi, Uganda. He sells electronics and phone accessories. He does farming as an additional income. He hopes to build a permanent home however he is challenged with inadequate capital.

David wants a loan to buy phones, phone accessories and electronics to sell.

loans.use: to buy phones, phone accessories and electronics to sell.

loans.name: Wadha

texts.en:
Wadha is a 21-year-old lady living in Mafraq, Jordan, with her family consisting of 12 members. She is a university student majoring in Class Teaching, and she is in her third year. Her father sells clothes. 

She is planning to work in her study field after graduation so that she can support her family financially, but she doesn't have enough money to pay for her upcoming semester fees. For that reason, she has applied for this loan.

loans.use: To pay her upcoming semester fees

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more beverages, seasonings, snack foods, canned goods, noodles, assorted candies, biscuits, laundry soaps, and soft drinks to resell

loans.name: Beleida

texts.es: Beleida, tiene la edad  de 42  años, está casada, vive con el esposo y dos hijos que son su mayor prioridad. Con su crédito pretende hacer la compra de ropa para su posterior venta .Ella pretende comprar mercaderia en cantidad para que le salga mas barata y poder octener mas ganancias y seguir creciendo con el proyecto  y así mejorar las condiciones de vida de su Familia y también cumplir algunas metas.  Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. Élla no había tenido  antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en: Beleida is 42 years old and married. She lives with her husband and two children, who are her greatest priority in life. With the loan, she aims to purchase clothing to sell later on. She aims to purchase merchandise in bulk so that it will be cheaper for her and so she can obtain greater profits and continue with her work, thereby improving her family’s living conditions and achieving some goals. This is the first loan she has received from FUDECOSUR. She has not had any other loans with state banks, but FUDECOSUR has offered her the loan with better terms and a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to buy clothing

location.town: El Ceibo, San Vito, Coto Brus

loans.name: Nanie

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Nanie works hard to support her family.

She has a buy and sell ready to wear business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from her general store.  Nanie is borrowing PHP 14000 through NWTF to buy additional stock to sell for her buy and sell ready to wear business.

Nanie has been sustaining her business activities through her past 3 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: buy additional stock to sell

loans.name: Rowena

texts.en: Rowena is 32 years old and married with two children who are in school. Rowena works very hard to provide for them. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a 20,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy items to sell such as shampoo, groceries, etc. Rowena has been in this business for two years. In the future she would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell such as shampoo, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Nena

texts.en: Nena is 56 years old and married with seven children. She works very hard to provide for them. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase items to sell such as noodles, eggs, milk, soap, shampoo, etc. Nena has been in this business for 23 years. In the future, she would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to purchase items to sell such as noodles, eggs, milk, soap, shampoo, etc.

loans.name: Ermelina

texts.en: Ermelina is 56 years old and married with four children. She works very hard to provide for them. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc.  Ermelina has been in this business for 20 years.  She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Melva

texts.en:
Melva is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a business selling dried fish in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 21,000 through NWTF in order to buy more fish, to make dried fish. Melva successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

NWTF is re-listing Melva's business profile  in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more fish to make dried fish.

loans.name: Edmond

texts.en: Edmond is a forty three year old married man with ten children, only four go to school. He trades in cocoa and has been in the business for 15 years. He is a hard workingman whose dreams are to build a residential house for his family and educate his children in better schools. He is challenged with weather changes and transport costs for his cocoa .He wants a loan to buy cocoa for resale.

loans.use: To buy cocoa for resale

loans.name: Seda

texts.en:
Seda is a young farmer from Sardarapat village. 
She lives there with her husband and three children. Seda is mainly involved in land cultivation. She cultivates wheat, sunflower and grass. Seda also owns a grape orchard which she maintains with great care. 
The requested loan of USD 2000 is important for her to purchase fertilizer and hire workers for cultivation.

loans.use: to pay for fertilizer and hire workers for cultivation

loans.name: Beatrace

texts.en:
Beatrace is a thirty eight year old hardworking single woman living in Kamwenge, Uganda. She runs a restaurant as her main source of income alongside rental ownership. She faces a challenge of scarcity of resources to buy more food for sell. She has hopes of completing her rentals.  

She intends to use the loan to finish up her rentals.

loans.use: to finish up her rentals.

loans.name: Junither

texts.en:
Hello Kiva lenders! Meet Junither, a 27-year-old mother who is very hardworking, ambitious and self-motivated. She lives in the Siongiroi area of Kenya - a very remote place - but blessed with beautiful weather patterns and climate. This area is very green, making it beautiful and a place you will stay. Junither is married and has three beautiful children who she always refers to as "her pride” because they are a source of joy to her. That is why she is keen on letting them have a brighter future and a comfortable life. 

Junither practices mixed farming - that is, crop and animal farming - and has been doing that for the past ten years. She has all the farming techniques at her finger tips. Junither's heart is in dairy farming as she is passionate about dairy farming and has even nicknamed one of her cows 'Keroi'. There is so much demand for milk in the Siongiroi area, but the supply is low. To meet the demand, Junither plans to increase her milk production by buying a dairy cow. She is faced with financial challenges, but knowing that partners such as Juhudi Kilimo (via Kiva) are there makes her feel relieved and she knows her dreams will be achieved. 

Junither expressed that “in five years, I want to make more money for myself and my family." With this loan, Junither is well on her way to achieving this dream. Junither also wishes to have more consistent income so that she can buy more dairy cows and be self-sufficient.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Emannuel

texts.en:
Emmanuel lives in Masindi, Uganda. He is married with two children. He does crop farming and also sells clothes .He started the business to cater for the family needs. Inadequate capital and weather changes affect his business.

He wants a loan to cultivate land and prepare for the coming season.

loans.use: to cultivate land and prepare for the coming season.

loans.name: Erlyn

texts.en:
Erlyn is 34 years old and married with five children. With three children in school, Erlyn works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to buy items like shampoo, groceries, etc. to sell.

Erlyn has been in this business for 3 years. 

In the future Erlyn would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items like shampoo, groceries, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Beatriz

texts.en: Beatriz is 59 years old, married and has eight children. Two of her children are in school. She is in the agricultural business of pig fattening in the Philippines. Beatriz has requested a 15,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs. Beatriz has been pig fattening for 10 years now, and has borrowed 17 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Om- Yaser Group

texts.en:
This group is called Om- Yaser. It consists of four ladies who live in Hodeidah, Yemen. They applied for a loan of 110,000 YER from AMB. 

Asma is a hardworking woman. She is a 24-year-old married woman with only one child of five years. She is the leader of the group. In order to help her husband with the expenses of the family, Asma decided to work in sewing and sell ready-made women's clothes. She started her business with small capital one year ago. She works with a few sewing machines and now she wants to improve her business by purchasing more of one sewing machine. Unfortunately, she doesn't have enough money to do that. For this reason, she has applied for a loan of 30,000 YER from AMB for purchase a sewing machine to enlarge her business. Asma looks forward to expanding her business more in order to establish a better future for her child.

loans.use: to purchase a sewing machine to enlarge her business.

loans.name: George

texts.en:
George, a married man with three children, operates a cattle trade business in rural Lyantonde. He has been able to provide for his family using income generated from cattle trade. He supplements the income with sale of milk.

He is grateful that Ugafode has supported him through his venture and is committed to paying well such that he can maintain the partnership. George is a hard working and resilient man who believes in hard work to achieve success.

loans.use: to buy cattle.

loans.name: Annabelle

texts.en:
Annabelle is 47 years old and married with five children. She earns a living by raising livestock in the Philippines. Annabelle is borrowing PHP 14,000 through NWTF to buy additional livestock to raise.

Annabelle has been raising livestock for 20 years and also earns additional income from a general store. She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream, to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional livestock to raise.

loans.name: Tiberius

texts.en: Tiberius is a 35-year-old hardworking, married man with six children aged 16, 13, 11, and 3 years living in Kamwenge, Uganda. He deals in produce, selling coffee as his main source of income, though he also practices farming where he earns an extra income. He started this business to sustain his family and have a better standard of living. He faces challenges of competition, price fluctuations, and weather changes that affect his produce business. He has a vision of owning a big, modern produce store and having educated children. He is requesting a loan to buy more coffee to sell.

loans.use: to buy more coffee to sell.

loans.name: Milton

texts.en: Milton is a hardworking and resilient agriculturalist who lives in rural western Uganda. He has lived all his life among cattle keepers, and therefore has gained experience in the business. He has done this business for 15 years now and it has helped him to put bread on his family's table. Milton wants to expand the business, but has a challenge of limited capital. He has therefore approached one of UGAFODE branches to get a loan, so that he can buy cattle that he will fatten and later sell at a profit. Milton thanks Kiva lenders for coming to his aid, and he will do all it takes to maintain a good record to his name.

loans.use: to buy cattle.

loans.name: Emelygilda

texts.en: Emelygilda hopes to earn a degree and help lift her family out of poverty someday. She is 18 years old, and a second year college student taking up a Bachelor of Science in Information Technology. Emelygilda is the youngest child among five siblings. Her father is a farmer, while her mother is engaged in laundry services for income. She is now asking for a loan of PHP 10,000 to pay for tuition fees, allowances, and a uniform. This loan will help her to continue her education and achieve her dreams in life.

loans.use: to pay for tuition fees, allowances, and a uniform.

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en:
Rosalinda works hard to support her family. She is married and has a buy and sell flower business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional bundles of flowers to sell.  Rosalinda has been in this business for 14 years now.

In the future, Rosalinda would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional bundles of flowers to sell.

loans.name: Rhea

texts.en:
