Rhea is 30 years old and married with two children who are both in school.  She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy more groceries to sell.

Rhea has borrowed and repaid twelve loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for six years and also earns an income from fish vending. Rhea aspires to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Susana

texts.en:
Susana is 34 years old and has six children. Susana is married, and four children of her children are in school.

She is in the agricultural business of pig fattening in the Philippines. Susana requested a 14,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Susana has been pig fattening for three years now, and has borrowed three times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Susana would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Leonila

texts.en: Leonila is 61 years old and married with five children. She works very hard to provide for them.  She runs a buy and sell charcoal business in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of charcoal to sell. Leonila has been in this business for 26 years. In the future, Leonila would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Alima

texts.en: Alima is 43 years old and married with six children.  With three children in school, Alima works very hard to provide for them. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to purchase items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc.  Alima has been in this business for two years.  In the future, Alima would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Miguel

texts.es: Miguel, tiene la edad de 20 años, está soltero, vive con sus padres y que son su mayor prioridad. Con su crédito pretende hacer la compra de fertilizantes, fungicidas  además de comprar algunas plantas de almácigo para hacer resiembras a inicio de lluvias esto con el objetivo de aumentar la densidad de plantas por área, además  espera obtener un poco de ganancias y así mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia.  Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. Él no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Miguel, 20, is single and lives with his parents, who are his main priority.  With his loan, he plans to purchase fertilizers and fungicides, and also to buy some seedlings to replant at the start of the rainy season.  This way, he can increase the density of his plants.  He hopes to thereby obtain some extra earnings so that he can improve his family's living conditions.  

This is the first loan that Miguel has received from FUDECOSUR.  He never took loans from the state banks, but FUDECOSUR has provided him with a loan with better payment terms and a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to buy seedlings

loans.name: Nasr Allah 5 Group

texts.en:
This group is called Nasr Allah 5. It consists of four hardworking women from Hodeidah, Yemen. They have requested a group loan of 240,000 YER (Yemen rials) from AMB, and they will hold each other accountable for the loan repayment.

Najla is a very active woman from a poor family. She is 32 years old and a mother of three children. She is the leader of the group. Her husband was the sole breadwinner of the family. Over time, he became unable to look after his family. Najla wanted to help him in this responsibility. She has sold women's clothes door to door with a small amount of capital for one year. Her income from this business is modest, and she wants to improve it more. Most of what she earns goes to the expenses of her family. On the other hand, she wants to improve it. For this reason, Najla asked a loan of 60,000 YER from AMB for the purchase more women's clothes to resell to her customers.

Najla looks forward to expanding her business more. She hopes to save a lot of money in order make a secure future for her children.

loans.use: to purchase more women's clothes to resell them to her customers.

loans.name: Cristina

texts.en: Cristina is 52 years old, married, and manages a farming business for income. They plant and harvest rice to sell to traders. Though they only generate minimal income from the business, they still work hard to achieve good profits. To ensure good crop production, she needs to give enough sustenance to farm inputs. Cristina is now asking for a loan of PHP 20,000 to buy fertilizers, herbicides, and pesticides used in farming. She hopes to gain profitable harvest. She will save additional income for her family's future expenses.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, herbicides and pesticides used in farming.

loans.name: Mary Joy

texts.en:
Mary Joy lives with her parents at Enrile, Cagayan. She is the eldest child among four siblings. Her mother raises hogs to sell for income, while her father is a construction worker. 

Mary Joy is taking up Technical Teacher Education. She is now a third-year student. Her family has insufficient funds to sustain her education, thus she is now asking for 5,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) to pay for her tuition fees. 

She hopes to finish her education and become successful so she will help her family someday.

loans.use: to pay for tuition fees

loans.name: Mercedita

texts.en:
Mercedita is married, and she works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines. Mercedita is borrowing 30,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) through NWTF in order to buy a new engine for her fishing boat for her fishing business.

Mercedita has been sustaining her business activities through her past 19 loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy a new engine for her fishing boat.

loans.name: Berta Elida

texts.es:
Berta de 58 años de edad,  es una persona muy trabajadora, no estudio ya que sus padres  no tenían las condiciones para enviarlo a estudiar y también por motivos del conflicto armado. Es casada su esposo trabaja en la agricultura,  tiene tres hijos de los cuales 2 viven con ellos y trabajan en el campo junto a su padre.

Berta trabaja en su hogar en crianza de gallinas, cerdos entre otras, sus hijos le ayudan cuando no van a trabajar al campo, tienen más de 20 años de dedicarse a estas actividades trabajan todos los días, no tienen un horario establecido.

El préstamo que esta solicitando a CREDICAMPO,  es para comprar bloque, cemento, hierro, etc para construir su casa de bloque, ya que la actual es de tierra. Con lo que mejorara su calidad de vida, ya que vivirán mejor y más seguros con su familia, ella quiere que sus hijos progresen y que cuando formen una familia puedan tener un terreno y una casa donde vivan bien.
texts.en:
Berta is 58 years old and is a very hardworking. She had no schooling since her parents lacked the means and also due to the armed conflict.

She is married. Her husband works in agriculture. They have three children, two of whom work in the field with their father.


Bertha works at home raising chickens and pigs, among other things; her children help her when they don't have to work the fields.

They have over 20 years doing these activities and they don't have a set schedule.

The loan they are requesting from CREDICAMPO is for buying cinderblocks, cement, irons, etc. since their current home is built from earth. With this they will improve their living standards live better and feel safer with their family.

She wants her children to get ahead and once they form their own families that they own a piece of land and their own homes.

loans.use: buy cinder blocks, cement, irons to build a brick house since her current house is made out of earth.

loans.name: Boyet

texts.en: Boyet is 27 years old, married, and they have two children. Boyet is a farmer, planting and harvesting rice to sell. He needs to gain a good harvest in order to save funds for his family and to use in the business. He had insufficient funds, and that is why he is asking for a loan of PHP 25,000 to buy fertilizers and insecticides used in farming. This will help to maintain good crops and to avoid insects that will destroy his crops. He hopes to gain a fruitful harvest and to pay back his loan on time.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and insecticides used in farming.

loans.name: Ma. Corazon

texts.en:
Ma. Corazon is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fish vending business in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF in order to buy more fish to sell to customers.  She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

NWTF is re-listing Ma. Corazon's business profile in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell.

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en:
Catherine is 33 years old and married with three children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 12,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc.

Catherine has borrowed and paid four loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for three years and also earns an income from farming vegetables.

She aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Melvin Jose

texts.es: Melvin José mayor de edad casado con dos hijos menores de edad aun bajo su responsabilidad originario del municipio de Chinandega ubicado en el occidente del país,zona que se caracteriza por ser productivamente comercial y turística, es un microempresario y administrador de una hermosa pulperia ubicado en su casa de habitación donde ofrece todo tipo de productos de consumo del hogar como: arroz, frijoles, azúcar, aceite, detergentes, productos congelados, gaseosas, pan, huevos, golosinas, papel higiénicos, fósforos, salsas de tomates, tomates, cebollas, sopas maggis, toallas sanitarias, bolsitas de shampoo, cremas, medicamentos, jabón, sardinas entre otros productos mas, sus compras y sus ventas son al contado tiene clientes fijos y eventuales, Melvin se caracteriza por ser un hombre trabajador, honrado, responsable y con muchos deseos de  superación personal,  inicia su negocio con fondos propios como un medio de poder sacar adelante a su familia, el cual poco a poco y con los financiamiento ha logrado tener esta hermosa pulperia, el cual le ha permitido mejorar un poco sus ingresos económicos, uno de sus sueños es poder algún día terminar sus estudios, y brindarle una mejor vida económica a su familia, tambien el ver a sus hijos formados en una carrera profesional, terminar de realizarles mejoras a su vivienda, el objetivo de este nuevo financiamiento es para invertir en capital de trabajo e surtir su inventario en la compra de productos de consumo del hogar como: arroz, frijoles, golosinas, aceite, detergentes, productos congelados, productos perecederos, medicamentos entre otros mas. Melvin agradece mucho el apoyo que los inversionistas kivas les ofrece a personas de bajos recursos económicos.-
texts.en:
Melvin José is an adult who is married and has two young children who he still takes care of. He is from the municipality of Chinandega, located in the western part of the country, an area known for commerce and tourism. He is a small-business owner and manager of a lovely grocery store located in his home. He offers all types of products that are consumed at home, such as rice, beans, sugar, oil, detergent, frozen food, soda, bread, eggs, snacks, toilet paper, matches, tomato sauce, tomatoes, onions, Maggi soups, sanitary napkins, little bags of shampoo, lotion, medicine, soap, sardines, and other products. His purchases and sales are made in cash and he has regular and occasional customers. 

Melvin is known for being a hardworking, honest, and responsible man with a great desire for self-improvement. He started his business with his own funds as a way to support his family. Little by little and with loans, he has managed to have this lovely grocery store, which has allowed him to improve his income a bit. One of his dreams is to be able to finish his studies one day and to provide a better economic life for his family. He also wants to see his children educated in a career and to finish making improvements to his home. The aim of this new loan is to invest in working capital and stock his inventory by purchasing products that are consumed at home, such as rice, beans, snacks, oil, detergent, frozen food, perishables, and medicine, among other items. Melvin is very grateful for the support that Kiva lenders offer to people with a low income.

loans.use: to invest in working capital and to stock his inventory by purchasing products for his grocery store, such as staple grains, frozen food, snacks, sodas, detergent, perishables, and medicine, among other items.
